target: Àkéréjùlọ abẹ́lé jẹ́ ojú níbi tí iye ìfà kéré ju ti àwọn ojú tímọ́.

source: A global maximum is the highest point on the entire function.
target: Àgbàjùlọ akáríayé jẹ́ ojú gíga jùlọ lórí gbogbo ìfà náà.

source: A global minimum is the lowest point on the entire function.
target: Àkéréjùlọ akáríayé jẹ́ ojú kéré jùlọ lórí gbogbo ìfà náà.

source: An even function satisfies f(-x) = f(x) for all x in its domain.
target: Ìfà onírúurú mú f(-x) = f(x) ṣẹ fún gbogbo x nínú àdúgbò rẹ̀.

source: An odd function satisfies f(-x) = -f(x) for all x in its domain.
target: Ìfà òrìtú mú f(-x) = -f(x) ṣẹ fún gbogbo x nínú àdúgbò rẹ̀.

source: A complex number has the form a + bi, where a and b are real numbers and i is the imaginary unit.
target: Òòkà àdàpọ̀ ní ọ̀nà a + bi, níbi tí a àti b jẹ́ àwọn òòkà gidi àti i jẹ́ ẹ̀yà àfojúró.

source: The absolute value of a number is its distance from zero on the number line.
target: Iye ajukájú òòkà kan jẹ́ ìjìnnà rẹ̀ láti òdo lórí ìlà-òòkà.

source: The factorial of a non-negative integer n, denoted n!, is the product of all positive integers less than or equal to n.
target: Ìṣesí òòkà odidi aláìdọ́wọ́lé n, tí a fì àmì hàn n!, jẹ́ ìsọdipúpọ̀ gbogbo àwọn òòkà odidi dáradára tí ó kéré ju tàbí dọ́gba pẹ̀lú n.

source: A permutation is an arrangement of a set of objects in a specific order.
target: Àtòsípo jẹ́ ìtò ìtò àwọn nkan ní ṣíṣe pàtó.

source: A combination is a selection of objects from a set without regard to order.
target: Àdàpọ̀ jẹ́ àṣàyàn àwọn nkan láti ìtò kan láìsí ìfẹ̀sẹ̀ sí ṣíṣe.

source: A sequence is an ordered list of numbers.
target: Ìtẹ̀lé jẹ́ àkọjọ àwọn òòkà tí a tò.

source: An arithmetic sequence has a common difference between consecutive terms.
target: Ìtẹ̀lé ìṣirò ní ìyàtọ̀ àjọṣe láàrín àwọn ẹ̀yà tó tẹ̀lé ara wọn.

source: A geometric sequence has a common ratio between consecutive terms.
target: Ìtẹ̀lé àjé ní ìbùpín àjọṣe láàrín àwọn ẹ̀yà tó tẹ̀lé ara wọn.

source: A recursively defined sequence has each term defined in terms of one or more previous terms.
target: Ìtẹ̀lé aṣàfihàn atẹyìnpadà ní ẹ̀yà kọ̀ọ̀kan tí a ṣàlàyé ní ọ̀nà ẹ̀yà kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ tẹ́lẹ̀.

source: A Fibonacci sequence is defined by F₀ = 0, F₁ = 1, and Fₙ = Fₙ₋₁ + Fₙ₋₂ for n > 1.
target: Ìtẹ̀lé Fíbónáṣì ni a ṣàlàyé bíi F₀ = 0, F₁ = 1, àti Fₙ = Fₙ₋₁ + Fₙ₋₂ fún n > 1.

source: The binomial theorem gives the expansion of (a + b)ⁿ.
target: Òfin ìdálẹ́jì fún wa ní ìgbóróṣẹ (a + b)ⁿ.

source: A set is a collection of distinct objects.
target: Ìtò jẹ́ àkójọ àwọn nkan ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

source: The union of two sets A and B, denoted A ∪ B, contains all elements that are in A or B or both.
target: Àpapọ̀ àwọn ìtò méjì A àti B, tí a fì àmì hàn A ∪ B, ní gbogbo àwọn èròjà tí ó wà nínú A tàbí B tàbí méjèèjì.

source: The intersection of two sets A and B, denoted A ∩ B, contains all elements that are in both A and B.
target: Ìpàdé àwọn ìtò méjì A àti B, tí a fì àmì hàn A ∩ B, ní gbogbo àwọn èròjà tí ó wà nínú A àti B.

source: The complement of a set A, denoted A', contains all elements in the universal set that are not in A.
target: Àkúnlé ìtò A, tí a fì àmì hàn A', ní gbogbo àwọn èròjà nínú ìtò àkáríayé tí kò sí nínú A.

source: The empty set, denoted ∅, contains no elements.
target: Ìtò òfìfo, tí a fì àmì hàn ∅, kò ní èròjà kankan.

source: A Venn diagram is a graphical representation of sets.
target: Àwòrán Vẹ́nù jẹ́ àfihàn àwọrán àwọn ìtò.

source: A relation is a set of ordered pairs.
target: Ìbátan jẹ́ ìtò àwọn ìwọ̀n tí a tò.

source: The domain of a relation is the set of all first components of its ordered pairs.
target: Àdúgbò ìbátan jẹ́ ìtò gbogbo àwọn èròjà àkọ́kọ́ àwọn ìwọ̀n tí a tò rẹ̀.

source: The range of a relation is the set of all second components of its ordered pairs.
target: Àyè-kàn ìbátan jẹ́ ìtò gbogbo àwọn èròjà kejì àwọn ìwọ̀n tí a tò rẹ̀.

source: A function is a relation where each element in the domain corresponds to exactly one element in the range.
target: Ìfà jẹ́ ìbátan níbi tí èròjà kọ̀ọ̀kan nínú àdúgbò bá ẹ̀yà kan pàtó nínú àyè-kàn mu.

source: A linear equation in two variables has the form ax + by = c.
target: Ọ̀mì-dogbá nínú àwọn onídìmọ̀ méjì ní ọ̀nà ax + by = c.

source: A system of linear equations is a set of two or more linear equations.
target: Ètò àwọn ọ̀mì-dogbá jẹ́ ìtò àwọn ọ̀mì-dogbá méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.

source: The solution to a system of linear equations is the set of values that satisfies all equations in the system.
target: Ojútùú sí ètò àwọn ọ̀mì-dogbá jẹ́ ìtò àwọn iye tí ó mú gbogbo àwọn ọ̀mì nínú ètò náà ṣẹ.

source: Gaussian elimination is a method for solving systems of linear equations.
target: Ìmúkúrò Gáúsiánù jẹ́ ọ̀nà fún yíyanǹjú àwọn ètò ọ̀mì-dogbá.

source: A conic section is a curve obtained as the intersection of a plane and a double-napped cone.
target: Abala kọ́nìkì jẹ́ kọ́fù tí a rí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìpàdé pẹpẹ kan àti abala-méjì kọ́nù.

source: A circle is a conic section formed when a plane intersects a cone perpendicular to the axis of the cone.
target: Ẹ̀ká jẹ́ abala kọ́nìkì tí a ṣẹ̀dá nígbà tí pẹpẹ bá da kọ́nù lọ́nà ọgbà sí ọ̀pọ̀n kọ́nù náà.

source: An ellipse is a conic section formed when a plane intersects a cone at an angle to the axis of the cone.
target: Ẹ̀láípsì jẹ́ abala kọ́nìkì tí a ṣẹ̀dá nígbà tí pẹpẹ bá da kọ́nù ní igun sí ọ̀pọ̀n kọ́nù náà.

source: A parabola is a conic section formed when a plane intersects a cone parallel to a line on the cone.
target: Kọ́nú-fífà jẹ́ abala kọ́nìkì tí a ṣẹ̀dá nígbà tí pẹpẹ bá da kọ́nù ní ọgbà sí ìlà lórí kọ́nù náà.

source: A hyperbola is a conic section formed when a plane intersects both halves of a double-napped cone.
target: Háípábólà jẹ́ abala kọ́nìkì tí a ṣẹ̀dá nígbà tí pẹpẹ bá da àwọn ààbọ̀ méjèèjì abala-méjì kọ́nù.

source: A differential equation is an equation involving derivatives of a function.
target: Ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀mì tí ó ní àwọn dérífátífù ìfà.

source: A first-order differential equation involves only the first derivative of the function.
target: Ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ ìpele-àkọ́kọ́ ní dérífátífù àkọ́kọ́ ìfà náà nìkan.

source: A second-order differential equation involves the second derivative of the function.
target: Ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ ìpele-kejì ní dérífátífù kejì ìfà náà.

source: A linear differential equation has the dependent variable and all its derivatives occurring with power 1.
target: Ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ dogbá ní onídìmọ̀ aláṣeégbé àti gbogbo àwọn dérífátífù rẹ̀ tí ó farahàn pẹ̀lú agbára 1.

source: A partial differential equation involves partial derivatives of a function of several variables.
target: Ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ abẹ́lé ní àwọn dérífátífù abẹ́lé ìfà àwọn onídìmọ̀ púpọ̀.

source: A boundary value problem is a differential equation together with a set of boundary conditions.
target: Ìyọnu iye-ààlà jẹ́ ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìtò àwọn ipò ààlà.

source: An initial value problem is a differential equation together with a set of initial conditions.
target: Ìyọnu iye-ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ jẹ́ ọ̀mì-ìyàtọ̀sọ́tọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìtò àwọn ipò ìbẹ̀rẹ̀.

source: A mathematical model is a description of a system using mathematical concepts and language.
target: Àwòṣe ìṣirò jẹ́ àpèjúwe ètò nípa lílo àwọn èrò àti èdè ìṣirò.

source: Optimization is the process of finding the maximum or minimum value of a function.
target: Ìdára jẹ́ ìlànà wíwá iye púpọ̀jùlọ tàbí kéréjùlọ ìfà.

source: A constraint is a condition that a solution to an optimization problem must satisfy.
target: Ìdílọ́wọ́ jẹ́ ipò tí ojútùú sí ìyọnu ìdára gbọ́dọ̀ mú ṣẹ.

source: Linear programming is a method to achieve the best outcome in a mathematical model with linear constraints.
target: Ìṣírò-dogbá jẹ́ ọ̀nà láti ṣe àṣeyọrí èsì tí ó dára jùlọ nínú àwòṣe ìṣirò pẹ̀lú àwọn ìdílọ́wọ́ dogbá.

source: Game theory is the study of mathematical models of strategic interaction between rational decision-makers.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ere jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn àwòṣe ìṣirò ìbáṣepọ̀ àdájọ láàrín àwọn olùpinnu aláròjinlẹ̀.

source: A zero-sum game is a game where one player's gain is exactly balanced by another player's loss.
target: Ere òdo-àpapọ̀ jẹ́ ere níbi tí èrè ẹlẹ́rẹ kan jẹ́ fífẹ̀gbálẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ikọlulẹ ẹlẹ́rẹ mìíràn.

source: A strategy is a complete plan of action in game theory.
target: Ìlànà-ẹ̀rí jẹ́ ètò pípé ìgbéṣẹ̀ nínú ẹ̀kọ́ ere.

source: A Nash equilibrium is a stable state in a game where no player can gain by unilaterally changing their strategy.
target: Ìdógba Nási jẹ́ ipò ìdúró nínú ere níbi tí kò sí ẹlẹ́rẹ tí ó lè jèrè nípa yíyi ìlànà-ẹ̀rí wọn padà lẹ́kansoso.

source: A graph in graph theory consists of vertices and edges.
target: Àwòrán nínú ẹ̀kọ́ àwòrán jẹ́ àkójọ àwọn tẹ́tẹ́ àti etí.

source: A directed graph has edges with a specific direction.
target: Àwòrán atọ́sọ́nà ní àwọn etí pẹ̀lú ìhà pàtó.

source: A weighted graph has a value associated with each edge.
target: Àwòrán alániwọ̀n ní iye tí a ṣe àbáṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú etí kọ̀ọ̀kan.

source: A tree is a connected graph with no cycles.
target: Igi jẹ́ àwòrán asọpọ̀ pẹ̀lú kò sí àwọn àyídà.

source: A spanning tree is a tree that includes all vertices of a graph.
target: Igi afáralọ́lá jẹ́ igi tí ó ní gbogbo àwọn tẹ́tẹ́ àwòrán.

source: A path in a graph is a sequence of vertices such that each adjacent pair is connected by an edge.
target: Ọ̀nà nínú àwòrán jẹ́ ìtẹ̀lé àwọn tẹ́tẹ́ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí ìwọ̀n tímọ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan jẹ́ sísopọ̀ nípa etí.

source: A cycle in a graph is a path that starts and ends at the same vertex.
target: Àyídà nínú àwòrán jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ tí ó sì parí ní tẹ́tẹ́ kannáà.

source: A connected graph has a path between every pair of vertices.
target: Àwòrán asọpọ̀ ní ọ̀nà láàrín ìwọ̀n tẹ́tẹ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan.

source: A complete graph has an edge between every pair of vertices.
target: Àwòrán pípé ní etí láàrín ìwọ̀n tẹ́tẹ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan.

source: A bipartite graph can have its vertices divided into two disjoint sets such that every edge connects a vertex in one set to a vertex in the other set.
target: Àwòrán ìpínméjì le ní àwọn tẹ́tẹ́ rẹ̀ pínpín sí àwọn ìtò méjì alájẹsọ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí gbogbo etí sọ tẹ́tẹ́ nínú ìtò kan pọ̀ mọ́ tẹ́tẹ́ nínú ìtò mìíràn.

source: The degree of a vertex is the number of edges connected to it.
target: Ìpele tẹ́tẹ́ jẹ́ iye àwọn etí tí a sọpọ̀ mọ́ ọ.

source: A Euler circuit is a path that traverses each edge of a graph exactly once and returns to the starting vertex.
target: Àyíká Yúlà jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí ó la etí kọ̀ọ̀kan àwòrán kọjá ẹ̀ẹ̀kan pàtó tí ó sì padà sí tẹ́tẹ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀.

source: A Hamilton circuit is a path that visits each vertex of a graph exactly once and returns to the starting vertex.
target: Àyíká Hámíltọ́nù jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí ó bẹ tẹ́tẹ́ kọ̀ọ̀kan àwòrán wò ẹ̀ẹ̀kan pàtó tí ó sì padà sí tẹ́tẹ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀.

source: A planar graph can be drawn on a plane without any edges crossing.
target: Àwòrán apẹpẹ lè jẹ́ yíya lórí pẹpẹ láìsí àwọn etí dídà.

source: A chromatic number of a graph is the minimum number of colors needed to color its vertices such that no adjacent vertices have the same color.
target: Òòkà àwọ̀jíjà àwòrán jẹ́ iye kéréjùlọ àwọn àwọ̀ tí a nílò láti kun àwọn tẹ́tẹ́ rẹ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí kò sí àwọn tẹ́tẹ́ tímọ́ tí ó ní àwọ̀ kannáà.

source: A mathematical proof is a rigorous argument that establishes the truth of a statement.
target: Ìdánilójú ìṣirò jẹ́ àríyànjiyàn lílágbára tí ó fi òtítọ́ gbólóhùn múlẹ̀.

source: A theorem is a statement that has been proven on the basis of previously established statements.
target: Òfin jẹ́ gbólóhùn tí a ti ṣe ìdánilójú lórí ìpìlẹ̀ à

source: Chemistry is the science of matter, especially its properties, structure, composition, behavior, reactions, interactions and the changes it undergoes.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ Ẹlà jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀-jinlẹ̀ ti ẹ̀dá, pápàá, ti ìṣesí, ètò-inú, ohun-inú, ìṣèwàhù, àsè, ìbáraṣepọ̀ àti àwọn ìyípadà tó má nní.

source: Chemistry is sometimes called the central science because it connects physics with other natural sciences.
target: A máa npè ẹ̀kọ́-ẹlà ní ìmọ̀-jinlẹ̀ t'àárín nítorí òun ló ṣe àsopọ̀ àwọn ẹ̀kọ́-ẹ̀dá pẹ̀lú àwọn ìmọ̀-jinlẹ̀ míràn.

source: Chemistry is the study of matter and energy and the interactions between them.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ẹ̀dá, agbára àti àwọn ìbáraṣepọ̀ tó wà láarín wọn.

source: A chemical reaction is a process that leads to the transformation of one set of chemical substances to another.
target: Àsè ẹlà jẹ́ ìlànà bí àwọn ìjọ ẹ̀dá kan ṣe nparadà sí àwọn ìjọ ẹ̀dá miran.

source: A chemical equation is the symbolic representation of a chemical reaction.
target: Ọ̀mì ẹlà jẹ́ àmì àpẹrẹ àsè ẹlà.

source: In a chemical equation, the reactant entities are given on the left hand side and the product entities on the right hand side.
target: Ní ọ̀mì ẹlà, a fi àwọn èsè-àsè sí apá òsì tí a sì fi àwọn ẹ̀sún-àsè sí apá ọ̀tún.

source: Chemical composition refers to the arrangement, type and ratio of atoms in molecules of substances.
target: Ètò Ohun-inú ẹlà túmọ̀ sí ètò, oríṣi àti ìbùpín àwọn átọ̀mù tó wà nínu mólékù àwọn ẹ̀dá.

source: Chemical synthesis is purposeful execution of chemical reactions to get a product, or several products.
target: Ìṣẹ̀dá ẹlà jẹ́ ìlànà tí a mọ̀ọ́mọ̀ gbà se àsè láti ní ẹ̀sún tàbí àwọn ẹ̀sún tí a nfẹ́.

source: Acids have a sour taste and can turn litmus paper red.
target: Àwọn ẹ̀kan ní adùn kíkorò wọn sì lè sọ ìwé lítmọ́ọ̀sì di pupa.

source: Bases have a bitter taste and can turn litmus paper blue.
target: Àwọn ègbo ní adùn kíkorò wọn sì lè sọ ìwé lítmọ́ọ̀sì di àwọ̀ àyìnrín.

source: A solution is formed when a solute dissolves in a solvent.
target: Àpòpọ̀ jẹ́ ohun tí a ní nígbàtí gbẹrẹfun bá yọ́ sínú èpò.

source: The concentration of a solution indicates how much solute is dissolved in a specific amount of solvent.
target: Ìdọ̀ti àpòpọ̀ fi hàn bí gbẹrẹfun ṣe pọ̀ tó ní inú iye èpò kan.

source: Mixtures contain two or more substances that are not chemically combined.
target: Àwọn àkópọ̀ ní méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá tí kò papọ̀ ní ọ̀nà ẹlà.

source: Compounds are substances made up of two or more elements that are chemically combined.
target: Àwọn àsèpọ̀ jẹ́ àwọn ẹ̀dá tí a ṣe pẹ̀lú méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn ìṣù-átọ̀mù tí wọ́n papọ̀ ní ọ̀nà ẹlà.

source: An element is a substance that cannot be broken down into simpler substances.
target: Ìṣù-átọ̀mù jẹ́ ẹ̀dá tí a kò lè fọ́ sí àwọn ẹ̀dá tí ó rọrùn ju.

source: The periodic table organizes all the known elements based on their properties.
target: Tábìlì àyíká́ to gbogbo àwọn ìṣù-átọ̀mù tí a mọ̀ dá lórí àwọn ìṣesí wọn.

source: Atoms are the basic units of matter and consist of a nucleus surrounded by electrons.
target: Àwọn átọ̀mù jẹ́ àwọn ẹyọ ìpilẹ̀ ẹ̀dá, wọ́n sì ní àgọ́ tí àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù yí ká.

source: The nucleus of an atom contains protons and neutrons.
target: Àgọ́ átọ̀mù ní àwọn pírótọ̀nù àti niútírọ̀nù.

source: Electrons orbit around the nucleus of an atom.
target: Àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù yí àgọ́ átọ̀mù ká.

source: Protons carry a positive charge.
target: Àwọn pírótọ̀nù gbe àmì ìdájúdá.

source: Neutrons have no electrical charge.
target: Àwọn niútírọ̀nù kò ní àmì okun-àrá kankan.

source: Electrons carry a negative charge.
target: Àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù gbe àmì ìdájúrò.

source: The atomic number of an element is the number of protons in its nucleus.
target: Nọ́mbà átọ̀mù ìṣù-átọ̀mù kan jẹ́ iye àwọn pírótọ̀nù nínú àgọ́ rẹ̀.

source: The mass number of an atom is the sum of the number of protons and neutrons in its nucleus.
target: Nọ́mbà ìwọ̀n-okun átọ̀mù kan jẹ́ àpapọ̀ iye àwọn pírótọ̀nù àti niútírọ̀nù nínú àgọ́ rẹ̀.

source: Isotopes are atoms of the same element with different numbers of neutrons.
target: Àwọn ísótópù jẹ́ àwọn átọ̀mù ìṣù-átọ̀mù kannáà pẹ̀lú oríṣiríṣi iye àwọn niútírọ̀nù.

source: Molecules are formed when two or more atoms join together.
target: Àwọn mólékù jẹ́ èyí tí a ní nígbàtí méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn átọ̀mù bá papọ̀.

source: A covalent bond is formed when atoms share electrons.
target: Ìsopọ̀ ìfipínhàn jẹ́ èyí tí a ní nígbàtí àwọn átọ̀mù bá ńpín àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù.

source: An ionic bond is formed when electrons are transferred from one atom to another.
target: Ìsopọ̀ áyọ́nìkì jẹ́ èyí tí a ní nígbàtí àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù bá ńgbé láti átọ̀mù kan sí òmíràn.

source: A metallic bond is formed between metal atoms.
target: Ìsopọ̀ àlùrọ jẹ́ èyí tí a ní láàrín àwọn átọ̀mù àlùrọ.

source: Acids and bases react together to form a salt and water.
target: Àwọn ẹ̀kan àti ègbo ṣe àsè papọ̀ láti ṣe iyọ̀ àti omi.

source: Oxidation is the loss of electrons by a molecule, atom or ion.
target: Ìfóksídù jẹ́ pípò àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù lọ́wọ́ mólékù, átọ̀mù tàbí áyọ́nù.

source: Reduction is the gain of electrons by a molecule, atom or ion.
target: Ìdínkù jẹ́ gbígba àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù lọ́wọ́ mólékù, átọ̀mù tàbí áyọ́nù.

source: Oxidation and reduction always occur together in a reaction.
target: Ìfóksídù àti ìdínkù máa nwáyé papọ̀ nígbà gbogbo nínú àsè kan.

source: A redox reaction involves the transfer of electrons between two species.
target: Àsè ìfóksídù-ìdínkù ní ṣíṣe pẹ̀lú ṣíṣe ìgbé àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù láàrín àwọn ẹ̀yà méjì.

source: A catalyst is a substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without being consumed.
target: Àyásè jẹ́ ẹ̀dá tí ó nmu ìyásí àsè ẹlà sókè láìjẹ́ pé a nlò ó.

source: Exothermic reactions release energy to the surroundings.
target: Àwọn àsè afaná túsílẹ̀ agbára sí àyíká.

source: Endothermic reactions absorb energy from the surroundings.
target: Àwọn àsè aloná fa agbára mú láti àyíká.

source: The pH scale measures the acidity or alkalinity of a solution.
target: Ìpẹ̀kan wọn rírun tàbí ríṣe ègbo àpòpọ̀ kan.

source: A solution with a pH less than 7 is acidic.
target: Àpòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìpẹ̀kan tí ó kéré ju 7 lọ jẹ́ elẹ̀kan.

source: A solution with a pH greater than 7 is basic (alkaline).
target: Àpòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìpẹ̀kan tí ó pọ̀ ju 7 lọ jẹ́ elègbo.

source: A solution with a pH of 7 is neutral.
target: Àpòpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìpẹ̀kan 7 jẹ́ àìsí apá kan.

source: The rate of a chemical reaction is influenced by temperature, concentration, surface area, and the presence of catalysts.
target: Ìyásí àsè ẹlà gba ipa láti ọwọ́ ìgbóná, ìdọ̀ti, òrò ojú, àti ìwà àwọn àyásè.

source: Organic chemistry is the study of carbon compounds.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-eléedú jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn àsèpọ̀ kábónì.

source: Inorganic chemistry is the study of compounds that do not contain carbon-hydrogen bonds.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-aláìléedú jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn àsèpọ̀ tí kò ní ìsopọ̀ kábónì-hádírójẹ̀nì.

source: Physical chemistry is the study of the physical properties of chemical systems.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́-ẹlà t'ìṣeṣí-ẹ̀dá jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ìṣesí ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ àwọn ètò ẹlà.

source: Analytical chemistry is the study of the separation, identification, and quantification of chemical compounds.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ (nípa) Ìtúpalẹ̀ Ẹ̀la jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìpín, ìdámọ̀, àti ìṣètó àwọn àsèpọ̀ ẹlà.

source: Biochemistry is the study of chemical processes within living organisms.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-ìyè jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ìlànà ẹlà nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá oníyè.

source: Electrochemistry is the study of chemical processes that cause electrons to move.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-àrá jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ìlànà ẹlà tí ó mú kí àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù ṣí ipò.

source: Chemical equilibrium is the state in which the reactants and products have no net change over time.
target: Agbede ẹlà jẹ́ ipò tí àwọn èsè-àsè àti àwọn ẹ̀sún-àsè kò ní àyípadà sókè nígbà kan.

source: The equilibrium constant is a value that indicates the ratio of products to reactants at equilibrium.
target: Òòkà-àìyẹ̀ ibi-agbede jẹ́ iye tí ó ntọ́ka sí ìbùpín àwọn ẹ̀sún-àsè sí àwọn èsè-àsè ní agbede.

source: Le Chatelier's principle states that if a system at equilibrium is subjected to a change, the system will readjust to counteract that change.
target: Òfin Le Chatelier sọ pé tí èto kan ní agbede bá gba àyípadà, ètò náà yóò ṣe àtúnṣètó láti takò àyípadà náà.

source: Thermodynamics is the study of heat and energy and their conversion from one form to another.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-òkun-iná jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ okun-iná àti agbára àti ìyípadà wọn láti ìrí kan sí òmíràn.

source: The first law of thermodynamics states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transferred or converted.
target: Òfin àkọ́kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-òkun-iná sọ pé a kò lè ṣẹ̀dá tàbí pa agbára run, ṣùgbọ́n a lè gbé e lọ tàbí yí i padà.

source: The second law of thermodynamics states that the entropy of an isolated system always increases.
target: Òfin kejì ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-òkun-iná sọ pé ìdàrú ètò tí a yà sọ́tọ̀ máa npọ̀ síi.

source: Entropy is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system.
target: Ìdàrú jẹ́ ìwọ̀n àìlétò tàbí àìdarapọ̀ nínú ètò kan.

source: Chemical reactions can be classified as synthesis, decomposition, single replacement, or double replacement reactions.
target: A lè pín àwọn àsè ẹlà sí àwọn àsè ìṣẹ̀dá, ìdànù, ìrọ́pò ẹyọ, tàbí ìrọ́pò ẹ̀ẹ́méjì.

source: A synthesis reaction is when two or more substances combine to form a new compound.
target: Àsè ìṣẹ̀dá jẹ́ nígbàtí méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá bá papọ̀ láti ṣẹ̀dá àsèpọ̀ tuntun.

source: A decomposition reaction is when a compound breaks down into two or more simpler substances.
target: Àsè ìdànù jẹ́ nígbàtí àsèpọ̀ kan bá fọ́ sí méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá tí ó rọrùn ju.

source: A single replacement reaction is when one element replaces another element in a compound.
target: Àsè ìrọ́pò ẹyọ jẹ́ nígbàtí ìṣù-átọ̀mù kan bá rọ́pò ìṣù-átọ̀mù mìíràn nínú àsèpọ̀ kan.

source: A double replacement reaction is when the positive and negative ions of two compounds exchange places.
target: Àsè ìrọ́pò ẹ̀ẹ́méjì jẹ́ nígbàtí àwọn áyọ́nù ìdájúdá àti ìdájúrò méjì àsèpọ̀ bá pààrọ̀ ipò.

source: A combustion reaction is a type of redox reaction in which a fuel reacts with oxygen to produce energy and products.
target: Àsè jíjóná jẹ́ irú àsè ìfóksídù-ìdínkù tí idáná ṣe àsè pẹ̀lú ọ́síjẹ̀nì láti ṣẹ̀dá agbára àti àwọn ẹ̀sún.

source: A neutralization reaction occurs when an acid and a base react to form water and a salt.
target: Àsè ìsọdàìní jẹ́ nígbàtí ẹ̀kan àti ègbo bá ṣe àsè láti ṣẹ̀dá omi àti iyọ̀.

source: Precipitation reactions occur when two soluble substances react to form an insoluble product called a precipitate.
target: Àwọn àsè ìrẹ̀sílẹ̀ nwáyé nígbàtí méjì àwọn ẹ̀dá tí ńyọ́ bá ṣe àsè láti ṣẹ̀dá ẹ̀sún tí kò yọ́ tí a npè ní ìrẹ̀sílẹ̀.

source: The periodic table is organized by atomic number, with elements having similar properties placed in the same column.
target: A to tábìlì àyíká́ gẹ́gẹ́bí nọ́mbà átọ̀mù, pẹ̀lú àwọn ìṣù-átọ̀mù tí ó ní ìṣesí báramu sí dúró ní ọ̀wọ́n kannáà.

source: Metals are typically good conductors of heat and electricity.
target: Àwọn àlùrọ máa jẹ́ olùdarí dáradára fún okun-iná àti okun-àrá.

source: Nonmetals are typically poor conductors of heat and electricity.
target: Àwọn àdàrọ máa jẹ́ olùdarí àìdára fún okun-iná àti okun-àrá.

source: Metalloids have properties of both metals and nonmetals.
target: Àwọn àrínrọdàrọ ní ìṣesí àwọn àlùrọ àti àdàrọ.

source: Noble gases are extremely unreactive and exist as single atoms.
target: Àwọn òyì iyebiye jẹ́ àìṣàsè gan-an wọ́n sì wà gẹ́gẹ́bí ẹyọ átọ̀mù.

source: Transition metals have multiple oxidation states.
target: Àwọn àlùrọ àyípadà ní ogunlọ́gọ̀ àwọn ipò ìfóksídù.

source: Halogens are highly reactive nonmetals.
target: Àwọn hálójẹ̀nì jẹ́ àwọn àdàrọ tí ó ṣàsè gan-an.

source: The alkali metals are highly reactive and form compounds with oxidation state +1.
target: Àwọn àlùrọ aṣọṣẹ jẹ́ àwọn tí ó ṣàsè gan-an wọ́n sì ńṣẹ̀dá àwọn àsèpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ipò ìfóksídù +1.

source: The alkaline earth metals form compounds with oxidation state +2.
target: Àwọn àlùrọ ilẹ̀ aṣọṣẹ ṣẹ̀dá àwọn àsèpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ipò ìfóksídù +2.

source: Solubility is the ability of a substance to dissolve in a solvent.
target: Ìlèyọ́ jẹ́ agbára ẹ̀dá kan láti yọ́ sínú èpò.

source: Alloys are mixtures of a metal with one or more other elements.
target: Àwọn àyọ́pọ̀ jẹ́ àwọn àkópọ̀ àlùrọ pẹ̀lú ọ̀kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn ìṣù-átọ̀mù mìíràn.

source: Polymers are large molecules made up of repeating units called monomers.
target: Àwọn pólímà jẹ́ àwọn mólékù nlá tí a ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹyọ tí ńtún ara wọn ṣẹ tí a npè ní mónómà.

source: Isomers are compounds with the same molecular formula but different structural arrangements.
target: Àwọn ísómà jẹ́ àwọn àsèpọ̀ pẹ̀lú àkọsílẹ̀ mólékù kannáà ṣùgbọ́n oríṣiríṣi ètò ìfẹ̀dí.

source: Hydrocarbons are compounds composed only of carbon and hydrogen.
target: Àwọn hádírókábónì jẹ́ àwọn àsèpọ̀ tí a ṣe pẹ̀lú kábónì àti hádírójẹ̀nì nìkan.

source: Alkanes are hydrocarbons with single bonds.
target: Àwọn álkánì jẹ́ àwọn hádírókábónì pẹ̀lú ìsopọ̀ ẹyọ.

source: Alkenes are hydrocarbons with at least one double bond.
target: Àwọn álkínì jẹ́ àwọn hádírókábónì pẹ̀lú ó kéré jù ìsopọ̀ ẹ̀ẹ́méjì kan.

source: Alkynes are hydrocarbons with at least one triple bond.
target: Àwọn álkáínì jẹ́ àwọn hádírókábónì pẹ̀lú ó kéré jù ìsopọ̀ ẹ̀ẹ́mẹ́ta kan.

source: Aromatic hydrocarbons contain benzene rings.
target: Àwọn hádírókábónì olóòórùn ní àwọn òrùka bẹ́ńsínì.

source: Functional groups are specific groups of atoms within a molecule that give the molecule its characteristic properties.
target: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ jẹ́ àwọn ẹgbẹ́ pàtó àwọn átọ̀mù nínú mólékù tí ó nfún mólékù náà ní àwọn ìṣesí àkànṣe rẹ̀.

source: Alcohols contain the hydroxyl (-OH) functional group.
target: Àwọn ẹmun ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ háídírọ́síìlì (-OH).

source: Carboxylic acids contain the carboxyl (-COOH) functional group.
target: Àwọn ẹkan kábọ́síìlìkì ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ kábọ́síìlì (-COOH).

source: Aldehydes contain the formyl (-CHO) functional group.
target: Àwọn áldẹ́háídì ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ fọ́mílì (-CHO).

source: Ketones contain the carbonyl (C=O) functional group.
target: Àwọn kẹ́tónì ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ kábónílì (C=O).

source: Ethers contain the ether (-O-) functional group.
target: Àwọn ítà ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ ítà (-O-).

source: Esters contain the ester (-COO-) functional group.
target: Àwọn ẹ́stà ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ ẹ́stà (-COO-).

source: Amines contain one or more nitrogen atoms with a lone pair of electrons.
target: Àwọn ámínì ní ọ̀kan tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn átọ̀mù náítírójẹ̀nì pẹ̀lú àkánpọ̀ lọ́nà kan àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù.

source: Amides contain the amide (-CONH2) functional group.
target: Àwọn ámídì ní ẹgbẹ́ iṣẹ́ ámídì (-CONH2).

source: Phenols contain a hydroxyl group bonded directly to an aromatic ring.
target: Àwọn fẹ́nọ́lì ní ẹgbẹ́ háídírọ́síìlì tí a sopọ̀ tààrà sí òrùka olóòórùn.

source: Carbohydrates are biological molecules composed of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen, typically with the formula Cx(H2O)y.
target: Àwọn ẹlà-okun jẹ́ àwọn mólékù jẹ́mọ́ ẹ̀mí tí a ṣe pẹ̀lú kábónì, hádírójẹ̀nì, àti ọ́síjẹ̀nì, pẹ̀lú àkọsílẹ̀ Cx(H2O)y ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ìgbà.

source: Proteins are large biomolecules consisting of chains of amino acids.
target: Àwọn ọ̀jẹ̀ jẹ́ àwọn mólékù jẹ́mọ́ ẹ̀mí nlá tí ó jẹ́ pípọ̀ àwọn ẹ̀yọ àsìdì ámínọ́.

source: Lipids are a diverse group of hydrophobic or amphiphilic compounds that include fats, oils, and waxes.
target: Àwọn ọ̀rá jẹ́ àkójọpọ̀ oríṣiríṣi àwọn àsèpọ̀ hydrofóbìkì tàbí àmfífílìkì tí ó ní àwọn ọ̀rá, epo, àti ìda.

source: Nucleic acids are biological polymers that store and transmit genetic information.
target: Àwọn àsìdì nukléìkì jẹ́ àwọn pólímà jẹ́mọ́ ẹ̀mí tí ó ntọ́jú àti gbé ìmọ̀ jẹ́mọ́ ìjogún.

source: DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) and RNA (ribonucleic acid) are the two main types of nucleic acids.
target: DNA (àsìdì dẹ́ọ́síríbónukléìkì) àti RNA (àsìdì ríbónukléìkì) ni àwọn oriṣi méjì pàtàkì àwọn àsìdì nukléìkì.

source: Enzymes are proteins that catalyze biochemical reactions.
target: Àwọn ẹ́ńsáìmù jẹ́ àwọn ọ̀jẹ̀ tí ó ńṣe àyásè fún àwọn àsè jẹ́mọ́ ẹ̀mí.

source: Fermentation is the conversion of carbohydrates to alcohol or organic acids using yeasts or bacteria under anaerobic conditions.
target: Ìdíbà jẹ́ ìyípadà àwọn ẹlà-okun sí ẹmu tàbí àwọn àsìdì jẹ́mọ́ ẹ̀mí pẹ̀lú àwọn osùn-ìdíbà tàbí àwọn alámọ̀ ní àbẹ́ ipò láìsí atẹ́gùn.

source: A chemical indicator changes color when exposed to different pH levels or other chemical conditions.
target: Olùdámọ̀ ẹlà yí àwọ̀ padà nígbàtí a bá fi hàn àwọn ìpele ìpẹ̀kan oríṣiríṣi tàbí àwọn ipò ẹlà mìíràn.

source: Chromatography is a technique used to separate mixtures based on different rates at which the components move through a stationary phase.
target: Krómátọ́gráfì jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí a lò láti ya àwọn àkópọ̀ sọ́tọ̀ dá lórí àwọn ìyásí oríṣiríṣi tí àwọn ohun inú rẹ̀ fi ńrìn kọjá ipò dúró.

source: Distillation is a method of separating mixtures based on differences in the boiling points of the components.
target: Ìfẹ́dídà jẹ́ ọ̀nà láti ya àwọn àkópọ̀ sọ́tọ̀ dá lórí ìyàtọ̀ nínú àwọn ìwọ̀ngbóná ibi-ìhó àwọn ohun inú rẹ̀.

source: Filtration is a technique used to separate solids from liquids or gases.
target: Àsẹ́ jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí a lò láti ya àwọn adì kúrò nínú àwọn aṣàn tàbí òyì.

source: Crystallization is the process of forming a solid crystal structure from a solution or melt.
target: Ìdákrístálì jẹ́ ìlànà pífinlẹ̀ ètò krístálì adì láti àpòpọ̀ tàbí ìyọ́.

source: Sublimation is the transition of a substance directly from the solid to the gas phase without passing through the liquid phase.
target: Ìfẹ́dògbéwálẹ̀ jẹ́ ìgbéra ẹ̀dá kan tààrà láti ipò adì sí ipò òyì láìla ipò aṣàn kọjá.

source: A titration is used to determine the concentration of an acid or base by adding a known concentration of the other until neutralization occurs.
target: A ń lo ìtítírẹ́ṣọ̀n láti pinnu ìdọ̀ti ẹ̀kan tàbí ègbo nípa fífi ìdọ̀ti tí a mọ̀ ti èkejì kún un títí ìsọdàìní fi ṣẹlẹ̀.

source: A buffer solution resists changes in pH when acids or bases are added.
target: Àpòpọ̀ aláàbò kọ àwọn ìyípadà nínú ìpẹ̀kan nígbàtí a bá fi àwọn ẹ̀kan tàbí ègbo kún un.

source: Stoichiometry is the calculation of the quantities of reactants and products in chemical reactions.
target: Stọ́ìkiọ́mẹ́trì jẹ́ ìṣirò àwọn iye àwọn èsè-àsè àti àwọn ẹ̀sún-àsè nínú àwọn àsè ẹlà.

source: The mole is the SI unit of amount of substance, representing approximately 6.022 × 10^23 elementary entities.
target: Móòlù jẹ́ ẹyọ ìdíwọ̀n SI fún iye ẹ̀dá, tí ó dúró fún bí 6.022 × 10^23 àwọn ẹyọ ìpilẹ̀.

source: Gas laws describe the behavior of gases under various conditions of temperature, pressure, and volume.
target: Àwọn òfin òyì ṣe àpèjúwe ìṣèwàhù àwọn òyì lábẹ́ oríṣiríṣi ipò ìgbóná, èéfún, àti àyè.

source: Boyle's law states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature.
target: Òfin Boyle sọ pé èéfún òyì kan jẹ́ ìdọ́gba ìdàkejì sí àyè rẹ̀ ní ìgbóná àìyípadà.

source: Charles's law states that the volume of a gas is directly proportional to its absolute temperature at constant pressure.
target: Òfin Charles sọ pé àyè òyì kan jẹ́ ìdọ́gba tààrà sí ìgbóná pípé rẹ̀ ní èéfún àìyípadà.

source: The Ideal Gas Law (PV = nRT) relates the pressure, volume, temperature, and amount of a gas.
target: Òfin Òyì Pípé (PV = nRT) ṣe àlàyé ìbáṣepọ̀ èéfún, àyè, ìgbóná, àti iye òyì.

source: Avogadro's law states that equal volumes of gases at the same temperature and pressure contain equal numbers of molecules.
target: Òfin Avogadro sọ pé àwọn àyè dọ́gba ti àwọn òyì ní ìgbóná àti èéfún kannáà ní àwọn nọ́mbà dọ́gba ti àwọn mólékù.

source: Dalton's law of partial pressures states that the total pressure of a gas mixture equals the sum of the partial pressures of each gas.
target: Òfin Dalton ti àwọn èéfún apá sọ pé èéfún àpapọ̀ àkópọ̀ òyì jẹ́ àpapọ̀ àwọn èéfún apá ti òyì kọ̀ọ̀kan.

source: The kinetic theory of gases explains the behavior of gases at the molecular level.
target: Ìlànà àyíkà ti àwọn òyì ṣe àlàyé ìṣèwàhù àwọn òyì ní ipele mólékù.

source: Chemical bonds are the forces that hold atoms together in molecules and compounds.
target: Àwọn ìsopọ̀ ẹlà jẹ́ àwọn ipá tí ó ṣe àgbẹ́ àwọn átọ̀mù papọ̀ nínú àwọn mólékù àti àsèpọ̀.

source: Electronegativity is a measure of an atom's ability to attract shared electrons in a chemical bond.
target: Ẹlẹ́ktrónẹ́gátífítì jẹ́ ìwọ̀n agbára átọ̀mù láti fa àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù tí wọ́n pín nínú ìsopọ̀ ẹlà.

source: Hydrogen bonding is a type of dipole-dipole interaction between a hydrogen atom and an electronegative atom.
target: Ìsopọ̀ hádírójẹ̀nì jẹ́ irú iṣẹ́pọ̀ dáìpólù-dáìpólù láàrín átọ̀mù hádírójẹ̀nì àti átọ̀mù ẹlẹ́ktrónẹ́gátífù.

source: Van der Waals forces are weak attractions between molecules.
target: Àwọn ipá Van der Waals jẹ́ àwọn ìfàmọ́ra tí kò lágbára láàrín àwọn mólékù.

source: Nuclear chemistry is the study of the processes and properties of radioactive materials.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-àgọ́ jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn ìlànà àti ìṣesí àwọn ohun àgọ́.

source: Radioactivity is the spontaneous emission of radiation from unstable atomic nuclei.
target: Ìfẹ́àgọ́ jẹ́ ìtúsílẹ̀ afẹ́tàn láìròtẹ́lẹ̀ láti àwọn àgọ́ átọ̀mù àìlàgbára.

source: Alpha radiation consists of helium nuclei and has the least penetrating power.
target: Afẹ́tàn álfà jẹ́ pípọ̀ àwọn àgọ́ hílíọ́mù ó sì ní agbára iwọnú kéréjùlọ.

source: Beta radiation consists of electrons or positrons and has moderate penetrating power.
target: Afẹ́tàn bẹ́tà jẹ́ pípọ̀ àwọn ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù tàbí pọ́sìtrọ́nù ó sì ní agbára iwọnú àárín.

source: Gamma radiation consists of high-energy photons and has the greatest penetrating power.
target: Afẹ́tàn gámà jẹ́ pípọ̀ àwọn fótọ́nù agbára-gíga ó sì ní agbára iwọnú púpọ̀jùlọ.

source: Half-life is the time required for half of a radioactive substance to decay.
target: Ìdá-ayé jẹ́ àkókò tí ó nílò fún ìdajì ohun àgọ́ láti bàjẹ́.

source: Nuclear fission is the splitting of a large atomic nucleus into smaller parts.
target: Ìyà-àgọ́ jẹ́ pípa àgọ́ átọ̀mù nlá sí àwọn apá kékeré.

source: Nuclear fusion is the combining of small atomic nuclei to form a larger nucleus.
target: Ìdàpọ̀-àgọ́ jẹ́ dídàpọ̀ àwọn àgọ́ átọ̀mù kékeré láti ṣẹ̀dá àgọ́ tó tóbi ju.

source: A spectrophotometer measures the intensity of light as a function of wavelength.
target: Òṣùwọ̀n-aádi wọn déédé ìtànná gẹ́gẹ́bí iṣẹ́ ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n.

source: Mass spectrometry is an analytical technique that measures the mass-to-charge ratio of ions.
target: Ìwọ̀n ìwọ̀n-okun jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìtúpalẹ̀ tí ó wọn ìbùpín ìwọ̀n-okun-sí-àmì àwọn áyọ́nù.

source: Infrared spectroscopy identifies chemical bonds based on the vibrations of atoms.
target: Ìwọn-aádi ìnfírárẹ́dì ṣe ìdámọ̀ àwọn ìsopọ̀ ẹlà dá lórí àwọn mímì àwọn átọ̀mù.

source: Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy uses the magnetic properties of certain atomic nuclei to provide information about the structure of molecules.
target: Ìwọn-aádi ìfẹsẹmúra òòfà-àgọ́ (NMR) ń lo àwọn ìṣesí òòfà àwọn àgọ́ átọ̀mù kan láti pèsè ìmọ̀ nípa ètò àwọn mólékù.

source: X-ray crystallography is a technique used to determine the atomic and molecular structure of a crystal.
target: Ìdákrístálì X-ray jẹ́ ọ̀nà tí a lò láti pinnu ètò átọ̀mù àti mólékù krístálì.

source: A solution is a homogeneous mixture of two or more substances.
target: Àpòpọ̀ jẹ́ àkópọ̀ ìṣọ̀kan méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá.

source: A saturated solution contains the maximum amount of solute that can be dissolved at a given temperature.
target: Àpòpọ̀ pọ́njúdọ̀tí ní iye púpọ̀jùlọ ti gbẹrẹfun tí ó lè yọ́ ní ìgbóná tí a fún.

source: A supersaturated solution contains more solute than can ordinarily be dissolved at a given temperature.
target: Àpòpọ̀ pọ́njúdọ̀tíjọbalọ ní gbẹrẹfun tó pọ̀ ju èyí tí ó lè yọ́ déédé ní ìgbóná tí a fún.

source: A colloid is a mixture where particles of one substance are dispersed evenly throughout another but are not dissolved.
target: Kólóídì jẹ́ àkópọ̀ níbi tí àwọn ẹ̀wẹ́ ẹ̀dá kan túka déédé káàkiri òmíràn ṣùgbọ́n wọn kò yọ́.

source: A suspension is a mixture where solid particles are suspended in a fluid.
target: Afẹ́dìsókè jẹ́ àkópọ̀ níbi tí àwọn ẹ̀wẹ́ adì fẹ́ dìsókè nínú aṣàn.

source: Molarity is the number of moles of solute per liter of solution.
target: Mólárítì jẹ́ iye àwọn móòlù gbẹrẹfun fún lítà kan ti àpòpọ̀.

source: Molality is the number of moles of solute per kilogram of solvent.
target: Mólálítì jẹ́ iye àwọn móòlù gbẹrẹfun fún kílógrámù kan ti èpò.

source: Mole fraction is the ratio of the number of moles of one component to the total number of moles in a mixture.
target: Ìbùpín móòlù jẹ́ ìbùpín iye àwọn móòlù ẹ̀yà kan sí iye àpapọ̀ àwọn móòlù nínú àkópọ̀.

source: The freezing point of a solution is lower than the freezing point of the pure solvent.
target: Ìwọ̀ngbóná ìdidi àpòpọ̀ kéré ju ìwọ̀ngbóná ìdidi èpò àìlẹ̀gbin lọ.

source: The boiling point of a solution is higher than the boiling point of the pure solvent.
target: Ìwọ̀ngbóná ìhó àpòpọ̀ ga ju ìwọ̀ngbóná ìhó èpò àìlẹ̀gbin lọ.

source: Surface tension is the tendency of liquid surfaces to shrink into the minimum surface area possible.
target: Èéfún ojú jẹ́ ìfarajì àwọn ojú aṣàn láti fara pọ́ sí òrò ojú kéréjùlọ tí ó ṣeéṣe.

source: Capillary action is the ability of a liquid to flow against gravity in a narrow space.
target: Iṣẹ́ òpó-tinrin jẹ́ agbára aṣàn láti ṣàn dojú òòfà-ilẹ̀ kọ nínú àyè tóóró.

source: Viscosity is a measure of a fluid's resistance to flow.
target: Ojúìdí jẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìtakò aṣàn láti ṣàn.

source: Vapor pressure is the pressure exerted by a vapor in equilibrium with its liquid or solid phase.
target: Èéfún òyì jẹ́ èéfún tí a fún papọ̀ láti òyì ní agbede pẹ̀lú ipò aṣàn tàbí adì rẹ̀.

source: The boiling point is the temperature at which the vapor pressure of the liquid equals the pressure of the surrounding atmosphere.
target: Ìwọ̀ngbóná ìhó jẹ́ ìgbóná tí èéfún òyì aṣàn bá fi jẹ́ déédé èéfún àjọ-òyì tí ó yí i ká.

source: The freezing point is the temperature at which the liquid and solid phases of a substance are in equilibrium at a specified pressure.
target: Ìwọ̀ngbóná ìdidi jẹ́ ìgbóná tí ipò aṣàn àti adì ẹ̀dá wà ní agbede ní èéfún tí a nàkasẹ.

source: Diffusion is the movement of particles from a region of high concentration to a region of low concentration.
target: Ìfẹ́tàn jẹ́ ìṣísí àwọn ẹ̀wẹ́ láti agbègbè ìdọ̀ti gíga sí agbègbè ìdọ̀ti kéré.

source: Osmosis is the diffusion of water through a semipermeable membrane.
target: Ìfẹ́tàn omi jẹ́ ìfẹ́tàn omi láti àìdá afẹ́dífọ̀.

source: Dialysis is the separation of particles in a liquid based on differing rates of diffusion through a semipermeable membrane.
target: Ìfẹ́yàwọnú jẹ́ ìyà àwọn ẹ̀wẹ́ sọ́tọ̀ nínú aṣàn dá lórí ìyàtọ̀ ìyásí ìfẹ́tàn láti àìdá afẹ́dífọ̀.

source: Electrolysis is the process of using electrical energy to drive an otherwise non-spontaneous chemical reaction.
target: Ìfẹ́àrádà jẹ́ ìlànà lílo agbára okun-àrá láti lé àsè ẹlà tí kò ní ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ara rẹ̀ síwájú.

source: Catalysis is the increase in the rate of a chemical reaction due to the presence of a catalyst.
target: Ìfẹ́yàse jẹ́ ìgbèrú nínú ìyásí àsè ẹlà nítorí ìwà àyásè.

source: Heterogeneous catalysis occurs when the catalyst is in a different phase from the reactants.
target: Ìfẹ́yàse àjọra nwáyé nígbàtí àyásè wà ní ipò tí ó yàtọ̀ sí àwọn èsè-àsè.

source: Homogeneous catalysis occurs when the catalyst is in the same phase as the reactants.
target: Ìfẹ́yàse ìṣọ̀kan nwáyé nígbàtí àyásè wà ní ipò kannáà bí àwọn èsè-àsè.

source: Catalytic converters in cars use catalysts to convert harmful exhaust gases into less harmful emissions.
target: Àwọn ìyípadà àyásè nínú àwọn ọkọ̀ ń lo àwọn àyásè láti yí àwọn òyì èédú tí ó léwu padà sí àwọn túsílẹ̀ tí ó kéré ní ewu.

source: An acid-base indicator is a substance that changes color as the pH of the solution changes.
target: Olùdámọ̀ ẹ̀kan-ègbo jẹ́ ẹ̀dá tí ó nyí àwọ̀ padà bí ìpẹ̀kan àpòpọ̀ ṣe nyí padà.

source: The pH scale ranges from 0 to 14, with 7 being neutral.
target: Ìwọ̀nkà ìpẹ̀kan gbòòrò láti 0 sí 14, pẹ̀lú 7 jẹ́ àìsí apá kan.

source: Strong acids completely dissociate in water.
target: Àwọn ẹ̀kan líle túka pátápátá nínú omi.

source: Weak acids partially dissociate in water.
target: Àwọn ẹ̀kan kúkúrú túka díẹ̀díẹ̀ nínú omi.

source: Strong bases completely dissociate in water.
target: Àwọn ègbo líle túka pátápátá nínú omi.

source: Weak bases partially dissociate in water.
target: Àwọn ègbo kúkúrú túka díẹ̀díẹ̀ nínú omi.

source: A salt is an ionic compound formed by the neutralization reaction between an acid and a base.
target: Iyọ̀ jẹ́ àsèpọ̀ áyọ́nìkì tí a ṣẹ̀dá nípa àsè ìsọdàìní láàrín ẹ̀kan àti ègbo.

source: Combustion is a chemical reaction between a fuel and an oxidant that produces heat and light.
target: Jíjóná jẹ́ àsè ẹlà láàrín idáná àti afóksídù tí ó ṣẹ̀dá okun-iná àti ìtànná.

source: The activation energy is the minimum energy required for a reaction to occur.
target: Agbára ìgbéra jẹ́ agbára kéréjùlọ tí ó nílò fún àsè láti wáyé.

source: The reaction rate is the speed at which reactants are converted into products.
target: Ìyásí àsè jẹ́ ìyárawọn tí a fi ńyí àwọn èsè-àsè padà sí àwọn ẹ̀sún-àsè.

source: The rate law expresses the relationship between the reaction rate and the concentrations of the reactants.
target: Òfin ìyásí ṣe àlàyé ìbáṣepọ̀ láàrín ìyásí àsè àti àwọn ìdọ̀ti àwọn èsè-àsè.

source: The rate constant is a proportionality constant in the rate law equation.
target: Òòkà-àìyẹ̀ ìyásí jẹ́ òòkà-àìyẹ̀ ìdọ́gba nínú ọ̀mì òfin ìyásí.

source: The order of a reaction with respect to a reactant is the power to which the concentration of that reactant is raised in the rate law.
target: Ètò àsè ní ìtẹ̀lé èsè-àsè jẹ́ agbára tí a gbe ìdọ̀ti èsè-àsè náà sí nínú òfin ìyásí.

source: A zero-order reaction has a rate that is independent of the concentration of the reactants.
target: Àsè ètò-òdo ní ìyásí tí kò dá lórí ìdọ̀ti àwọn èsè-àsè.

source: A first-order reaction has a rate that is directly proportional to the concentration of one reactant.
target: Àsè ètò-àkọ́kọ́ ní ìyásí tí ó jẹ́ ìdọ́gba tààrà sí ìdọ̀ti èsè-àsè kan.

source: A second-order reaction has a rate that is proportional to the square of the concentration of one reactant or the product of the concentrations of two reactants.
target: Àsè ètò-èkejì ní ìyásí tí ó jẹ́ ìdọ́gba sí onírìnméjì ìdọ̀ti èsè-àsè kan tàbí ẹ̀sún ìdọ̀ti àwọn èsè-àsè méjì.

source: The Arrhenius equation relates the rate constant to the activation energy and temperature.
target: Ọ̀mì Arrhenius ṣe àlàyé ìbáṣepọ̀ òòkà-àìyẹ̀ ìyásí sí agbára ìgbéra àti ìgbóná.

source: A reaction mechanism is the step-by-step sequence of elementary reactions by which an overall chemical reaction occurs.
target: Ète àsè jẹ́ ìtẹ̀lé ìṣẹ̀sẹ̀ àwọn àsè ìpìlẹ̀ nípa èyí tí àkójọpọ̀ àsè ẹlà fi ṣẹlẹ̀.

source: The rate-determining step is the slowest step in a reaction mechanism.
target: Ìgbèsẹ̀ ìpinnu-ìyásí jẹ́ ìgbèsẹ̀ tí ó lọ́ra jùlọ nínú ète àsè.

source: Photochemistry is the study of chemical reactions that are triggered by light.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹlà-ìtànná jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ àwọn àsè ẹlà tí ìtànná ti ṣe àkànmọ́lẹ̀.

source: Photosynthesis is a photochemical process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy.
target: Àsè-ìtànná jẹ́ ìlànà ẹlà-ìtànná nípa èyí tí àwọn ọ̀gbìn fi ńyí agbára ìtànná padà sí agbára ẹlà.

source: A free radical is an atom, molecule, or ion with an unpaired electron.
target: Àdáradà jẹ́ átọ̀mù, mólékù, tàbí áyọ́nù pẹ̀lú ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù àìní ẹnìkejì.

source: A chain reaction is a sequence of reactions where a reactive product or by-product causes additional reactions to take place.
target: Àsè òkè-òkúta jẹ́ ìtẹ̀lé àwọn àsè níbi tí ẹ̀sún-àsè tí ó ṣàsè tàbí ẹ̀sún-àsè abẹ̀-ìgbẹ́ mú kí àwọn àsè àfikún wáyé.

source: Physics is the study of matter and its motion through spacetime.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ (nípa) ẹ̀dá jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀-jinlẹ̀ tó wà fún kíkọ́ nípa ẹ̀dá àti ìpapòdà rẹ̀ nínù àyé-ayé òun ìgbà-ayé.

source: Energy is the capacity to do work.
target: Agbára jẹ́ okun fún ètò ẹ̀dá kan láti le ṣe iṣẹ́.

source: Heat energy is a form of energy which transfers among particles in a substance.
target: Agbára Okun-iná jẹ́ oríṣi agbára kan tí a lè ṣi ní ipò láarín àwọn átọ̀mù inú ẹ̀dá kan.

source: The temperature of water increases when heated.
target: Ìgbóná omi a máa gùn sókè nígbàtí a bá gbé e gbóná.

source: Scientists use a thermometer to measure temperature.
target: Àwọn onímọ̀n-jinlẹ̀ a máa lo òṣùwọ̀n-ìgbóná láti díwọ̀n ìgbóná.

source: Light is a form of radiant energy that you can detect with your eyes.
target: Agbára ìtànná jẹ́ irú agbára atàn kan tí a lè fi ojú rí.

source: Sound energy is energy produced by sound vibrations.
target: Agbára Ìró jẹ́ agbára tó ṣẹ̀ wá láti gbígbọ̀n àwọn nkan tó ndún.

source: Force is any influence that causes an object to undergo a change in speed, direction, or shape.
target: Ipá jẹ́ òkùnfà tó le mú kí ẹ̀dá kan kí ó pa eré dà, tàbí kí ó yà lọ́nà rẹ̀, tàbí kí ó tilẹ̀ pa ìrí ara rẹ̀ dà.

source: Electricity is energy made available by the flow of electric charge through a conductor.
target: Agbára Okun-ará jẹ́ agbára tó di wíwà nípa ìṣọ̀n iye-àrá kan nínú òpó ìṣọ̀n-àrá.

source: A magnet attracts objects containing iron.
target: Òòfà a máa fa àwọn ohun tó ní irin sí ara rẹ̀.

source: Gravitational force is responsible for the weight of objects.
target: Ipá òòfà-ilẹ̀ ló máa fa kí nkan ní ìwọ̀n-ìwúwo.

source: The speed of an object is the rate at which its position changes with time.
target: Eré ohun kan jẹ́ ìwọ̀n-iye bí ipò rẹ̀ ṣe nyí pẹ̀lú àkókò.

source: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with time.
target: Ìdà-eré jẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìyípadà eré pẹ̀lú àkókò.

source: Friction is the force that opposes the motion of objects that touch.
target: Ìmúlẹ̀ jẹ́ ipá tí ó takò ìpapòdà àwọn nkan tí ó fi ara kàn.

source: Light travels at a speed of 299,792,458 meters per second in a vacuum.
target: Ìtànná a máa ṣọ̀n pẹ̀lú ìyásí 299,792,458 mítà ní ìṣísẹ̀ kan nínú afẹ́fẹ́ òfìfo.

source: Sound waves require a medium to travel through.
target: Agbọ̀n ìró nílò nkan kan láti gbà ṣọ̀n.

source: When you drop an object, it falls due to gravity.
target: Nígbàtí o bá ju nkan sílẹ̀, yóò ṣubú nítorí òòfà-ilẹ̀.

source: A mechanical wave is a wave that needs a medium to travel through.
target: Agbọ̀n ẹ̀rọ jẹ́ agbọ̀n tó nílò nkan láti gbà rin.

source: Energy can neither be created nor destroyed.
target: A kò lè dá agbára, bẹ́ẹ̀ni a kò lè pa agbára run.

source: The atomic theory states that all matter is made of atoms.
target: Àlàyé átọ̀mù sọ pé gbogbo àìdá jẹ́ akójọpọ̀ àwọn átọ̀mù.

source: The speed of sound in air is approximately 343 meters per second.
target: Ìyásí ìró nínú afẹ́ tó jẹ́ bí 343 mítà ní ìṣísẹ̀ kan.

source: Pressure is force per unit area.
target: Èéfún jẹ́ ipá fún àyè kan.

source: Air pressure decreases as altitude increases.
target: Èéfún afẹ́ a máa dínkù bí gíga bá ṣe npọ̀ sí i.

source: A lever is a simple machine that multiplies force.
target: Egbé jẹ́ ẹ̀rọ àkọ́dá tí ó nlọ ipá sí i.

source: An inclined plane makes it easier to lift heavy objects.
target: Pẹpẹ dídà a máa mú kí ó rọrùn láti gbé àwọn nkan wíwúwo sókè.

source: A pulley changes the direction of a force.
target: Afàwọ̀n a máa yí ipa ipá padà.

source: A screw is an inclined plane wrapped around a cylinder.
target: Ìdè jẹ́ pẹpẹ dídà tí a ká yí agolo.

source: A wheel and axle multiplies force or distance.
target: Ayíra àt'apòyì a máa mú kí ipá tàbí ìjìn pọ̀ sí i.

source: Velocity is speed in a given direction.
target: Ìyásí Ìpapòdà jẹ́ eré ní ipa kan.

source: Mass is a measure of how much matter is in an object.
target: Ìwọ̀n-okun jẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìwọ̀n àìdá tó wà nínú nkan kan.

source: Weight is the force exerted on an object due to gravity.
target: Ìwọ̀n-ìwúwo jẹ́ ipá tí òòfà-ilẹ̀ fi dé lórí nkan kan.

source: Volume is a measure of the amount of space occupied by an object.
target: Àyè jẹ́ ìwọ̀n iye ibi tí nkan kan gbà.

source: Density is mass per unit volume.
target: Ọ̀rìn jẹ́ ìwọ̀n-okun fún àyè kan.

source: Work is the product of force and displacement in the direction of force.
target: Iṣẹ́ jẹ́ ẹ̀sún ipá àti ìjìn ní ipa ipá.

source: Power is the rate at which work is done.
target: Ìgbóra jẹ́ ìyásí bí iṣẹ́ ṣe nṣe.

source: Kinetic energy is the energy of motion.
target: Agbára (nípa) ìmira jẹ́ agbára nípa ìpapòdà.

source: Potential energy is stored energy due to position or state.
target: Agbára (nípa) Ipò jẹ́ agbára tí a pamọ́ sí inú ẹ̀dá kan tàbí ètò kan nípa ipò ti nkan yi wà.

source: Heat is the transfer of thermal energy from one object to another.
target: Okun-iná jẹ́ ìṣínípò agbára ìgbóná láti ara nkan kan sí èkejì.

source: Temperature is a measure of the average kinetic energy of particles in a substance.
target: Ìgbóná jẹ́ ìwọ̀n àròpín agbára ìmira àwọn átọ̀mù inú ẹ̀dá kan.

source: Thermal expansion is the tendency of matter to change in shape, area, and volume in response to a change in temperature.
target: Ìgbóna-ìgbàyẹ̀ jẹ́ ìṣèwahù àìdá láti yípadà ní ìrísí, òrò, àti àyè nígbàtí ìgbóná bá yí padà.

source: Boyle's law states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature.
target: Òfin Boyle sọ pé èéfún òyì jẹ́ ìdà ìbátan sí àyè rẹ̀ ní ìgbóná aìyípadà.

source: Charles's law states that the volume of a gas is directly proportional to its temperature at constant pressure.
target: Òfin Charles sọ pé àyè òyì jẹ́ tààrà ìbátan sí ìgbóná rẹ̀ ní èéfún aìyípadà.

source: Hooke's law states that the extension of a spring is directly proportional to the force applied to it.
target: Òfin Hooke sọ pé ìnáró àwọ̀n jẹ́ tààrà ìbátan sí ipá tí a fi sí i.

source: Newton's first law of motion states that an object will remain at rest or in uniform motion unless acted upon by an external force.
target: Òfin ìpapòdà àkọ́kọ́ ti Newton sọ pé nkan kan yóò wà ní ìsinmi tàbí ní ìpapòdà déédé àyàfi tí ipá láti òde bá wà lórí rẹ̀.

source: Newton's second law of motion states that the acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.
target: Òfin ìpapòdà èkejì ti Newton sọ pé ìdà-eré ohun kan jẹ́ tààrà ìbátan sí ipá tó bá wà lórí rẹ̀ àti ìdà ìbátan sí ìwọ̀n-okun rẹ̀.

source: Newton's third law of motion states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
target: Òfin ìpapòdà èkẹta ti Newton sọ pé fún gbogbo ìṣesí, ìṣesí ìdápadà tí ó dọ́gba tí ó sì lòdì wà.

source: The law of conservation of energy states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.
target: Òfin ìpamọ́ agbára sọ pé a kò lè dá agbára tàbí pa agbára run, a lè kàn yí i padà láti orí kan sí èkejì.

source: The law of conservation of momentum states that the total momentum of a closed system remains constant.
target: Òfin ìpamọ́ ìyíparaḿọ́ sọ pé ìyíparaḿọ́ àpapọ̀ ètò tí a tì pa á jẹ́ déédé.

source: The Doppler effect is the change in frequency of a wave in relation to an observer who is moving relative to the wave source.
target: Àkóbá Doppler jẹ́ ìyípadà ní ìyásí agbọ̀n kan ní ìbátan sí olùwòran tí ó nṣe ìpapòdà ní ìbátan sí orísun agbọ̀n náà.

source: Diffraction is the bending of waves around obstacles or through openings.
target: Ìwọ́-agbọ̀n jẹ́ wíwọ́ agbọ̀n yí àwọn ìdènà tàbí láti inú àwọn ihò.

source: Interference is the phenomenon that occurs when two waves meet while traveling along the same medium.
target: Ìṣẹ́parapọ̀ jẹ́ ìṣẹlẹ̀ tí ó máa nṣẹlẹ̀ nígbàtí agbọ̀n méjì bá pàdé nígbàtí wọ́n ń lọ lórí nkan kan náà.

source: Reflection is the change in direction of a wave at a boundary between two different media.
target: Ìpadà-agbọ̀n jẹ́ ìyípadà ní ipa agbọ̀n kan ní aàlà láàrín àwọn nkan méjì tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: Refraction is the change in direction of a wave passing from one medium to another.
target: Ìṣẹ́-ìtànná jẹ́ ìyípadà ní ipa agbọ̀n kan tí ó nkọjá láti inú nkan kan sí òmíràn.

source: Static electricity is an imbalance of electric charges within or on the surface of a material.
target: Àrá-dúró jẹ́ àìdọ́gba àwọn iye-àrá nínú tàbí lórí ojú ohun kan.

source: Electric current is the flow of electric charge.
target: Ìsán-àrá jẹ́ ìṣọ̀n iye-àrá.

source: Voltage is the difference in electric potential between two points.
target: Ìgbóra-àrá jẹ́ ìyàtọ̀ ní agbára-àrá láàrín àwọn ojúlé méjì.

source: Resistance opposes the flow of electric current through a conductor.
target: Atako takò ìṣọ̀n ìsán-àrá láti inú onípa kan.

source: Ohm's law states that the current through a conductor is directly proportional to the voltage and inversely proportional to the resistance.
target: Òfin Ohm sọ pé ìsán-àrá láti inú onípa kan jẹ́ tààrà ìbátan sí ìgbóra-àrá àti ìdà ìbátan sí atako.

source: A series circuit provides only one path for electricity to flow.
target: Ìrìnpo tẹ̀lé-ara-wọn pèsè ọ̀nà kan fún àrá láti ṣọ̀n.

source: A parallel circuit provides multiple paths for electricity to flow.
target: Ìrìnpo apọ̀gbà pèsè ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọ̀nà fún àrá láti ṣọ̀n.

source: An electric motor converts electrical energy into mechanical energy.
target: Ẹ̀rọ àrá-yíyí yí agbára àrá padà sí agbára ẹ̀rọ.

source: A generator converts mechanical energy into electrical energy.
target: Ẹ̀rọ afaragbára yí agbára ẹ̀rọ padà sí agbára àrá.

source: A transformer changes the voltage of alternating current.
target: Ẹ̀rọ ayípadà-àrá yí ìgbóra-àrá ìsán-àrá ayípadà.

source: Electromagnetism is the interaction between electricity and magnetism.
target: Àrá-òòfà jẹ́ ìbáraṣepọ̀ láàrín àrá àti òòfà.

source: A magnetic field is the area around a magnet where its force can be detected.
target: Ìtẹ́ òòfà jẹ́ àgbègbè yí òòfà ka níbi tí a lè rí ipá rẹ̀.

source: An electromagnetic wave consists of oscillating electric and magnetic fields.
target: Agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà jẹ́ akójọpọ̀ ìtẹ́ àrá àti òòfà tí ó nmì.

source: Radio waves are electromagnetic waves with the longest wavelengths.
target: Agbọ̀n rédíò jẹ́ agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà pẹ̀lú ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n tí ó gùn jùlọ.

source: Microwaves are electromagnetic waves that cause water molecules to vibrate.
target: Agbọ̀n maikro jẹ́ agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà tí ó mú kí àwọn mólékù omi gbọ̀n.

source: Infrared waves are electromagnetic waves that we feel as heat.
target: Agbọ̀n infraredi jẹ́ agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà tí a lè mọ̀ bí okun-iná.

source: Visible light is the part of the electromagnetic spectrum that humans can see.
target: Ìtànná àfojúrí jẹ́ apá ti ìlànà agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà tí ènìyàn lè rí.

source: Ultraviolet waves have higher frequencies than visible light.
target: Agbọ̀n arekojaosorun ní ìyásí tí ó ga ju ìtànná àfojúrí lọ.

source: X-rays are high-energy electromagnetic waves used in medical imaging.
target: Agbọ̀n ekisi jẹ́ agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà alágbára-gíga tí a nlò fún àwòrán ìṣègùn.

source: Gamma rays are the highest-energy electromagnetic waves.
target: Agbọ̀n gamma jẹ́ agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà tí ó ní agbára-gíga jùlọ.

source: The electromagnetic spectrum is the range of all possible frequencies of electromagnetic radiation.
target: Ìlànà agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà jẹ́ àkójọ gbogbo àwọn ìyásí tí ó ṣeéṣe ti ìtànká àrá-òòfà.

source: Einstein's theory of relativity describes how time and space are not absolute but relative to the observer's frame of reference.
target: Àlàyé ìbátan ti Einstein ṣe àpejúwe bí àkókò àti àyè-ayé kò ṣe jẹ́ déédéé ṣùgbọ́n ó jẹ́ ìbátan sí ètò ìtọ́kasí olùwòran.

source: The theory of quantum mechanics describes the physical properties of nature at the scale of atoms and subatomic particles.
target: Àlàyé ìṣirò onírínlẹ́ ṣe àpejúwe àwọn ìṣesí afojúrí ti àyànmọ́ ní ìwọ̀n àwọn átọ̀mù àti àwọn ẹ̀yá-átọ̀mù.

source: In physics, time is considered the fourth dimension.
target: Ní ẹ̀kọ́ nípa-ẹ̀dá, a ka àkókò sí ìwọ̀n kẹrin.

source: Entropy is a measure of disorder or randomness in a system.
target: Ìdàrú jẹ́ ìwọ̀n àìṣetò tàbí àìṣepàtó nínú ètò kan.

source: Amplitude is the maximum displacement of a wave from its equilibrium position.
target: Ìjì jẹ́ ìyàtọ̀-ipò tí ó pọ̀jùlọ ti agbọ̀n kan láti ibi agbede rẹ̀.

source: The frequency of a wave is the number of complete oscillations per unit time.
target: Ìyásí agbọ̀n kan jẹ́ iye ìmì pípé fún àkókò kan.

source: The wavelength of a wave is the distance between two consecutive corresponding points on the wave.
target: Ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n kan jẹ́ ìjìn láàrín àwọn ojúlé méjì tí ó tẹ̀lé ara wọn lórí agbọ̀n náà.

source: A longitudinal wave oscillates in the same direction as the wave travels.
target: Agbọ̀n olóòró máa nmì ní ipa kan náà bí agbọ̀n náà ṣe nrin.

source: A transverse wave oscillates perpendicular to the direction of travel.
target: Agbọ̀n oníbú máa nmì ní ipa tí ó takọ sí ipa tí agbọ̀n náà nrin.

source: Standing waves appear to be stationary, with nodes that do not move.
target: Agbọ̀n adúró dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n dúró jẹ́ẹ́, pẹ̀lú àwọn ìkọ tí kò ní ìpapòdà.

source: Resonance is the tendency of a system to oscillate with greater amplitude at some frequencies than at others.
target: Ìbáwọnkadùn jẹ́ ìṣèwahù ètò kan láti mì pẹ̀lú ìjì tí ó pọ̀ ní àwọn ìyásí kan ju ni àwọn mìíràn.

source: The Doppler effect explains why the pitch of a sound changes as its source moves toward or away from the observer.
target: Àkóbá Doppler ṣe àlàyé ìdí tí ohùn ìró fi yí padà bí orísun rẹ̀ ṣe nsúnmọ́ tàbí jìnà sí olùwòran.

source: Light behaves both as a wave and as a particle, a property known as wave-particle duality.
target: Ìtànná hùwà bí agbọ̀n àti bí àyẹ̀lẹ̀, èyí tí a mọ̀ sí ìkannimejì agbọ̀n-àyẹ̀lẹ̀.

source: In a vacuum, all electromagnetic waves travel at the same speed, the speed of light.
target: Nínú òfìfo, gbogbo agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà máa ṣọ̀n ní ìyásí kan náà, ìyásí ìtànná.

source: The photoelectric effect is the emission of electrons when light shines on a material.
target: Àkóbá ìtànná-àrá jẹ́ ìtúsílẹ̀ àwọn ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù nígbàtí ìtànná bá tan lórí ohun kan.

source: According to Heisenberg's uncertainty principle, it is impossible to simultaneously know both the position and the momentum of a particle with perfect accuracy.
target: Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìlànà àìdá kan ti Heisenberg, kò ṣeéṣe láti mọ ipò àti ìyíparaḿọ́ àyẹ̀lẹ̀ kan pẹ̀lú ìdádéédé pípé.

source: The Big Bang theory proposes that the universe began as a singularity, which expanded over time.
target: Àlàyé Ariwo-nlá náà dábàá pé àgbáyé bẹ̀rẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣọ̀kan, èyí tí ó gbòòrò pẹ̀lú àkókò.

source: Black holes are regions of spacetime where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape from it.
target: Ihò-dúdú jẹ́ àwọn agbègbè ti àyé-àkókò níbi tí òòfà-ilẹ̀ ti lágbára tóbẹ́ẹ̀ tí kò sí ohun, kódà ìtànná, tí ó lè bọ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀.

source: Nuclear fission is the splitting of an atomic nucleus into smaller parts.
target: Pínpín-àgọ́ jẹ́ pínpín àgọ́ átọ̀mù sí àwọn apá kékeré.

source: Nuclear fusion is the joining of two atomic nuclei to form a heavier nucleus.
target: Ìdàpọ̀-àgọ́ jẹ́ ìdàpọ̀ àwọn àgọ́ átọ̀mù méjì láti ṣẹ̀dá àgọ́ tí ó wúwo.

source: A sound wave is a mechanical wave that transfers energy through a medium by compressing and expanding it.
target: Agbọ̀n ìró jẹ́ agbọ̀n ẹ̀rọ tí ó nṣínípò agbára láti inú nkan kan nípa fífúnpọ̀ àti gbígbòòrò rẹ̀.

source: The speed of sound depends on the medium through which it travels.
target: Ìyásí ìró dá lórí nkan tí ó ngbà rin.

source: The pitch of a sound is determined by its frequency.
target: Gígajù ìró jẹ́ ìpinnu nípa ìyásí rẹ̀.

source: The loudness of a sound is determined by its amplitude.
target: Rírọpò ìró jẹ́ ìpinnu nípa ìjì rẹ̀.

source: In a simple pendulum, the period of oscillation depends on the length of the pendulum and the acceleration due to gravity.
target: Nínú àsokọ́ rọ́gọ́dọ́, àsìkò ìmì dá lórí gígùn àsokọ́ náà àti ìdà-eré nítorí òòfà-ilẹ̀.

source: The center of mass of an object is the point at which the object's mass can be considered to be concentrated.
target: Àárín ìwọ̀n-okun ohun kan jẹ́ ojúlé tí a lè ka ìwọ̀n-okun ohun náà sí bí ẹni pé ó kójọ sí.

source: A rigid body is an object whose size and shape do not change when forces are applied to it.
target: Ara líle jẹ́ ohun tí ìwọ̀n àti ìrísí rẹ̀ kò ní yípadà nígbàtí a bá fi ipá sí i.

source: The moment of inertia of an object determines its resistance to changes in rotation.
target: Ìgbà ti ìfaragbéra ohun kan pinnu ìtakò rẹ̀ sí àwọn ìyípadà ní ìyípo.

source: Angular momentum is a measure of the rotational motion of an object.
target: Ìyíparaḿọ́-ayípo jẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìpapòdà ìyípo ohun kan.

source: The law of conservation of angular momentum states that the angular momentum of a closed system remains constant.
target: Òfin ìpamọ́ ìyíparaḿọ́-ayípo sọ pé ìyíparaḿọ́-ayípo ètò tí a tì pa á wà bakannáà.

source: The principle of superposition states that when two or more waves overlap, the resultant displacement at any point is the algebraic sum of the displacements due to each individual wave.
target: Ìlànà ìṣàfikún sọ pé nígbàtí agbọ̀n méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ bá borí ara wọn, iyàtọ̀-ipò àbájáde ní ojúlé kankan jẹ́ àròpọ̀ ìṣirò àwọn iyàtọ̀-ipò nítorí ẹyọ agbọ̀n kọ̀ọ̀kan.

source: A wave pulse is a single disturbance that travels through a medium.
target: Ìgbàdí agbọ̀n jẹ́ ìdàrúdàpọ̀ kan tí ó nrin láti inú nkan kan.

source: The phase of a wave describes its position within its cycle of oscillation.
target: Ipele agbọ̀n ṣe àpejúwe ipò rẹ̀ nínú àyíká ìmì rẹ̀.

source: Constructive interference occurs when wave displacements add together.
target: Ìṣẹ́parapọ̀ kíkọ́ ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbàtí àwọn iyàtọ̀-ipò agbọ̀n ṣàfikún ara wọn.

source: Destructive interference occurs when wave displacements subtract from each other.
target: Ìṣẹ́parapọ̀ fífọ́ ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbàtí àwọn iyàtọ̀-ipò agbọ̀n ṣàyọkúrò láti ara wọn.

source: The fundamental frequency is the lowest frequency at which a vibrating object oscillates.
target: Ìyásí ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jẹ́ ìyásí tí ó kéré jùlọ níbi tí ohun tí ó nmì ti máa gbọ̀n.

source: Harmonics are frequencies that are integer multiples of the fundamental frequency.
target: Ìyásí-ìbáwọnkadùn jẹ́ àwọn ìyásí tí ó jẹ́ ìṣọdipúpọ̀ nọ́mbà odidi ti ìyásí ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀.

source: Torque is a force that causes rotation around an axis.
target: Ipá-ẹ̀lọ́ jẹ́ ipá tí ó fa ìyípo yí àpóyì kan.

source: A force that is perpendicular to the moment arm produces the maximum torque.
target: Ipá tí ó takọ sí apá-ìgbà fún ipá-ẹ̀lọ́ tí ó pọ̀jùlọ.

source: The center of gravity of an object is the point at which all of its weight can be considered to act.
target: Àárín òòfà-ilẹ̀ ohun kan jẹ́ ojúlé níbi tí gbogbo ìwọ̀n-ìwúwo rẹ̀ lè ṣe.

source: An object is said to be in equilibrium when the sum of all forces acting on it is zero.
target: A sọ pé ohun kan wà ní agbede nígbàtí àròpọ̀ gbogbo ipá tí ó wà lórí rẹ̀ jẹ́ òdo.

source: An object in static equilibrium is at rest.
target: Ohun kan ní agbede-àìpapòdà wà ní ìsinmi.

source: An object in dynamic equilibrium moves with constant velocity.
target: Ohun kan ní agbede-apapòdà yí pẹ̀lú ìyásí-ìpapòdà aìyípadà.

source: The distance between two consecutive crests or troughs of a wave is called the wavelength.
target: Ìjìn láàrín àwọn gègélè méjì tàbí àfọ̀ méjì tí ó tẹ̀lé ara wọn lórí agbọ̀n kan jẹ́ ohun tí a npè ní ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n.

source: The speed of a wave is equal to its frequency multiplied by its wavelength.
target: Ìyásí agbọ̀n kan dọ́gba pẹ̀lú ìyásí rẹ̀ ìsọdipúpọ̀ pẹ̀lú ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n rẹ̀.

source: When a wave passes from one medium to another, its frequency remains constant, but its wavelength changes.
target: Nígbàtí agbọ̀n kan bá kọjá láti inú nkan kan sí òmíràn, ìyásí rẹ̀ wà bakannáà, ṣùgbọ́n ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n rẹ̀ yí padà.

source: The index of refraction of a medium is the ratio of the speed of light in a vacuum to the speed of light in the medium.
target: Òkà ìṣẹ́-ìtànná ti nkan kan jẹ́ ìbùpín ìyásí ìtànná nínú òfìfo sí ìyásí ìtànná nínú nkan náà.

source: When light slows down as it enters a medium, it bends toward the normal.
target: Nígbàtí ìtànná bá dín ìyásí rẹ̀ kù bí ó ṣe wọ inú nkan kan, ó máa ṣe wíwọ́ sí àdọ́jú.

source: When light speeds up as it exits a medium, it bends away from the normal.
target: Nígbàtí ìtànná bá ṣe ìyásí rẹ̀ pọ̀ bí ó ṣe jáde nínú nkan kan, ó máa ṣe wíwọ́ kúrò ní àdọ́jú.

source: The angle of incidence is the angle between the incident ray and the normal to the surface at the point of incidence.
target: Igun ìkọlù jẹ́ igun láàrín ìtànná tí ó kọlù àti àdọ́jú sí ojú-ara ní ojúlé ìkọlù.

source: The angle of reflection is the angle between the reflected ray and the normal to the surface at the point of reflection.
target: Igun ìpadà jẹ́ igun láàrín ìtànná tí ó padà àti àdọ́jú sí ojú-ara ní ojúlé ìpadà.

source: The law of reflection states that the angle of reflection equals the angle of incidence.
target: Òfin ìpadà sọ pé igun ìpadà dọ́gba pẹ̀lú igun ìkọlù.

source: The law of refraction, also known as Snell's law, relates the angles of incidence and refraction to the refractive indices of the two media.
target: Òfin ìṣẹ́-ìtànná, tí a mọ̀ sí òfin Snell, ṣe àlàyé igun ìkọlù àti ìṣẹ́-ìtànná sí àwọn òkà ìṣẹ́-ìtànná ti àwọn nkan méjì.

source: A convex lens converges parallel light rays to a focus.
target: Awòye oníkùn ṣe ìkójọ àwọn ìtànná apọ̀gbà sí ibi ìfọkànsí.

source: A concave lens diverges parallel light rays.
target: Awòye onínú ṣe ìtúká àwọn ìtànná apọ̀gbà.

source: A convex mirror forms a virtual, upright, and diminished image of an object placed in front of it.
target: Awòji oníkùn ṣẹ̀dá àwòrán òrò, tí ó dúró, tí ó sì dín kù ti ohun kan tí a fi sí iwájú rẹ̀.

source: A concave mirror can form either a real or a virtual image depending on the position of the object.
target: Awòji onínú lè ṣẹ̀dá bóyá àwòrán gidi tàbí òrò ní dá lórí ipò ohun náà.

source: The focal length of a mirror is the distance from the mirror to the focal point.
target: Gígùn ìfokànsí ti awonji jẹ́ ìjìn láti awonji sí ojúlé ìfokànsí.

source: The magnification of an image is the ratio of the image height to the object height.
target: Ìfẹ̀ àwòrán jẹ́ ìbùpín gíga àwòrán sí gíga ohun.

source: The lens equation relates the object distance, image distance, and focal length of a lens.
target: Ọ̀mì awòye ṣe àlàyé ìjìn ohun, ìjìn àwòrán, àti gígùn ìfokànsí ti awòye.

source: Magnification is positive for upright images and negative for inverted images.
target: Ìfẹ̀ jẹ́ àbáyo fún àwọn àwòrán tí ó dúró àti èyí tí ó jẹ́ àdákẹndé fún àwọn àwòrán tí a dojú kodò.

source: A virtual image cannot be projected onto a screen, but a real image can.
target: A kò lè fi àwòrán òrò hàn lórí ìbọ, ṣùgbọ́n a lè fi àwòrán gidi hàn.

source: The refractive power of a lens is measured in diopters, which is the reciprocal of the focal length in meters.
target: A díwọ̀n agbára ìṣẹ́-ìtànná ti awòye ní diopters, èyí tí ó jẹ́ ìpadà ìgbùpín ti gígùn ìfokànsí ní mítà.

source: Radioactivity is the spontaneous emission of particles or energy from the nucleus of an atom.
target: Ìtànká aláfirahàn jẹ́ ìtúsílẹ̀ àìgbọdọ̀lọ́wọ́ àwọn àyẹ̀lẹ̀ tàbí agbára láti inú àgọ́ átọ̀mù.

source: Alpha radiation consists of helium nuclei.
target: Ìtànká álifà jẹ́ akójọpọ̀ àwọn àgọ́ hélíọ̀mù.

source: Beta radiation consists of electrons.
target: Ìtànká bẹ́tà jẹ́ akójọpọ̀ àwọn ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù.

source: Gamma radiation consists of high-energy photons.
target: Ìtànká gámmà jẹ́ akójọpọ̀ àwọn fótọ̀nù alágbára-gíga.

source: The half-life of a radioactive isotope is the time it takes for half of the atoms in a sample to decay.
target: Ìdajì-ìgbà ti isotope aláfirahàn jẹ́ àkókò tí ó gbà fún ìdajì àwọn átọ̀mù nínú àpẹẹrẹ kan láti bàjẹ́.

source: In nuclear fission, a heavy nucleus splits into lighter nuclei, releasing energy.
target: Nínú pínpín-àgọ́, àgọ́ wíwúwo kan pín sí àwọn àgọ́ fífẹ́, tí ó sì túsílẹ̀ agbára.

source: In nuclear fusion, light nuclei combine to form a heavier nucleus, releasing energy.
target: Nínú ìdàpọ̀-àgọ́, àwọn àgọ́ fífẹ́ dàpọ̀ láti ṣẹ̀dá àgọ́ wíwúwo, tí ó sì túsílẹ̀ agbára.

source: The energy released in nuclear reactions comes from the conversion of mass to energy according to Einstein's equation, E = mc².
target: Agbára tí a túsílẹ̀ nínú àwọn àsè àgọ́ wá láti ìyípadà ìwọ̀n-okun sí agbára ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ọ̀mì Einstein, E = mc².

source: The strong nuclear force holds protons and neutrons together in the nucleus.
target: Ipá àgọ́ lágbára faramọ́ àwọn pròtónù àti niútírọ̀nù papọ̀ nínú àgọ́.

source: The weak nuclear force is responsible for radioactive decay.
target: Ipá àgọ́ aláìlágbára ló dá fún ìbàjẹ́ aláfirahàn.

source: In a cathode ray tube, electrons are accelerated through an electric field.
target: Nínú òpó ìtànká kàtódì, a mú àwọn ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù ṣe ìdà-eré láti inú ìtẹ́ àrá.

source: The photoelectric effect provides evidence for the particle nature of light.
target: Àkóbá ìtànná-àrá pèsè ẹ̀rí fún ìwà àyẹ̀lẹ̀ ti ìtànná.

source: Quantum mechanics describes the behavior of matter and energy at the atomic and subatomic scale.
target: Ìṣirò onírínlẹ́ ṣe àpejúwe ìwà ti ohun àti agbára ní ìwọ̀n átọ̀mù àti ẹ̀yá-átọ̀mù.

source: According to the uncertainty principle, the more precisely the position of a particle is known, the less precisely its momentum can be determined, and vice versa.
target: Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú ìlànà àìdá kan, bí a bá mọ ipò àyẹ̀lẹ̀ kan pẹ̀lú ìdádéédé ju, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni a ó dín mọ̀ ìyíparaḿọ́ rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìdádéédé kù, àti lọ́tùn-ún.

source: The principle of wave-particle duality states that all matter and energy exhibit both wave-like and particle-like properties.
target: Ìlànà ìkannimejì agbọ̀n-àyẹ̀lẹ̀ sọ pé gbogbo ohun àti agbára ṣe àfihàn àwọn ìṣesí bí agbọ̀n àti bí àyẹ̀lẹ̀.

source: Waves and particles have complementary properties.
target: Agbọ̀n àti àwọn àyẹ̀lẹ̀ ní àwọn ìṣesí aṣebápáda.

source: Electrons can behave as waves, as demonstrated by electron diffraction experiments.
target: Àwọn ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù lè hùwà bí agbọ̀n, bí a ṣe fihàn nípa àwọn àdánwò fífọ́ ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù.

source: The Schrödinger equation describes how the quantum state of a physical system changes over time.
target: Ọ̀mì Schrödinger ṣe àpejúwe bí ipò onírínlẹ́ ti ètò afojúrí ṣe yí padà pẹ̀lú àkókò.

source: A quantum state is described by a wave function.
target: A ṣe àpejúwe ipò onírínlẹ́ nípa ìṣe agbọ̀n.

source: The square of the wave function gives the probability of finding a particle at a specific location.
target: Igun méjì ìṣe agbọ̀n fún ìṣeéṣe ti ríran àyẹ̀lẹ̀ kan ní ibikibí.

source: Electrons in an atom occupy specific energy levels or orbitals.
target: Àwọn ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù nínú átọ̀mù kan gbà àwọn ipele agbára tàbí àgbàyí.

source: The Pauli exclusion principle states that no two electrons in an atom can have the same set of quantum numbers.
target: Ìlànà ìfẹrígba Pauli sọ pé kò sí ẹlẹ́tírọ̀nù méjì nínú átọ̀mù kan tí ó lè ní àkójọ nọ́mbà onírínlẹ́ kan náà.

source: The Heisenberg uncertainty principle is a fundamental limit to the precision with which complementary variables can be known.
target: Ìlànà àìdá kan Heisenberg jẹ́ ìdí ìpilẹ̀ sí ìdádéédé pẹ̀lú èyí tí a lè mọ àwọn onídọ̀gba aṣebápáda.

source: Space and time are not separate entities but are intertwined in a four-dimensional continuum called spacetime.
target: Àyè àti àkókò kì í ṣe àwọn ẹ̀dá tí ó tọ́jọ ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n papọ̀ nínú àìlọsíbọmíràn onípakọ̀rín tí a npè ní àyé-àkókò.

source: The speed of light in a vacuum is the same for all observers, regardless of their motion.
target: Ìyásí ìtànná nínú òfìfo jẹ́ bakannáà fún gbogbo olùwòran, láìnífẹ̀ẹ́ sí ìpapòdà wọn.

source: The energy of a photon is proportional to its frequency.
target: Agbára ti fótọ̀nù kan jẹ́ ìbátan sí ìyásí rẹ̀.

source: Electromagnetic waves do not require a medium to travel through.
target: Àwọn agbọ̀n àrá-òòfà kò nílò nkan kan láti gbà rin.

source: The speed of light in a medium is less than its speed in a vacuum.
target: Ìyásí ìtànná nínú nkan kan kéré ju ìyásí rẹ̀ nínú òfìfo.

source: The refraction of light occurs due to the change in its speed as it passes from one medium to another.
target: Ìṣẹ́-ìtànná ti ìtànná ṣẹlẹ̀ nítorí ìyípadà ní ìyásí rẹ̀ bí ó ṣe kọjá láti inú nkan kan sí òmíràn.

source: A black body is an idealized physical body that absorbs all incident electromagnetic radiation.
target: Ara dúdú jẹ́ ara afojúrí tí a ṣe àfojúsùn tí ó nfàmun gbogbo ìtànká àrá-òòfà tí ó kọlù.

source: A black body emits thermal radiation with a spectrum that depends only on its temperature.
target: Ara dúdú túsílẹ̀ ìtànká ìgbóná pẹ̀lú ìlànà tí ó dá lórí ìgbóná rẹ̀ nìkan.

source: The Stefan-Boltzmann law describes the power radiated from a black body in terms of its temperature.
target: Òfin Stefan-Boltzmann ṣe àpejúwe agbára tí a tàn láti ara dúdú ní ọ̀rọ̀ ìgbóná rẹ̀.

source: Wien's displacement law states that the wavelength at which a black body emits the most energy is inversely proportional to its temperature.
target: Òfin ìyàtọ̀-ipò Wien sọ pé ìgbọ̀n agbọ̀n níbi tí ara dúdú ti túsílẹ̀ agbára tí ó pọ̀jùlọ jẹ́ ìdà ìbátan sí ìgbóná rẹ̀.

source: The greenhouse effect is the warming of Earth due to the trapping of thermal radiation by greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.
target: Àkóbá ilé-ẹwà jẹ́ ìgbóná Ilẹ̀ Ayé nítorí ìdànímọ́lẹ̀ ìtànká ìgbóná nípa àwọn òyì ilé-ẹwà nínú òyì-ojú ayé.

source: Greenhouse gases include carbon dioxide, methane, and water vapor.
target: Àwọn òyì ilé-ẹwà pẹ̀lú òyì-èédú, mẹ́téènì, àti èéhó omi.

source: The Doppler effect explains why the frequency of a wave appears to change when its source moves relative to an observer.
target: Àkóbá Doppler ṣe àlàyé ìdí tí ìyásí agbọ̀n fi dàbí ẹni pé ó yí padà nígbàtí orísun rẹ̀ bá ṣe ìpapòdà ní ìbátan sí olùwòran.

source: When a wave source moves toward an observer, the observed frequency is higher than the emitted frequency.
target: Nígbàtí orísun agbọ̀n bá ṣe ìpapòdà sí olùwòran, ìyásí tí a ríi ga ju ìyásí tí a túsílẹ̀ lọ.

source: When a wave source moves away from an observer, the observed frequency is lower than the emitted frequency.
target: Nígbàtí orísun agbọ̀n bá ṣe ìpapòdà kúrò ní olùwòran, ìyásí tí a ríi kéré ju ìyásí tí a túsílẹ̀ lọ.

source: The Doppler effect is used in radar to determine the speed of moving objects.
target: A nlò àkóbá Doppler nínú rédà láti pinnu ìyásí àwọn ohun tí ó nṣe ìpapòdà.

source: The Doppler shift in light causes a blueshift when the source moves toward the observer and a redshift when it moves away.
target: Ìyílọ́ Doppler nínú ìtànná fa ìyípò-sí-àwọ̀-bùlúù nígbàtí orísun bá ṣe ìpapòdà sí olùwòran àti ìyípò-sí-àwọ̀-pupa nígbàtí ó bá ṣe ìpapòdà kúrò.

source: The expansion of the universe is indicated by the redshift of distant galaxies.
target: Ìgbòòrò àgbáyé jẹ́ ìfihàn nípa ìyípò-sí-àwọ̀-pupa ti àwọn àjọọ̀ràwọ̀ tí ó jìn.

source: Fluid mechanics is the study of how fluids (liquids and gases) behave when they are in motion or at rest.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ẹ̀rọ aṣàn jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ bí àwọn aṣàn (àwọn aṣàn àti àwọn òyì) ṣe hùwà nígbàtí wọ́n wà ní ìpapòdà tàbí ní ìsinmi.

source: Pressure in a fluid increases with depth.
target: Èéfún nínú aṣàn pọ̀ pẹ̀lú jíjìn.

source: Pascal's principle states that pressure applied to an enclosed fluid is transmitted undiminished to all portions of the fluid and to the walls of the container.
target: Ìlànà Pascal sọ pé èéfún tí a fi sí aṣàn tí a dí mọ́lẹ̀ jẹ́ ìfiránṣẹ́ láìdínkù sí gbogbo àwọn apá ti aṣàn náà àti sí àwọn ògiri ti ìbà náà.

source: Archimedes' principle states that the buoyant force on an object immersed in a fluid is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object.
target: Ìlànà Archimedes sọ pé ipá àfọn lórí ohun tí a ri sínú aṣàn dọ́gba pẹ̀lú ìwọ̀n-ìwúwo aṣàn tí ohun náà yípò padà.

source: An object will float in a fluid if its density is less than that of the fluid.
target: Ohun kan yóò fò nínú aṣàn kan bí ọ̀rìn rẹ̀ bá kéré ju ti aṣàn náà lọ.

source: Bernoulli's principle states that as the speed of a fluid increases, the pressure within the fluid decreases.
target: Ìlànà Bernoulli sọ pé bí ìyásí aṣàn kan ṣe npọ̀ sí i, bẹ́ẹ̀ ni èéfún nínú aṣàn náà ṣe ndín kù.

source: The flow of a fluid can be either laminar or turbulent.
target: Ìṣọ̀n aṣàn kan lè jẹ́ bóyá oníìpele tàbí oníìrúbọ́.

source: Laminar flow occurs when a fluid flows in parallel layers with no disruption between the layers.
target: Ìṣọ̀n oníìpele ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbàtí aṣàn kan bá nṣọ̀n ní àwọn ìpele apọ̀gbà láìsí ìdàrúdàpọ̀ láàrín àwọn ìpele.

source: Turbulent flow is characterized by chaotic, irregular fluctuations.
target: Ìṣọ̀n oníìrúbọ́ jẹ́ ìfihàn nípa àwọn ìparadà àìṣètò, àìṣeé.

source: The viscosity of a fluid is a measure of its resistance to deformation at a given flow rate.
target: Ìtẹnilọ́rùn aṣàn jẹ́ ìwọ̀n ìtakò rẹ̀ sí ìyípadà ní ìyásí ìṣọ̀n tí a fún.

source: The Reynolds number is a dimensionless number that helps predict flow patterns in different fluid flow situations.
target: Nọ́mbà Reynolds jẹ́ nọ́mbà aláìníìpakọ̀rín tí ó nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ láti ṣe àsọtẹ́lẹ̀ àwọn àpẹẹrẹ ìṣọ̀n ní àwọn ipò ìṣọ̀n aṣàn tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: The continuity equation states that in a steady flow, the mass flow rate is the same at all points along a streamline.
target: Ọ̀mì àìlóṣiṣẹ́ sọ pé nínú ìṣọ̀n déédé, ìyásí ìṣọ̀n ìwọ̀n-okun jẹ́ bakannáà ní gbogbo àwọn ojúlé lórí ìlà ìṣọ̀n.

source: A sonic boom is produced when an object travels through the air faster than the speed of sound.
target: A ṣẹ̀dá ariwo ìró nígbàtí ohun kan bá rin láti inú afẹ́ ju ìyásí ìró lọ.

source: The shock wave created by an object traveling at supersonic speeds forms a cone, known as the Mach cone.
target: Agbọ̀n ìdojú tí a ṣẹ̀dá nípa ohun kan tí ó rin ní àwọn ìyásí tí ó kọjá èyí ti ìró ṣẹ̀dá kọnu, tí a mọ̀ sí kọnu Mach.

source: The Mach number is the ratio of an object's speed to the speed of sound in the medium through which the object is traveling.
target: Nọ́mbà Mach jẹ́ ìbùpín ìyásí ohun kan sí ìyásí ìró nínú nkan tí ohun náà ngbà rin.

source: Thermodynamics is the study of heat and its transformation into other forms of energy.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ìgbóna-kíka jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ okun-iná àti ìyípadà rẹ̀ sí àwọn orí míran ti agbára.

source: The zeroth law of thermodynamics states that if two systems are each in thermal equilibrium with a third system, they are in thermal equilibrium with each other.
target: Òfin kẹfá ti ẹ̀kọ́ ìgbóna-kíka sọ pé bí ètò méjì bá wà ní agbede ìgbóná pẹ̀lú ètò kẹta, wọ́n wà ní agbede ìgbóná pẹ̀lú ara wọn.

source: Agriculture is the cultivation of animals, plants, fungi and other life forms for food, fiber, and other products used to sustain life.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀gbìn (Ẹ̀kọ́ ìroko) jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìtọ́jú àwọn ẹranko, àwọn ọ̀gbìn, àwọn osunwuuru at'àwọn ohun alààyè miran fún jíjẹ, fún oran at'àwọn ẹ̀sún miran tó wà fún ìtọ́jú emi.

source: Agriculture was a key advancement in the rise of human civilization.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ọ̀gbìn jẹ́ nkan gbogi tó ṣẹ̀dá amuwa ilaju fún ọmọ-ènìyàn.

source: Farming of domesticated species created food surpluses that enabled the development of civilization.
target: Ìroko nípa sísọ àwọn di ẹranko-ilé jẹ́kí onjẹ wopo, eléyi sì mú kí ìdàgbàsókè nínú ilaju bá ọmọ ènìyàn.

source: Fertilizer is a chemical substance that is added to soil to give it more nutrients.
target: Ajílẹ̀ jẹ́ oríṣi ẹlà kan tí a nbù sí ilẹ̀ láti fún un ní èròjà sí i.

source: Soil erosion is the process by which soil is gradually removed by the rain, wind, or sea from a region of the Earth's surface.
target: Ilẹ̀ẹ́yìnrìn jẹ́ ọ̀nà bí àgbàrá òjò, atẹ́gùn tàbí ríru omi òkun ṣe ngbá ilẹ̀ lọ láti àwọn orí ilẹ̀ ayé kan.

source: Gardening is the practice of growing and cultivating plants.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìroko ọ̀gbìn jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ifurugbin àti ìroko àwọn ohun ọ̀gbìn.

source: Animal husbandry is the practice of breeding and raising livestock.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìroko ẹran-ọ̀sìn jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ itoju àti idagbasoke àwọn ẹran-ọ̀sìn.

source: Agronomy is the science and technology of producing and using plants for food, fuel, feed, and fiber.
target: Ẹ̀kọ́ ìlò èrè-oko jẹ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ àti ìmọ̀-ẹ̀rọ nípa ìṣẹ̀dá àti lílò àwọn ohun-ọ̀gbìn fún onjẹ, ohun ìdáná, onjẹ ẹran-ọ̀sìn, àti ohun ríran.

source: Weather is the state of the atmosphere, whether it is hot or cold, wet or dry, calm or stormy, clear or cloudy.
target: Ojú-ọjọ́ jẹ́ ipò tí òyì-ojú ayé wa, yálà, ó gbóná ni tàbí ó tutù ni, ó rẹ ni tàbí ó gbẹ ni, o dákẹ́rọ́rọ́ ni tàbí ó nfẹ́ ìjì ni, ó mọ́ ṣákálá ni tàbì ó kún fún ìkúùkù.

source: The farmer plows the land before planting his crops.
target: Àgbẹ̀ ntú ilẹ̀ kó tó fúnrúgbìn rẹ̀.

source: She uses a hoe to remove weeds from her garden.
target: Ó nlo ọkọ́ láti mu èpò kúrò nínú ọgbà rẹ̀.

source: Irrigation systems help farmers water their crops during dry seasons.
target: Ètò ìbomirin nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún àwọn àgbẹ̀ láti fún ọ̀gbìn wọn ní omi ní àsìkò èèrùn.
