source: Hormones are chemical messengers in the body.
target: Àwọn ojera jé̩ àwọn ẹlà tí a túsílè̩ láti àwọn ẹṣé̩-àìlópo sínú òpó èjè̩.̣

source: The pituitary gland is known as the master gland.
target: Ẹṣé̩ ìdí-ọpọlọ jé̩ olórí àwọn ẹṣé̩ ojera.

source: The reproductive system enables organisms to produce offspring.
target: Ètò bíbí ara jé̩ ètò àwọn èyà kan nínú àwọn èdá-oníyè tí wó̩n nbá ara ṣiṣé̩ fún bíbí.

source: The pancreas produces insulin to regulate blood sugar.
target: Èdò̩-òrónro nṣèdá ìnísúlìn tí ó ń ṣe àtóṣónà oníjẹ̀ inú èjẹ̀.

source: Muscles work by contracting and relaxing.
target: Àwọn iṣan ń ṣiṣé̩ nípa fífàsí àti títún ara sílẹ̀.

source: Bones provide structure and protection for internal organs.
target: Eegun nṣe ìtójú àti ìdáàbò bo àwọn èyà inú ara.

source: The brain controls all body functions.
target: Ọpọlọ jé̩ olùdarí gbogbo àwọn iṣé̩ ara.

source: Arteries carry oxygenated blood away from the heart.
target: Àwọn ìṣòw-èjè̩ ̣àlọ gbé èjẹ̀ olóyi-iná kúrò láti ọkàn.

source: Veins return deoxygenated blood to the heart.
target: Àwọn ìṣòn-èjè̩ ̣àbò̩ ̣nṣe ìdápadà èjẹ̀ alòyì-iná lọ sí ọkàn.

source: The liver detoxifies harmful substances in the blood.
target: Èdò̩ ̣nṣe ìwẹ̀nùmọ́ àwọn ohun olóró inú èjẹ̀.

source: The excretory system removes waste products from the body.
target: Ètò ìkégbin ara nṣe ìmúkúrò àwọn ègbin tí àwọn pádi ara ti ṣèdá.

source: Enzymes are biological catalysts that speed up chemical reactions.
target: Àwọn ẹnísáìmù jé̩ àwọn aṣètúnṣe tí ó ń mú kí àwọn àṣe ẹlà ṣẹlẹ̀ níṣàrà.

source: Genetics is the study of heredity and variation.
target: Èkó̩ ìtàn-ìran jé̩ ìwádìí ìjọsípò àti ìyàtò̩ nínú àwọn èdá.

source: DNA carries the genetic instructions for development and functioning.
target: DNA ni ó ń gbé àwọn àṣẹ ìtàn-ìran fún ìdàgbàsókè àti ìṣiṣé̩ àwọn èdá.

source: Chromosomes are structures that contain DNA.
target: Àwọn okùn-ìran jé̩ àwọn ètò tí ó ní DNA.

source: Genes are segments of DNA that determine specific traits.
target: Àwọn ẹyọ-ìran jé̩ àwọn èka DNA tí ó ń pinnu àwọn àbùdá pàtó.

source: Adaptation allows organisms to survive in their environment.
target: Ìmórạ jé̩ ohun tí ó ń jé̩ kí àwọn èdá lè gbé ààyè ní àgbègbè wọn.

source: Mutations are changes in genetic material.
target: Ìtipádiyà jé̩ àwọn ìyípàdà nínú àwọn ohun ìtàn-ìran.

source: Natural selection is the process by which organisms evolve.
target: Àṣàyàn àdáyébá jé̩ ìlànà tí àwọn èdá fi ń ṣe ìtìranyà.

source: Homeostasis is the maintenance of stable internal conditions.
target: Ìfẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ jé̩ ìṣètọ́jú ètò inú ara ní ìdúró déédé.

source: Symbiosis is a close relationship between different species.
target: Àjọṣe jé̩ ìbáṣepọ̀ tímọ́tímọ́ láàrín àwọn òwó̩ tó yàtọ̀ síra.

source: Carnivores are animals that eat other animals.
target: Ajẹran jé̩ àwọn ẹranko tí ó ń jẹ àwọn ẹranko mìíràn.

source: Herbivores are animals that eat plants.
target: Ajẹèwé jé̩ àwọn ẹranko tí ó ń jẹ àwọn ògbìn.

source: Omnivores eat both plants and animals.
target: Ajẹméjì jé̩ àwọn ẹranko tí ó ń jẹ àwọn ògbìn àti ẹran.

source: Decomposers break down dead organisms.
target: Awọn adọ̀ngbẹ̀ ń ṣe ìdàgbàṣókè lára àwọn èdá tí ó kú.

source: Predators hunt and kill other animals for food.
target: Adigunjalè ń dènà pa àwọn ẹranko mìíràn jẹ.

source: A food chain shows how energy passes from one organism to another.
target: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ oúnjẹ ń fihàn bí agbára ṣe ń gba lára èdá kan sí òmíràn.

source: The water cycle describes the movement of water in the biosphere.
target: Ètò àyíká omi ní àlàyé nípa ìgbàlódè omi ní ayé.

source: Photosynthesis converts light energy to chemical energy.
target: Ìṣeé̩dà onjẹ pẹ̀lú ìtànná ń ṣe àyípàdà agbára ìmọ́lẹ̀ sí agbára ẹ̀lá.

source: Cellular respiration releases energy from food.
target: Ìpòyìdà pádi ń tú agbára sílẹ̀ láti inú oúnjẹ.

source: The nucleus is the control center of the cell.
target: Àgọ́-pádi jé̩ ilé iṣẹ́ olùdarí fún pádi.

source: The cytoplasm is the cellular material outside the nucleus.
target: Ohun-inú pádi ni ohun tó wà nínú pádi ṣùgbọ́n tó wà ní ẹ̀yìn àgọ́-pádi.

source: The cell membrane controls what enters and leaves the cell.
target: Ìwọ̀ ohun-inú pádi ń darí ohun tó wọlé àti tó jáde lára pádi.

source: Mitochondria are the powerhouses of the cell.
target: Eya jé̩ ilé agbára nínú pádi.

source: Chloroplasts are where photosynthesis occurs in plant cells.
target: Èyàtúwà jé̩ ibi tí ìṣeé̩dà onjẹ pẹ̀lú ìtànná ti ń ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú àwọn pádi ògbìn.

source: The cell wall gives plant cells their rigid structure.
target: Àmọ̀ pádi ń fún àwọn pádi ògbìn ní ètò líle wọn.

source: Ribosomes are where proteins are made in the cell.
target: Àwọn àgọ́-ìfẹ́fẹ́ jé̩ ibi tí a ti ń ṣèdá àwọn òjẹ̀ nínú pádi.

source: Vacuoles store materials in the cell.
target: Àwọn àpò-àsètò ń tọ́jú àwọn ohun inú pádi.

source: The nervous system is divided into the central and peripheral systems.
target: A pín ètò èṣọ-ara sí ònà méjì, ètò èṣọ t'ògangan̩ àti ètò èṣọ t'àgbèègbè.

source: The brain and spinal cord make up the central nervous system.
target: Ẹṣọ òp̣á-èhìn àti ọpọlọ ló jé̩ àpapò̩ èṣọ t'ògangan̩.

source: Neurons are the basic functional units of the nervous system.
target: Pádi èṣọ jé̩ ìpilẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ẹyọ iṣẹ́ ti ètò èṣọ.

source: Sensory neurons carry information from sensory organs to the brain.
target: Àwọn pádi èṣọ-iyè ń gbé ìròyìn láti àwọn èyà-ara ìyè lọ sọ́dọ̀ ọpọlọ.

source: Motor neurons carry commands from the brain to muscles.
target: Àwọn pádi èṣọ-ìmira ń gbé àṣẹ láti ọpọlọ lọ si àwọn iṣan.

source: The human brain has three main parts: cerebrum, cerebellum, and brainstem.
target: Ọpọlọ ọmọ ènìyàn ní apá ẹlẹgbẹ̀ẹ̀ mẹ́ta: apá ìjọbá, apá ìṣeré, àti apá ipilẹ̀.

source: The respiratory system includes the lungs and air passages.
target: Ètò èy̩à-ìpòyìdà ara ni àwọn èdòfóró̩ àti àwọn ọ̀nà afẹ́.

source: Inhaled air contains oxygen needed by cells.
target: Afẹ́ ìmísí ní òyì-iná tí àwọn pádi nílò.

source: Exhaled air contains carbon dioxide produced by cells.
target: Afẹ́ ìmíjáde ní òyì-èédú tí àwọn pádi ti ṣèdá.

source: The diaphragm is the main muscle of respiration.
target: Iṣan-agbede jé̩ iṣan pàtàkì fún ìpòyìdà.

source: The alveoli are tiny air sacs where gas exchange occurs.
target: Àwọn àpò afẹ́ kékèké jé̩ ibi tí pàṣípààrò̩ òyì ti ń ṣẹlẹ̀.

source: Blood carries oxygen to tissues and carbon dioxide away from tissues.
target: Èjẹ̀ ń gbé òyì-iná lọ sí àwọn ìṣù ara, ó sì ń mú òyì-èédú kúrò lára àwọn ìṣù.

source: The heart has four chambers: two atria and two ventricles.
target: Ọkàn ní yàrá mẹ́rin: yàrá òkè méjì àti yàrá ìsàlẹ̀ méjì.

source: The digestive system begins at the mouth and ends at the anus.
target: Ètò èdà-onjẹ ara bẹ̀rẹ̀ láti ẹnu, ó sì parí sí ihò-ìdí.

source: The stomach contains acid that helps break down food.
target: Ikùn ní èdà kikoro tí ó ń ran àwọn oúnjẹ lọ́wọ́ láti fọ́.

source: The small intestine is where most nutrient absorption occurs.
target: Ìfun kékeré jé̩ ibi tí ìfàmun èròjà ti ń ṣẹlẹ̀ jùlọ.

source: The large intestine absorbs water and forms feces.
target: Ìfun nlá ń fa omi mú, ó sì ń ṣèdá ìgbọnsẹ̀.

source: The liver produces bile to aid in fat digestion.
target: Èdọ̀ ̣nṣèdá òrónro láti ran àdàonjẹ òṛá lọ́wọ́.

source: The pancreas produces enzymes for digestion.
target: Èdò̩-òrónro nṣèdá àwọn ẹnísáìmù fún àdàonjẹ.

source: The urinary system filters waste from the blood.
target: Ètò èyà títò̩ ara ń ṣe àsẹ èjẹ̀ kúrò nínú èjẹ̀.

source: The kidneys filter blood to produce urine.
target: Àwọn iwe ń ṣe àsẹ èjẹ̀ láti mú ìtò̩ jáde.

source: The bladder stores urine until it is excreted.
target: Àpòòtò̩ ̣ń tọ́jú ìtò̩ títí tí a ó fi pọ̀ ọ́ jáde.

source: The reproductive system in males produces sperm.
target: Ètò bíbí ara tí ọkùnrin ń ṣèdá àtọ̀.

source: The reproductive system in females produces eggs.
target: Ètò bíbí ara tí obìnrin ń ṣèdá ẹyin.

source: Fertilization occurs when sperm meets egg.
target: Ìgbàrin ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí àtọ̀ bá pàdé ẹyin.

source: Pregnancy begins when a fertilized egg implants in the uterus.
target: Oyún bẹ̀rẹ̀ nígbà tí ọlẹ̀ bá gbin ara rẹ̀ sínú ilé ọmọ'nú.

source: Menstruation is the shedding of the uterine lining.
target: Nkan oṣù jé̩ ìdànù ìwọ̀ ilé-ọmọ.

source: The skeletal system is made up of bones, cartilage, and ligaments.
target: Ètò àjọ-eegun ara dá lórí àwọn egungun, òkèrékèré, àti àwọn ìṣù aparapọ̀.

source: The skull protects the brain.
target: Agbárí ń dáàbò bo ọpọlọ.

source: The ribcage protects the heart and lungs.
target: Àgbà ìhà ń dáàbò bo ọkàn àti àwọn èdòfóró̩.

source: The vertebral column protects the spinal cord.
target: Òp̣á èhìn ń dáàbò bo èṣọ òp̣á-èhìn.

source: Joints are where two or more bones meet.
target: Oríke jé̩ ibi tí egungun méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ pàdé.

source: The muscular system is made up of three types of muscles.
target: Ètò iṣan ara dá lórí oríṣi iṣan mẹ́ta.

source: Skeletal muscles are attached to bones and allow voluntary movement.
target: Àwọn iṣan eegun so mọ́ àwọn egungun, wọ́n sì ń fàyè gba ìmira àfẹ́só.

source: Smooth muscles control involuntary movements like digestion.
target: Àwọn iṣan ara ń darí àwọn ìmira àìfẹ́só bí àdàonjẹ.

source: Cardiac muscle is found only in the heart.
target: Iṣan ọkàn wà nínú ọkàn nìkan.

source: The endocrine system produces hormones that regulate body functions.
target: Ètò ẹṣé̩ àìlópo nṣèdá àwọn ojera tí ó ń ṣe àtóṣónà àwọn iṣẹ́ ara.

source: The thyroid gland regulates metabolism.
target: Ẹṣé̩ ìdí-ìkòkò òfun̩ ń ṣe àtóṣónà àsè ìjẹ ara.

source: The adrenal glands produce adrenaline in response to stress.
target: Àwọn ẹṣé̩ orí-iwe ń ṣèdá àwọn ojera fún ìdáhùn sí ìnira.

source: The immune system defends the body against pathogens.
target: Ètò òkí-ara nṣe ìdáàbò bo ara lówó̩ àwọn èyàwuuru afàìsàn.

source: White blood cells are part of the immune system.
target: Àwọn pádi-èjẹ̀ funfun jé̩ apá kan nínú ètò òkí-ara.

source: Antibodies are proteins that help fight infection.
target: Àwọn òjẹ̀-ara apèy̩àwuuru jé̩ àwọn òjẹ̀ tí ó ń ran ìjàkadì àrùn lọ́wọ́.

source: Vaccination introduces antigens to stimulate immunity.
target: Àjẹsára ń mú àwọn àjèjì wọlé láti rú òkí-ara sókè.

source: The skin is the largest organ of the body.
target: Awọ ara jé̩ èyà-ara tí ó tóbi jù nínú ara.

source: The skin has three main layers: epidermis, dermis, and hypodermis.
target: Awọ ara ní àwọn ìpele mẹ́ta: àwọ̀ òde, inú awọ-ara, àti ìpèlé abẹ́-awọ.

source: Sweat glands help regulate body temperature.
target: Àwọn ẹṣé̩-òógùn ń ran ìfẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ ìgbóná ara lọ́wọ́.

source: Hair and nails are made of a protein called keratin.
target: Irun àti èékán ní òjẹ̀ tí a ń pè ní kẹ́rátìn.

source: The integumentary system protects against infection and water loss.
target: Ètò awọ-ara ń dáàbò bo ara lọ́wọ́ àrùn àti àdánù omi.

source: Ecology is the study of the relationships between organisms and their environment.
target: Èkó̩ àyíká jé̩ ìwádìí àwọn ìbáṣepọ̀ láàrín àwọn èdá oníyè àti àyíká wọn.

source: A habitat is where an organism lives.
target: Ibùgbé jé̩ ibi tí èdá oníyè ń gbé.

source: A niche is an organism's role in an ecosystem.
target: Ipò-iṣẹ́ jé̩ iṣẹ́ tí èdá oníyè ń ṣe nínú ètò àyíká.

source: A population is all the members of a species in a particular area.
target: Àkójọpọ̀ jé̩ gbogbo àwọn ọmọ òwó̩ kan ní àgbègbè kan páàtó.

source: A community is all the populations of different species in an area.
target: Ìlú jé̩ gbogbo àwọn àkójọpọ̀ òwó̩ onírúurú ní àgbègbè kan.

source: An ecosystem includes all the organisms and their physical environment.
target: Ètò àyíká pẹ̀lú gbogbo àwọn èdá oníyè àti àyíká afọjúrí wọn.

source: Biodiversity is the variety of life in an area.
target: Onírúurú-ìyè jé̩ oríṣiríṣi ìyè ní àgbègbè kan.

source: A food web shows the complex feeding relationships in an ecosystem.
target: Àwọ̀n oúnjẹ ń fihàn àwọn ìbáṣepọ̀ oúnjẹ tí ó ṣòro nínú ètò àyíká.

source: Energy flows through an ecosystem from producers to consumers.
target: Agbára ń ṣàn lọ nínú ètò àyíká láti ọ̀dọ̀ àwọn olùṣèdá sí àwọn olùmúlò.

source: Producers make their own food through photosynthesis.
target: Àwọn olùṣèdá ń ṣe oúnjẹ wọn fúnra wọn nípa ìṣeé̩dà onjẹ pẹ̀lú ìtànná.

source: Primary consumers eat producers.
target: Àwọn olùmúlò àkọ́kọ́ jẹ àwọn olùṣèdá.

source: Secondary consumers eat primary consumers.
target: Àwọn olùmúlò èkejì jẹ àwọn olùmúlò àkọ́kọ́.

source: Tertiary consumers eat secondary consumers.
target: Àwọn olùmúlò ẹ̀kẹta jẹ àwọn olùmúlò èkejì.

source: The endoplasmic reticulum is a transport network in cells.
target: Àwọ̀n-inú-pádi jẹ́ ètò ọ̀nà fún gbígbé ohun nínú pádi.

source: The Golgi apparatus processes and packages proteins.
target: Ètò Golgi ṣe àtúnṣe àti dídé àwọn òjẹ̀.

source: Lysosomes contain digestive enzymes.
target: Àwọn aláṣẹ-pádi ní àwọn ẹnísáìmù àdàonjẹ.

source: Prokaryotic cells do not have a membrane-bound nucleus.
target: Àwọn pádi aláìní-àgọ́ kò ní àgọ́-pádi tí a di ní egbìrín.

source: Eukaryotic cells have a membrane-bound nucleus.
target: Àwọn pádi onípádi-gidi ní àgọ́-pádi tí a di ní egbìrín.

source: Animal cells do not have a cell wall.
target: Àwọn pádi ẹranko kò ní àmọ̀ pádi.

source: Plant cells have a cell wall made of cellulose.
target: Àwọn pádi ògbìn ní àmọ̀ pádi tí a ṣe pẹ̀lú sẹ́lúlósì.

source: Fungi are decomposers that break down dead organic material.
target: Àwọn alára-osun jẹ́ adọ̀ngbẹ̀ tí wọ́n ń fọ́ àwọn ohun oníyè tí kú.

source: Bacteria are unicellular prokaryotes.
target: Alámọ̀ jẹ́ ẹ̀dá onípádikan aláìní-àgọ́.

source: Viruses are not considered living organisms.
target: A kò ka àwọn ọlọ́jẹ̀ sí ẹ̀dá oníyè.

source: The structure of DNA is a double helix.
target: Ètò DNA jẹ́ àfikò ìkarọ méjì.

source: RNA carries genetic information from DNA to ribosomes.
target: RNA ń gbé ìfitónilétí ìran láti DNA sí àwọn àgọ́-ìfẹ́fẹ́.

source: Genes are the basic unit of heredity.
target: Àwọn ẹyọ-ìran jẹ́ ìpìlẹ̀ ẹyọ ìtàn-ìran.

source: Phenotype is the physical expression of genes.
target: Àbùdá-àfojúrí jẹ́ ìfihàn ìran tí a lè rí.

source: Genotype is the genetic makeup of an organism.
target: Àbùdá-ìní jẹ́ àpapọ̀ ìran èdá oníyè.

source: Dominant genes mask the expression of recessive genes.
target: Àwọn ìran aṣẹ́gun ń bo ìfihàn àwọn ìran aṣẹ́fà mọ́lẹ̀.

source: Recessive genes are only expressed when dominant genes are absent.
target: Àwọn ìran aṣẹ́fà jẹ́ fífihàn nígbà tí àwọn ìran aṣẹ́gun kò sí.

source: Meiosis is a type of cell division that produces gametes.
target: Pínpín-pádi-ìdínwó jẹ́ irú pínpín pádi tí ó ń ṣèdá àwọn pádi ìnrin.

source: Sexual reproduction involves the fusion of gametes.
target: Bíbí ti lákọlábo jẹ́ àpapọ̀ àwọn pádi ìnrin.

source: Asexual reproduction does not involve the fusion of gametes.
target: Bíbí àìgbakọ kò ní àpapọ̀ àwọn pádi ìnrin.

source: Cloning is a form of asexual reproduction.
target: Ṣíṣe-àwòkọ jẹ́ irú bíbí àìgbakọ.

source: The human digestive system breaks down food into nutrients.
target: Ètò ẹ̀dà-onjẹ ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń fọ́ oúnjẹ sí èròjà.

source: The human respiratory system exchanges gases with the environment.
target: Ètò ìpòyìdà ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń ṣe pàṣípààrọ̀ òyì pẹ̀lú àyíká.

source: The human circulatory system transports substances around the body.
target: Ètò ìṣọ̀n-ẹ̀jẹ̀ ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń gbé àwọn nkan yí ara ká.

source: The human nervous system coordinates responses to stimuli.
target: Ètò ẹ̀ṣọ ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń ṣe ìbáṣepọ̀ àwọn ìdáhùn sí àwọn ìfura.

source: The human immune system defends against pathogens.
target: Ètò òkí-ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń dáàbò bo ara lọ́wọ́ àwọn ẹ̀yàwuuru afàìsàn.

source: The human reproductive system produces gametes for reproduction.
target: Ètò bíbí ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń ṣèdá àwọn pádi ìnrin fún bíbí.

source: The human muscular system enables movement.
target: Ètò iṣan ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń fàyè gba ìmira.

source: The human skeletal system provides support and protection.
target: Ètò àjọ-eegun ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń pèsè ìtọ́jú àti ààbò.

source: The human integumentary system protects the body from the environment.
target: Ètò awọ-ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń dáàbò bo ara lọ́wọ́ àyíká.

source: The human endocrine system regulates body functions through hormones.
target: Ètò ẹṣẹ́ àìlópo ọmọ ènìyàn ń ṣe àtóṣónà àwọn iṣẹ́ ara nípa àwọn ojera.

source: The human excretory system removes waste from the body.
target: Ètò ìkẹ́gbin ara ọmọ ènìyàn ń mú ègbin kúrò nínú ara.

source: Ecosystems include both living and non-living components.
target: Àwọn ètò àyíká ní àwọn èdá oníyè àti àwọn èdá àìníyè.

source: The biosphere is the part of Earth where life exists.
target: Àyíká-ìyè jẹ́ apá ilẹ̀ ayé níbi tí ìyè wà.

source: The hydrosphere includes all water on Earth.
target: Àyíká-omi pẹ̀lú gbogbo omi lórí ilẹ̀ ayé.

source: The atmosphere is the layer of gases surrounding Earth.
target: Àyíká-afẹ́ jẹ́ ìpele òyì tí ó yí ilẹ̀ ayé ká.

source: The lithosphere is the solid outer layer of Earth.
target: Àyíká-ilẹ̀ jẹ́ ìpele líle òde ilẹ̀ ayé.

source: Natural selection leads to adaptation of species.
target: Àṣàyàn àdáyébá ń yọrí sí ìmórạ àwọn ọ̀wọ́.

source: Evolution is the process of biological change over time.
target: Ìtìranyà jẹ́ ìlànà ìyípàdà ìyè lórí ìgbà.

source: Biodiversity refers to the variety of life in an area.
target: Onírúurú-ìyè tọ́ka sí oríṣiríṣi ìyè ní àgbègbè kan.

source: Conservation is the protection of biodiversity.
target: Ìtọ́jú jẹ́ ààbò onírúurú-ìyè.

source: The theory of evolution explains how species change over time.
target: Ìlànà ìtìranyà ń ṣàlàyé bí àwọn ọ̀wọ́ ṣe ń yipada lórí ìgbà.

source: The cell theory states that all organisms are composed of cells.
target: Ìlànà pádi sọ pé gbogbo àwọn èdá oníyè ni a ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn pádi.

source: The germ theory states that diseases are caused by microorganisms.
target: Ìlànà àjàkálẹ̀-àrùn sọ pé àwọn àìsàn ní a fa nípa àwọn èyàwuru kékèké.

source: Organisms with similar characteristics are grouped together in taxonomy.
target: Àwọn èdá oníyè tí ó ní àbùdá ìjọra ni a kó jọ pọ̀ nínú ìkàsí.

source: The binomial nomenclature system is used to name species.
target: Ètò ìsọdorúkọ-ìbejì ni a ń lò láti sọ àwọn ọ̀wọ́ ní orúkọ.

source: Linnaeus developed the modern system of taxonomy.
target: Linnaeus ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ètò òde-òní fún ìkàsí.

source: Kingdom is the highest taxonomic rank.
target: Ìjọ jẹ́ ipò ìkàsí tí ó ga jùlọ.

source: Species is the lowest taxonomic rank.
target: Ọ̀wọ́ jẹ́ ipò ìkàsí tí ó kéré jùlọ.

source: Phylogeny is the evolutionary history of a species.
target: Ìtàn-ìran jẹ́ ìtàn ìtìranyà ọ̀wọ́ kan.

source: Mutations are changes in genetic material.
target: Àwọn ìtipádiyà jẹ́ àwọn ìyípàdà nínú ohun ìtàn-ìran.

source: Natural selection acts on phenotypic variation.
target: Àṣàyàn àdáyébá ń ṣiṣẹ́ lórí ìyàtọ̀ àbùdá-àfojúrí.

source: Genetic drift is a change in allele frequency due to chance.
target: Ìfàsẹ́yìn ìran jẹ́ ìyípàdà ní ìṣirò ìran nítorí àṣesóótọ́.

source: Gene flow is the transfer of genes between populations.
target: Ìṣàn ìran jẹ́ ìgbéyọ ìran láàrín àwọn àkójọpọ̀.

source: Speciation is the formation of new species.
target: Ìṣeṣẹ̀dá-ọ̀wọ́ jẹ́ ìdásílẹ̀ àwọn ọ̀wọ́ tuntun.

source: Homologous structures share a common ancestry but may have different functions.
target: Àwọn ètò ìjọsípọ̀ ní ìdílé ajọpọ̀ ṣùgbọ́n lè ní àwọn iṣẹ́ tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: Analogous structures have similar functions but different evolutionary origins.
target: Àwọn ètò aláfaní ní àwọn iṣẹ́ tí ó jọra ṣùgbọ́n ní àwọn ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìtìranyà tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: Vestigial structures are remnants of structures that had functions in ancestors.
target: Àwọn ètò ìyókù jẹ́ àwọn èyí tí ó kù nínú àwọn ètò tí ó ní iṣẹ́ ní àwọn baba ńlá.

source: Human and chimpanzee DNA are about 98% identical.
target: DNA ọmọ ènìyàn àti ìnọ́kí jẹ́ bí 98% bákan náà.

source: Humans share a common ancestor with great apes.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn pín baba ńlá ajọpọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn ẹranko ńlá.

source: Humans are classified as primates.
target: A ṣe ìkàsí ọmọ ènìyàn gẹ́gẹ́ bí olórí-ẹranko.

source: Humans are mammals that belong to the order Primates.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ onírunlára tí ó jẹ́ ti agboolé olórí-ẹranko.

source: The scientific name for humans is Homo sapiens.
target: Orúkọ ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ fún ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ Homo sapiens.

source: The human genome contains about 20,000-25,000 genes.
target: Àkójọpọ̀ ìran ọmọ ènìyàn ní bí ẹgbẹ̀rún ogún sí ẹgbẹ̀rún méẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n àwọn ìran.

source: Humans are vertebrates with a backbone.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ ẹlẹ́sọ̀lẹ́hìn pẹ̀lú ẹ̀hin eegun.

source: Humans have a four-chambered heart.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn ní ọkàn onípele mẹ́rin.

source: Humans are endotherms, maintaining a constant body temperature.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ onígbóná-inú, tí ó ń ṣe àtọ́jú ìgbóná ara déédé.

source: Humans have binocular vision, allowing depth perception.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn ní ìríran ojú méjì, tí ó ń fàyè gba ìdámọ̀ jíjìn.

source: Humans have opposable thumbs.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn ní àwọn àtànpàkò tó lòdì síra wọn.

source: Humans are omnivores, eating both plant and animal material.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ ajẹméjì, tí ó ń jẹ èròjà ògbìn àti ẹran.

source: The human life cycle includes infancy, childhood, adolescence, adulthood, and old age.
target: Àyíká ìgbésí ayé ọmọ ènìyàn pẹ̀lú ìgbà ọmọ ọwọ́, ìgbà èwe, ìgbà bàlágà, ìgbà àgbà, àti ìgbà arúgbó.

source: Human embryonic development begins with fertilization.
target: Ìdàgbàsókè ọlẹ̀ ọmọ ènìyàn bẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ìgbàrin.

source: The menstrual cycle is a series of changes in the female reproductive system.
target: Àyíká oṣù jẹ́ ẹ̀ka ìyípàdà nínú ètò bíbí ara obìnrin.

source: Pregnancy in humans typically lasts about 40 weeks.
target: Oyún ní ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ ní gbogbo ọ̀sẹ̀ ogójì.

source: Puberty is when sexual maturation occurs.
target: Ìbàlágà jẹ́ nígbà tí ìdàgbà ìbálòpọ̀ ṣẹlẹ̀.

source: The stages of mitosis are prophase, metaphase, anaphase, and telophase.
target: Àwọn ìpele pínpín àgọ́-pádi jẹ́ ìbẹ̀rẹ̀, àárín, ìparí, àti ìparí pátápátá.

source: Interphase is the period between cell divisions.
target: Àárín-ìpele jẹ́ àkókò láàrín àwọn pínpín pádi.

source: The stages of meiosis include two divisions.
target: Àwọn ìpele pínpín-pádi-ìdínwó pẹ̀lú pínpín méjì.

source: Crossing over occurs during meiosis.
target: Kọ́rọ́ṣíngì ṣẹlẹ̀ lákokò pínpín-pádi-ìdínwó.

source: Independent assortment of chromosomes increases genetic diversity.
target: Ìpínkiri ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ àwọn okùn-ìran ń mú onírúurú ìran pọ̀ sí i.

source: DNA replication occurs during the S phase of interphase.
target: Àtúnṣe DNA ṣẹlẹ̀ lákokò ìpele S ti àárín-ìpele.

source: Translation is the process of making proteins from mRNA.
target: Ìtumọ̀ jẹ́ ìlànà ṣíṣe àwọn òjẹ̀ láti mRNA.

source: Transcription is the process of making RNA from DNA.
target: Ìkọ̀wé jẹ́ ìlànà ṣíṣe RNA láti DNA.

source: Proteins are made up of amino acids.
target: Àwọn òjẹ̀ ni a ṣe pẹ̀lú àwọn ásídì àmínò.

source: Photosynthesis occurs in chloroplasts in plant cells.
target: Ìṣeé̩dà onjẹ pẹ̀lú ìtànná ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú àwọn èyàtúwà nínú àwọn pádi ògbìn.

source: The light-dependent reactions of photosynthesis produce ATP and NADPH.
target: Àwọn àṣe tí ó dá lórí ìmọ́lẹ̀ ti ìṣeé̩dà onjẹ pẹ̀lú ìtànná ń ṣèdá ATP àti NADPH.

source: The Calvin cycle uses ATP and NADPH to produce glucose.
target: Àyíka Calvin ń lo ATP àti NADPH láti ṣèdá gúlúkósì.

source: Cellular respiration releases energy from glucose.
target: Ìpòyìdà pádi ń tú agbára sílẹ̀ láti inú gúlúkósì.

source: Glycolysis is the first stage of cellular respiration.
target: Ìfọ́-oníjẹ jẹ́ ìpele àkọ́kọ́ ti ìpòyìdà pádi.

source: The citric acid cycle occurs in the mitochondrial matrix.
target: Àyíka ásídì sítríkì ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú inú eya pádi.

source: The electron transport chain generates most of the ATP in cellular respiration.
target: Okùn ìgbé ẹlẹ́ktrọ́nù ń ṣèdá púpọ̀ jùlọ ti ATP nínú ìpòyìdà pádi.

source: Fermentation occurs in the absence of oxygen.
target: Ìdíbà ṣẹlẹ̀ ní àìsí òyì-iná.

source: Lactic acid fermentation occurs in muscle cells during intense exercise.
target: Ìdíbà ásídì láktíkì ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú àwọn pádi iṣan lákokò eré ìdárayá líle.

source: Alcoholic fermentation produces ethanol and carbon dioxide.
target: Ìdíbà ọtí ń ṣèdá ẹ́tánọ́lù àti òyì-èédú.

source: The water cycle includes evaporation, condensation, and precipitation.
target: Àyíká omi pẹ̀lú ìgbóná-ojú-omi, ìdí-omi, àti òjò.

source: The carbon cycle describes the movement of carbon through ecosystems.
target: Àyíká kábọ́nì ṣàlàyé ìgbàlódè kábọ́nì láàrín àwọn ètò àyíká.

source: The nitrogen cycle involves the conversion of nitrogen into forms that plants can use.
target: Àyíká náítírójìn jẹ́ àyípàdà náítírójìn sí àwọn irú tí àwọn ògbìn lè lò.

source: The phosphorus cycle describes the movement of phosphorus through ecosystems.
target: Àyíká fọ́sfọ́rọ̀sì ṣàlàyé ìgbàlódè fọ́sfọ́rọ̀sì láàrín àwọn ètò àyíká.

source: Ecological succession is the process of change in community structure over time.
target: Ìṣẹ̀dálẹ̀kọ̀ ẹ̀kọ́lọ́jì jẹ́ ìlànà ìyípàdà ní ètò ìlú lórí ìgbà.

source: Primary succession occurs in areas where no soil exists.
target: Ìṣẹ̀dálẹ̀kọ̀ àkọ́kọ́ ṣẹlẹ̀ ní àwọn àgbègbè níbi tí ilẹ̀ kò sí.

source: Secondary succession occurs in areas where soil exists but the community has been disturbed.
target: Ìṣẹ̀dálẹ̀kọ̀ èkejì ṣẹlẹ̀ ní àwọn àgbègbè níbi tí ilẹ̀ wà ṣùgbọ́n tí ìlú ti dàrú.

source: A biome is a large community of plants and animals that occupies a distinct region.
target: Àgbègbè-ìyè jẹ́ ìlú ńlá ti àwọn ògbìn àti ẹranko tí ó ń gbé àgbègbè tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: The tundra is a cold, treeless biome.
target: Ilẹ̀-tútù jẹ́ àgbègbè-ìyè tútù, aláìlégí.

source: The taiga is a coniferous forest biome.
target: Ilẹ̀-igijẹjẹ jẹ́ àgbègbè-ìyè igbó oní àrọ.

source: The temperate deciduous forest is a biome with trees that lose their leaves seasonally.
target: Igbó awọ́wẹ́ onítẹ́ẹ́dẹ́ jẹ́ àgbègbè-ìyè pẹ̀lú igi tí ó ń pá ewé wọn dànù ní ìgbà àkókò.

source: The tropical rainforest is a warm, wet biome with high biodiversity.
target: Igbó-ojo ilẹ̀-gbígbóná jẹ́ àgbègbè-ìyè gbígbóná, tútù pẹ̀lú onírúurú-ìyè gíga.

source: The savanna is a grassland biome with scattered trees.
target: Pápá jẹ́ àgbègbè-ìyè pápá koríko pẹ̀lú àwọn igi tí ó fọ́nká.

source: The desert is a dry biome with low precipitation.
target: Ilẹ̀-gbígbẹ jẹ́ àgbègbè-ìyè gbígbẹ pẹ̀lú òjò kékeré.

source: The marine biome includes oceans, coral reefs, and estuaries.
target: Àgbègbè-ìyè òkun pẹ̀lú àwọn òkun, àwọn ọ̀pá-òkun, àti àwọn ẹnu-odò.

source: The freshwater biome includes lakes, rivers, and wetlands.
target: Àgbègbè-ìyè omi-dídára pẹ̀lú àwọn adágún, àwọn odò, àti àwọn ilẹ̀-omi.

source: Carrying capacity is the maximum population size that an environment can sustain.
target: Agbára-gbígbà jẹ́ títóbi àkójọpọ̀ tí ó pọ̀jù tí àyíká kan lè gbé.

source: Population growth is influenced by birth rates, death rates, immigration, and emigration.
target: Ìdàgbàsókè àkójọpọ̀ jẹ́ nípa ìṣirò ìbí, ìṣirò ikú, ìwọlé-ilẹ̀, àti ìkúrò-ilẹ̀.

source: Exponential growth occurs when resources are abundant.
target: Ìdàgbà àfikún ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí àwọn ohun-ìní pọ̀.

source: Logistic growth occurs when resources become limited.
target: Ìdàgbà onípínlẹ̀ ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí àwọn ohun-ìní di ìpínlẹ̀.

source: Competition occurs when organisms vie for the same resources.
target: Ìdíje ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí àwọn èdá oníyè bá n jà fún àwọn ohun-ìní kan náà.

source: Predation is when one organism kills and eats another.
target: Ìdẹ-ẹran jẹ́ nígbà tí èdá oníyè kan bá pa èdá oníyè mìíràn jẹ.

source: Parasitism is a relationship where one organism benefits at the expense of another.
target: Ajẹtìmọlẹ̀ jẹ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ níbi tí èdá oníyè kan ń jẹ àǹfààní ní ìdojútini èdá oníyè mìíràn.

source: Mutualism is a relationship where both organisms benefit.
target: Asejọwọ́pọ̀ jẹ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ níbi tí àwọn èdá oníyè méjèèjì ń jẹ àǹfààní.

source: Commensalism is a relationship where one organism benefits and the other is unaffected.
target: Aṣejọwọ́pọ̀kan jẹ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ níbi tí èdá oníyè kan ń jẹ àǹfààní ṣùgbọ́n tí òmíràn kò ní ipa.

source: Symbiosis is a close, long-term interaction between different species.
target: Ìgbétímọ́ra jẹ́ ìbáṣepọ̀ tímọ́tímọ́, ìgbà-pípẹ́ láàrín àwọn ọ̀wọ́ tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: Camouflage is an adaptation that helps organisms blend with their environment.
target: Ìbáradé jẹ́ ìmóra tí ó ń ran àwọn èdá oníyè lọ́wọ́ láti dàpọ̀ mọ́ àyíká wọn.

source: Mimicry is when one organism resembles another for protection.
target: Àfarawé jẹ́ nígbà tí èdá oníyè kan bá jọ òmíràn fún ìdáàbòbò.

source: Warning coloration is bright coloration that signals danger.
target: Àwọ̀-ìkìlọ̀ jẹ́ àwọ̀ dídán tí ó ń fi àmì ewu hàn.

source: Behavioral adaptations are behaviors that help organisms survive.
target: Àwọn ìmóra ìhùwàsí jẹ́ àwọn ìhùwàsí tí ó ń ran àwọn èdá oníyè lọ́wọ́ láti yè.

source: Physiological adaptations are changes in body functions.
target: Àwọn ìmóra ara jẹ́ àwọn ìyípàdà nínú àwọn iṣẹ́ ara.

source: Structural adaptations are physical features that help organisms survive.
target: Àwọn ìmóra ètò jẹ́ àwọn àbùdá afojúrí tí ó ń ran àwọn èdá oníyè lọ́wọ́ láti yè.

source: Migration is the seasonal movement of animals.
target: Ìsipò jẹ́ ìgbàlódè àkókò àwọn ẹranko.

source: Hibernation is a state of inactivity during winter.
target: Ojúṣùúrù-òtútù jẹ́ ipò àìṣíṣẹ́ ní àkókò òtútù.

source: Estivation is a state of inactivity during hot, dry periods.
target: Ojúṣùúrù-gbígbóná jẹ́ ipò àìṣíṣẹ́ ní àkókò gbígbóná, gbígbẹ.

source: Homeostasis is the maintenance of a stable internal environment.
target: Ìfẹsẹ̀múlẹ̀ jẹ́ ìṣètọ́jú àyíká inú déédé.

source: Thermoregulation is the maintenance of body temperature.
target: Ìṣètọ́jú-ìgbóná jẹ́ ìṣètọ́jú ìgbóná ara.

source: Osmoregulation is the control of water balance in organisms.
target: Ìṣètọ́jú-omi jẹ́ ìdarí ìwọ̀ntúnwọ̀nsì omi nínú àwọn èdá oníyè.

source: Excretion is the removal of metabolic waste from the body.
target: Ìkẹ́gbin jẹ́ ìmúkúrò àwọn ègbin àsè ìjẹ láti inú ara.

source: Metabolism is the sum of all chemical reactions in an organism.
target: Àsè-ìjẹ ara jẹ́ àpapọ̀ gbogbo àwọn àṣe ẹ̀lá nínú èdá oníyè.

source: Anabolism is the building up of complex molecules from simpler ones.
target: Àkójọ-èdá jẹ́ kíkọ́ àwọn mọ́lìkúù ìṣòro láti àwọn tí ó rọrùn.

source: Catabolism is the breaking down of complex molecules into simpler ones.
target: Àfọ́-èdá jẹ́ fífọ́ àwọn mọ́lìkúù ìṣòro sí àwọn tí ó rọrùn.

source: Enzymes are biological catalysts that speed up chemical reactions.
target: Àwọn ẹnísáìmù jẹ́ àwọn aṣètúnṣe ìyè tí ó ń mú àwọn àṣe ẹ̀lá yára.

source: Substrates are molecules that enzymes act upon.
target: Àwọn ohun-iṣẹ́ jẹ́ àwọn mọ́lìkúù tí àwọn ẹnísáìmù ń ṣiṣẹ́ lé lórí.

source: Active sites are regions on enzymes where substrates bind.
target: Àwọn ibi-iṣẹ́ jẹ́ àwọn agbègbè lórí àwọn ẹnísáìmù níbi tí àwọn ohun-iṣẹ́ ń so mọ́.

source: Inhibitors are substances that reduce enzyme activity.
target: Àwọn adínkù jẹ́ àwọn ohun tí ó ń dín iṣẹ́ ẹnísáìmù kù.

source: Competitive inhibitors bind to the active site of an enzyme.
target: Àwọn adínkù adíje ń so mọ́ ibi-iṣẹ́ ẹnísáìmù.

source: Noncompetitive inhibitors bind to a site other than the active site.
target: Àwọn adínkù àìdíje ń so mọ́ ibi mìíràn yàtọ̀ sí ibi-iṣẹ́.

source: Hormones are chemical messengers that regulate body functions.
target: Àwọn ojera jẹ́ àwọn ìránṣẹ́ ẹ̀lá tí ó ń ṣe àtóṣónà àwọn iṣẹ́ ara.

source: Endocrine glands secrete hormones directly into the bloodstream.
target: Àwọn ẹṣẹ́ àìlópo ń sun àwọn ojera tààrà sínú ìṣọ̀n ẹ̀jẹ̀.

source: Exocrine glands secrete substances through ducts.
target: Àwọn ẹṣẹ́ olópo ń sun àwọn ohun láti inú òpó.

source: The pituitary gland is called the master gland because it controls other glands.
target: Ẹṣẹ́ ìdí-ọpọlọ jẹ́ pípè ní ẹṣẹ́ olórí nítorí ó ń darí àwọn ẹṣẹ́ mìíràn.

source: The thyroid gland regulates metabolism.
target: Ẹṣẹ́ ìdí-ìkòkò ọ̀fun ń ṣe àtóṣónà àsè-ìjẹ ara.

source: The adrenal glands produce adrenaline in response to stress.
target: Àwọn ẹṣẹ́ orí-iwe ń ṣèdá àdrẹ́nálínì ní ìdáhùn sí ìnira.

source: The pancreas produces insulin to regulate blood sugar.
target: Èdọ̀-òrónro ń ṣèdá ìnísúlìnì láti ṣe àtóṣónà oníjẹ̀ ẹ̀jẹ̀.

source: The ovaries produce estrogen and progesterone.
target: Àwọn ibú-ẹyin ń ṣèdá ẹ́sítírójẹ̀n àti pírójẹ́sítẹ́rónì.

source: The testes produce testosterone.
target: Àwọn ikóropọ̀n ń ṣèdá tẹ́sítósítẹ́rónì.

source: Insulin lowers blood glucose levels.
target: Ìnísúlìnì ń dín àwọn ipò gúlúkósì ẹ̀jẹ̀ kù.

source: Glucagon raises blood glucose levels.
target: Gúlúkágọ̀n ń gbé àwọn ipò gúlúkósì ẹ̀jẹ̀ sókè.

source: Diabetes is a disease characterized by high blood glucose levels.
target: Ìtọ̀súgà jẹ́ àìsàn tí a ṣe àfihàn nípa àwọn ipò gúlúkósì ẹ̀jẹ̀ gíga.

source: Type 1 diabetes is caused by the immune system attacking insulin-producing cells.
target: Ìtọ̀súgà 1 ni a fa nípa ètò òkí-ara kọlu àwọn pádi tí ó ń ṣèdá ìnísúlìnì.

source: Type 2 diabetes is characterized by insulin resistance.
target: Ìtọ̀súgà 2 jẹ́ àfihàn nípa ìṣòdì-ìnísúlìnì.

source: The human genome consists of about 3 billion base pairs.
target: Àkójọpọ̀ ìran ọmọ ènìyàn jẹ́ nípa bílíọ̀nù mẹ́ta àwọn ẹ̀ka báásì.

source: A genome is the complete set of genetic material in an organism.
target: Àkójọpọ̀ ìran jẹ́ ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ ohun ìtàn-ìran nínú èdá oníyè.

source: Chromosomes are structures that contain DNA.
target: Àwọn okùn-ìran jẹ́ àwọn ètò tí ó ní DNA.

source: Humans have 46 chromosomes in 23 pairs.
target: Ọmọ ènìyàn ní okùn-ìran mẹ́rìndínláàádọ́ta ní ẹ̀ka mẹ́tàlélógún.

source: Genes are segments of DNA that code for proteins.
target: Àwọn ìran jẹ́ àwọn èka DNA tí ó ń ṣe àmì fún àwọn òjẹ̀.

source: Alleles are alternative forms of the same gene.
target: Àwọn ọmọ-ìran jẹ́ àwọn irú míran ti ìran kan náà.

source: Genotype is the genetic makeup of an organism.
target: Àbùdá-ìní jẹ́ àpapọ̀ ìran èdá oníyè.

source: Phenotype is the observable traits of an organism.
target: Àbùdá-àfojúrí jẹ́ àwọn àbùdá tí a lè rí ti èdá oníyè.

source: Homozygous means having identical alleles for a particular gene.
target: Alákeejọ túmọ̀ sí níní àwọn ọmọ-ìran bakannáà fún ìran kan pàtó.

source: Heterozygous means having different alleles for a particular gene.
target: Alákeeyàtọ̀ túmọ̀ sí níní àwọn ọmọ-ìran tí ó yàtọ̀ fún ìran kan pàtó.

source: Dominant alleles are expressed when present in either homozygous or heterozygous states.
target: Àwọn ọmọ-ìran aṣẹ́gun jẹ́ fífihàn nígbà tí ó bá wà ní ipò alákeejọ tàbí alákeeyàtọ̀.

source: Recessive alleles are only expressed in the homozygous state.
target: Àwọn ọmọ-ìran aṣẹ́fà jẹ́ fífihàn ní ipò alákeejọ nìkan.

source: Incomplete dominance is when the heterozygous phenotype is intermediate between the two homozygous phenotypes.
target: Àṣẹ́gun àìpé jẹ́ nígbà tí àbùdá-àfojúrí alákeeyàtọ̀ bá wà láàrín àwọn àbùdá-àfojúrí alákeejọ méjì.

source: Codominance is when both alleles are expressed in the heterozygous state.
target: Àjọ-ṣẹ́gun jẹ́ nígbà tí àwọn ọmọ-ìran méjèèjì bá jẹ́ fífihàn ní ipò alákeeyàtọ̀.

source: Multiple alleles means a gene has more than two possible alleles.
target: Àwọn ọmọ-ìran púpọ̀ túmọ̀ sí ìran kan ní ju ọmọ-ìran méjì tí ó ṣeéṣe lọ.

source: Polygenic inheritance is when a trait is controlled by multiple genes.
target: Jogún oníran-púpọ̀ jẹ́ nígbà tí a bá darí àbùdá nípa àwọn ìran púpọ̀.

source: Pleiotropy is when one gene affects multiple traits.
target: Àbùdá-púpọ̀ jẹ́ nígbà tí ìran kan bá ní ipa lórí àwọn àbùdá púpọ̀.

source: Sex-linked genes are located on the sex chromosomes.
target: Àwọn ìran ìnrin-ìsopọ̀ wà lórí àwọn okùn-ìran ìnrin.

source: X-linked recessive disorders are more common in males.
target: Àwọn àìsàn X-ìsopọ̀ aṣẹ́fà wọ́pọ̀ ní ọkùnrin.

source: Pedigrees are diagrams that show the inheritance of traits in families.
target: Àwọn ìtànṣe jẹ́ àwọn àwòrán tí ó ń fi jogún àwọn àbùdá nínú àwọn ìdílé hàn.

source: The Hardy-Weinberg principle describes allele frequencies in populations.
target: Ìlànà Hardy-Weinberg ṣàlàyé àwọn ìṣirò ọmọ-ìran nínú àwọn àkójọpọ̀.

source: Genetic drift is a change in allele frequency due to chance.
target: Ìfàsẹ́yìn ìran jẹ́ ìyípàdà ní ìṣirò ọmọ-ìran nítorí àṣesóótọ́.

source: Genetic bottlenecks occur when a population is drastically reduced in size.
target: Àwọn ìkórù ìran ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí a bá dín àkójọpọ̀ kù ní títóbi gbigbogbo.

source: The founder effect occurs when a new population is established by a small number of individuals.
target: Ipa aṣẹ̀dá ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí àkójọpọ̀ tuntun bá jẹ́ dídásílẹ̀ nípa iye kékeré àwọn ẹnìkọ̀ọ̀kan.

source: Mutation is a change in the genetic material of an organism.
target: Ìtipádiyà jẹ́ ìyípàdà nínú ohun ìtàn-ìran ti èdá oníyè.

source: Point mutations affect a single nucleotide.
target: Àwọn ìtipádiyà àmì ní ipa lórí èkun-ẹ̀yọ́ kan.

source: Frameshift mutations involve the insertion or deletion of nucleotides.
target: Àwọn ìtipádiyà ìyípò jẹ́ àfikún tàbí ìyọkúrò àwọn èkun-ẹ̀yọ́.

source: Gene flow is the transfer of alleles from one population to another.
target: Ìṣàn ìran jẹ́ ìgbéyọ àwọn ọmọ-ìran láti ọ̀dọ̀ àkójọpọ̀ kan sí òmíràn.

source: Natural selection is the process by which organisms better adapted to their environment survive and reproduce.
target: Àṣàyàn àdáyébá jẹ́ ìlànà nípa èyí tí àwọn èdá oníyè tí ó dára ní ìmóra sí àyíká wọn yè tí wọ́n sì ń ṣèdá.

source: Artificial selection is selection by humans for breeding of desirable traits.
target: Àṣàyàn àbájáde jẹ́ àṣàyàn ọmọ ènìyàn fún ìbísí àwọn àbùdá tí ó wù.

source: Directional selection favors one extreme of a trait.
target: Àṣàyàn ìtọ́sọ́nà fẹ́ràn òpin kan ti àbùdá.

source: Stabilizing selection favors the average form of a trait.
target: Àṣàyàn ìdúróṣinṣin fẹ́ràn irú apapọ̀ ti àbùdá.

source: Disruptive selection favors both extremes of a trait.
target: Àṣàyàn ìyapa fẹ́ràn àwọn òpin méjèèjì ti àbùdá.

source: Sexual selection is selection for traits that increase mating success.
target: Àṣàyàn ìbálòpọ̀ jẹ́ àṣàyàn fún àwọn àbùdá tí ó ń mú àṣeyọrí ìbálòpọ̀ pọ̀ sí i.

source: Speciation is the formation of new species.
target: Ìṣèṣẹ̀dá-ọ̀wọ́ jẹ́ ìdásílẹ̀ àwọn ọ̀wọ́ tuntun.

source: Allopatric speciation occurs when populations are geographically isolated.
target: Ìṣèṣẹ̀dá-ọ̀wọ́ ìpinya-ayé ṣẹlẹ̀ nígbà tí àwọn àkójọpọ̀ bá jẹ́ pínyà ní jíografi.

source: Sympatric speciation occurs within a single geographical area.
target: Ìṣèṣẹ̀dá-ọ̀wọ́ ìpapọ̀-ayé ṣẹlẹ̀ láàrín agbègbè jíografi kan.

source: Reproductive isolation prevents interbreeding between species.
target: Ìpinya ìbísí dínà ìbísí láàrín àwọn ọ̀wọ́.

source: Pre-zygotic barriers prevent fertilization.
target: Àwọn ìdínà ṣíwájú-ọlẹ̀ dínà ìgbàrin.

source: Post-zygotic barriers prevent the development of viable offspring.
target: Àwọn ìdínà ẹ̀yìn-ọlẹ̀ dínà ìdàgbàsókè ọmọ tó dára.

source: Convergent evolution is when unrelated species evolve similar traits.
target: Ìtìranyà ìpàdé jẹ́ nígbà tí àwọn ọ̀wọ́ aláìjọra bá ṣe ìtìranyà àwọn àbùdá tí ó jọra.

source: Divergent evolution is when related species evolve different traits.
target: Ìtìranyà ìpinya jẹ́ nígbà tí àwọn ọ̀wọ́ ajọra bá ṣe ìtìranyà àwọn àbùdá tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: Coevolution is when species evolve in response to each other.
target: Àjọ-tìranyà jẹ́ nígbà tí àwọn ọ̀wọ́ bá ṣe ìtìranyà ní ìdáhùn sí ara wọn.

source: Adaptive radiation is the rapid diversification of a group of organisms.
target: Ìtànjáde ìmóra jẹ́ yíyara onírúurú ẹgbẹ́ àwọn èdá oníyè.

source: Phylogeny is the evolutionary history of a group of organisms.
target: Ìtàn-ìran jẹ́ ìtàn ìtìranyà ẹgbẹ́ àwọn èdá oníyè.

source: A phylogenetic tree shows evolutionary relationships.
target: Igi ìtàn-ìran ń fi àwọn ìbáṣepọ̀ ìtìranyà hàn.

source: Cladistics is a method of classification based on shared derived traits.
target: Ìkàsí-ẹ̀ka jẹ́ ọ̀nà ìkàsí tí ó dá lórí àwọn àbùdá tí a pín tí a mú wá.

source: Homologous structures share a common ancestry.
target: Àwọn ètò ìjọsípọ̀ pín ìdílé ajọpọ̀.

source: Analogous structures have similar functions but different evolutionary origins.
target: Àwọn ètò aláfaní ní àwọn iṣẹ́ tí ó jọra ṣùgbọ́n ní àwọn ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ìtìranyà tí ó yàtọ̀.

source: Vestigial structures are remnants of structures that had functions in ancestors.
target: Àwọn ètò ìyókù jẹ́ àwọn èyí tí ó kù nínú àwọn ètò tí ó ní iṣẹ́ ní àwọn baba ńlá.

source: Embryological evidence shows similarities in early development stages of related organisms.
target: Ẹ̀rí ọlẹ̀-ìmọ̀ ń fi àwọn ìjọra hàn ní àwọn ìpele ìdàgbàsókè tí ó kọ́kọ́ ti àwọn èdá oníyè ajọra.

source: Molecular evidence includes similarities in DNA and proteins of related organisms.
target: Ẹ̀rí mọ́lìkúù pẹ̀lú àwọn ìjọra nínú DNA àti àwọn òjẹ̀ ti àwọn èdá oníyè ajọra.

source: Fossils are preserved remains or traces of ancient organisms.
target: Àwọn egungun-àtijọ́ jẹ́ àwọn èyí tí a tọ́jú tàbí àwọn àmì ti àwọn èdá oníyè àtijọ́.

source: The fossil record provides evidence of evolutionary history.
target: Àkọsílẹ̀ egungun-àtijọ́ ń pèsè ẹ̀rí ti ìtàn ìtìranyà.

source: Radiometric dating is used to determine the age of fossils.
target: Ìdáyelé rédíòmẹ́tíríkì ni a ń lò láti pinnu ọjọ́ orí àwọn egungun-àtijọ́.

source: The geologic time scale divides Earth's history into eras, periods, and epochs.
target: Ìwọ̀n àkókò jẹ́ọ́lọ́jì pín ìtàn Ilẹ̀ Ayé sí àwọn ìgbà, àwọn ìpele, àti àwọn àkókò.

source: The Precambrian era covers about 88% of Earth's history.
target: Ìgbà ṣíwájú-Kámbríánì bo nípa 88% ti ìtàn Ilẹ̀ Ayé.

source: The Paleozoic era was characterized by the diversification of marine invertebrates.
target: Ìgbà Pálẹ́ósóíkì jẹ́ àfihàn nípa onírúurú àwọn ẹranko okun aláìlẹ́hin eegun.

source: The Mesozoic era is known as the Age of Reptiles.
target: Ìgbà Mẹ́sósóíkì jẹ́ mímọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ọjọ́ Orí Afàyàfà.

source: The Cenozoic era is known as the Age of Mammals.
target: Ìgbà Sẹ́nósóíkì jẹ́ mímọ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ọjọ́ Orí Onírunlára.

source: Taxonomy is the science of classifying organisms.
target: Ìkàsí jẹ́ ìmọ̀ ṣíṣe ìkàsí àwọn èdá oníyè.

source: Binomial nomenclature uses genus and species names.
target: Ìsọdorúkọ-ìbejì ń lo àwọn orúkọ ìran àti ọ̀wọ́.

source: The taxonomic hierarchy includes kingdom, phylum, class, order, family, genus, and species.
target: Ẹ̀sẹ̀-ẹ̀sẹ̀ ìkàsí pẹ̀lú ìjọ, agbo-ẹ̀yà, ẹ̀yà, agboolé, ìdílé, ìran, àti ọ̀wọ́.

source: The five kingdom classification system includes Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, and Animalia.
target: Ètò ìkàsí ìjọ márùn-ún pẹ̀lú Ìjọ-pádi aláìní-àgọ́, Ìjọ pádi Onípádigidi, Ìjọ Alára-osun, Ìjọ Ọ̀gbìn, àti Ìjọ Ẹran.

source: The three-domain system includes Archaea, Bacteria, and Eukarya.
target: Ètò agbègbè-mẹ́ta pẹ̀lú Archaea, Bacteria, àti Eukarya.

source: Bacteria are prokaryotic, unicellular organisms.
target: Alámọ̀ jẹ́ àìní-àgọ́, èdá oníyè onípádikan.

source: Archaeans are prokaryotic organisms that live in extreme environments.
target: Àkíánù jẹ́ àwọn èdá oníyè àìní-àgọ́ tí ó ń gbé ní àwọn àyíká líle.

source: Protists are eukaryotic, mostly unicellular organisms.
target: Àwọn prọ́tístì jẹ́ onípádi-gidi, púpọ̀ àwọn èdá oníyè onípádikan.

source: Fungi are eukaryotic, heterotrophic organisms.
target: Àwọn alára-osun jẹ́ onípádi-gidi, àwọn èdá oníyè ajẹ-oníyè.

source: Plants are eukaryotic, photosynthetic organisms.
target: Àwọn ògbìn jẹ́ onípádi-gidi, àwọn èdá oníyè ìṣeé̩dà onjẹ pẹ̀lú ìtànná.

source: Animals are eukaryotic, heterotrophic, multicellular organisms.
target: Àwọn ẹran jẹ́ onípádi-gidi, ajẹ-oníyè, àwọn èdá oníyè onípádipúpọ̀.

source: Viruses are acellular, obligate intracellular parasites.
target: Àwọn ọlọ́jẹ̀ jẹ́ aláìpádi, àwọn ajẹtìmọlẹ̀ inú-pádi dandan.

source: Bacteria have a cell wall containing peptidoglycan.
target: Àwọn alámọ̀ ní àmọ̀ pádi tí ó ní pẹ́ptídòglàìkán.

source: Eukaryotic cells have membrane-bound organelles.
target: Àwọn pádi onípádi-gidi ní àwọn eyawere inu padi mẹ́mbíréénì-ìdè.

source: The endosymbiotic theory explains the origin of mitochondria and chloroplasts.
target: Ìlànà ìgbétímọ́ra-inú ṣàlàyé ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ àwọn eya àti àwọn èyàtúwà.

source: Biodiversity is the variety of life on Earth.
target: Onírúurú-ìyè jẹ́ oríṣiríṣi ìyè lórí Ilẹ̀ Ayé.

source: Biodiversity includes genetic diversity, species diversity, and ecosystem diversity.
target: Onírúurú-ìyè pẹ̀lú onírúurú ìran, onírúurú ọ̀wọ́, àti onírúurú ètò àyíká.

source: Conservation biology aims to protect biodiversity.
target: Ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ ìtọ́jú ń gbìyànjú láti dá onírúurú-ìyè bò.

source: Habitat destruction is a major threat to biodiversity.
target: Ìparun ibùgbé jẹ́ ewu pàtàkì sí onírúurú-ìyè.

source: An organ system is a group of anatomical structures that work together to perform a specific function or task.
target: Èto ẹya-ara jẹ akojọpọ awọn oriṣi iṣu-ara ti nwọn nbaraṣiṣẹ pọ fun aṣeyọri ọya kan ninu ara.

source: The failure of even one organ system could lead to severe disability or even death.
target: Ikuna ikan ninu wọn si le e mu ki aiṣedede ba ara tabi ki ẹda tilẹ ku.

source: An organ or structure that is included in one system may also be included in another.
target: Eya-ara kan ti a ba ka mọ ikan ninu eto yi si le tun jẹyọ ninu eto miran.

source: The Respiratory System includes the nose, trachea, and lungs.
target: Ètò èyà-ìpòyìdà ara ni ihò imú, òpó-mímí, àti ẹdọforó.

source: The Digestive System includes the mouth, esophagus, stomach, and intestines.
target: Ètò èyà-ẹdà-onjẹ ara ni ẹnu, òòfà-ọfun, ikùn, àti ìfun.

source: Arthropods are a large group of invertebrates, which means they do not have backbones.
target: Awọn kòkòrò jẹ agbo-ẹyà nla kan lara awọn ẹranko alailọpa-ẹhin, ti o tumọ si pe wọn ko ni ọpa-ẹhin.

source: Arthropods have jointed feet, a segmented body, and an exoskeleton.
target: Awọn kòkòrò ní awọn ẹsẹ to papọ, ara to ní awẹ, nwọn si ní nkan to le bi eegun ni ode ara wọn.

source: Insects are the most diverse organisms in the history of life.
target: Awọn ẹlẹsẹmẹfa lo jẹ awọn ẹda-oniyẹ to ni oriṣiriṣi ju lati ọjọ ti alaye ti da aye.

source: Arachnids are distinguished from insects by the fact they do not have antennae or wings.
target: Awọn ẹlẹsẹmẹjọ yatọ si awọn ẹlẹsẹmẹfa ni ti pe wọn ko ni mọgala, ko si si ninu wọn to ni iye-apa.

source: All arachnids have eight legs.
target: Gbogbo wọn lo ni ẹsẹ mẹjọ.

source: The bodies of arachnids are divided into two sections.
target: Ara awọn ẹlẹsẹmẹjọ pin si meji: ori-oun-aya lapapọ ni iwaju ati ikun lẹhin.

source: The digestive system processes food that we eat.
target: Ètò ẹdà-onjẹ ara ló nṣe àyípadà onjẹ tí a jẹ.

source: It is made up of multiple organs and glands that digest the food.
target: Àwọn èyà-inú àti ẹṣé-̣oje inú rẹ pé oríṣiríṣi tí wọn nlọ onjẹ yi.

source: The digestive system consists of the buccal cavity, esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine.
target: Ètò ẹdà-onjẹ ara ní àwọn nkan wọnyí: ihò ẹnu, òòfà-ọfun, ikùn, ìfun kékeré, agbẹdu.

source: The alimentary canal is also called the digestive tract.
target: Àpapọ gbogbo àwọn yi ni a npè ní ìfun onjẹ.

source: The liver is part of the digestive system.
target: Èdọ, ẹdọki jẹ apá kan ninu ètò ẹdà-onjẹ ara.

source: The pancreas produces digestive enzymes.
target: Èdọ-òrónro npèsè àwọn ẹyàwuuru tó nran lọwọ láti da onjẹ.ẹ̀

source: The Circulatory system passes nutrients, gases, hormones, and blood cells to and from cells in the body.
target: Ètò ìṣòn-èjẹ̀nṣe ìfiránṣẹ àwọn èròjà, òyì, oje-ara, pádi èjẹ̀láti àti lọ sí àwọn pádi ara.

source: Blood Vessels are tubes that carry blood as it circulates.
target: Àwọn Ìṣòn èjẹ̀jé ̣àwọn inú òpó tí èjẹ̀tí nṣọn yí ara kaakiri.

source: Arteries bring oxygenated blood from the heart and lungs.
target: Àwọn ìṣòn-èjẹ̀àlọ ngbé èjẹ̀olóyi-iná láti ọkàn àti ẹdọforó.

source: Veins return oxygen-depleted blood back to the heart and lungs.
target: Àwọn ìṣòn-èjẹ̀àbọ nṣe ìdápadà èjẹ̀alòyì-iná lọ sí ọkàn àti ẹdọforó.

source: Capillaries are very thin, fragile blood vessels.
target: Àwọn òpó-èjẹ̀jé ̣àwọn òpó tinrin-tinrin tí wọn ngba èjè.̣

source: Plasma helps transport vital substances around the body.
target: Oje-èjẹ̀ran lọ́wọ́ fún àgbéká àwọn èròjà kòṣeémáni yí ara ka.

source: The immune system protects against disease by identifying and killing pathogens and tumor cells.
target: Eya òkí-ara jé ̣àwọn ètò àti ìlànà nínú èdá-oníyè tó nṣe ìdáàbò bo ara lọwọ àwọn àrùn nípa ṣiṣe àfihàn àti pípa àwọn èyàwuuru afàìsàn àti àwọn pádi tó nfa lẹẹrẹ àti jẹjẹrẹ.

source: It detects a wide variety of agents, from viruses to parasitic worms.
target: Ó nṣe àfarahàn ọpọlọpọ àwọn àlejò ara, bẹrẹ láti àwọn ọlọjẹ títídé àwọn aràn ajọfẹ.

source: Immunodeficiencies occur when one or more of the components of the immune system are inactive.
target: Òkí-ara àìtó má nṣẹlẹ nígbàtí ìkan tàbí púpọ nínú àwọn nkan-inú ètò òkí-ara yi bá wà ní àìṣedéédé.

source: All the cells of the immune system are initially derived from the bone marrow.
target: Gbogbo àwọn pádi ti ètò òkí-ara tó ṣẹ láti imùdùnmúdùn èjè.̣

source: The spleen is an immunologic filter of the blood.
target: Àmọ jé ̣asẹ fún èjẹ̀tó njé ̣kí òkí-ara ṣe déédé.

source: Malnutrition affects the immune system.
target: Ìkúdùn àìdára-ìjẹ nṣe ìdílówọ́fún èyà òkí-ara.

source: Estimates of the number of arthropod species account for over 80% of all known living animal species.
target: Bi a bá fi oju-inu wo awọn òwọ́ awọn kòkòrò to wà, a oo ri i pe nwọn kópa to ida-ọrun ọgọrin ninu gbogbo ìdílé ẹranko aiye gbogbo.

source: They range in size from microscopic plankton up to several meters across.
target: Nipa titobi, a ri ninu wọn to kere to jẹ wipe a fẹrẹ ma le fi oju ri wọn; bẹẹ gẹgẹ ni a si ri awọn ti o to ọpọ mita ni gigun.

source: Arthropods are mainly terrestrial in their habitat but are found throughout marine and freshwater environments.
target: Awọn kòkòrò jẹ ẹranko ti wọn saba ma ngbe lori ilẹ ṣugbọn a ri ninu wọn ti wọn nfi inu omi amu se ibugbe.

source: Insects have a chitinous exoskeleton, a three-part body, three pairs of jointed legs, and compound eyes.
target: Nwọn ni abarajọ-eegun ni ode ara wọn, nwọn si ni ara to pin si ọna meta: ori, aya, at'ikun. Nwọn ni ẹsẹ mẹfa to parapọ ni mejimeji. Oju wọn si wa ni ominira ara won.

source: Crustaceans form a very large group of arthropods.
target: Awọn onigbalẹhin tun jẹ idilẹ nla kan laarin awọn kokoro.

source: Crustaceans have a hard exoskeleton, jointed legs, and a segmented body that is bilaterally symmetrical.
target: Nwọn ni abarajọ-eegun lode ara to le pupọ. Nwọn si ni awọn ẹsẹ to parapọ, ati ara to ni ọpọlọpọ awẹ sugbọn ti tọtun-tosi wọn baradọgba.

source: The digestive system extracts energy and nutrients from food.
target: Ètò ẹdà-onjẹ ara nfa okun àti èròjà yọ láti inú onjẹ.

source: It later expels the waste by-products.
target: Lẹhìn náà wọn a sì ṣe ìmúkúrò ẹgbin tó ṣẹkù.

source: Mastication is the process of chewing food.
target: Láti rún onjẹ ni ìṣe dídá onjẹ kékèké lẹnu.

source: The mouth contains different types of teeth for different functions.
target: Ẹnu ni àwọn oriṣiriṣi ehín fún oríṣiríṣi iṣẹ.

source: Incisors are the front teeth used for cutting food.
target: Ẹwà-ehin ni àwọn ehín iwájú tí a fi nge onjẹ.

source: Molars are the back teeth used for grinding food.
target: Èrìkì àgbà ni àwọn ehín ẹhìn tí a fi nlọ́ onjẹ.

source: The small intestine absorbs nutrients from digested food.
target: Ìfun kékeré nfa èròjà láti inú onjẹ tí a ti dà.

source: The circulatory system helps fight diseases and stabilize body temperature.
target: Ètò ìṣòn-èjẹ̀nṣe ikoju ija sí àwọn àrùn àti láti jé ̣kí ìgbóná ara wà ní ìfẹsèṃúlẹ.

source: Arteries are muscular blood vessels that carry oxygenated blood away from the heart.
target: Àwọn Ìṣòn-èjẹ̀àlọ jé ̣òpó alágbara tó ngbé èjẹ̀olóyi-iná kúrò láti ọkàn.

source: Capillaries exchange oxygen and carbon dioxide.
target: Àwọn òpó-èjẹ̀a ṣe pàṣípààrọ òyì-iná pèlú òyì-èédú.

source: Veins deliver waste-rich blood to the heart.
target: Àwọn ìṣòn-èjẹ̀àbọ a ṣe ìfiránṣẹ èjẹ̀tó kún fún ẹgbin sí ọkàn.

source: Red blood cells transport oxygen and carbon dioxide.
target: Pádi-èjẹ̀pupa nṣe àgbéká òyì-iná àti òyì-eedu.

source: White blood cells defend the body by fighting diseases.
target: Pádi-èjẹ̀funfun ṣe ìgbèjà ara nípa bíbá àwọn èdá-afàìsàn jà.

source: Pathogens can evolve rapidly and adapt to avoid the immune system.
target: Àwọn èyàwuuru afàìsàn yi má nparadà ní kíákíá láti farapamọ fún àwọn òkí-ara yi.

source: The immune system detects a wide variety of agents.
target: Ètò òkí-ara nṣe àfarahàn ọpọlọpọ àwọn àlejò ara.

source: Benign tumors are non-cancerous growths in the body.
target: Léẹ́ṛé ̣ni àwọn ikókó inú ara tí wọn kì í fa jẹjẹrẹ.

source: Malignant tumors are cancerous growths that can spread to other parts of the body.
target: Jẹjẹrẹ ni àwọn ikókó inú ara tí ó lè tànkálẹ̀ sí àwọn ibi mhìíràn nínú ara.

source: The lymph nodes function as an immunologic filter for the bodily fluid known as lymph.
target: Àwọn asé ̣omi-ara nṣiṣé ̣gég̣éḅí asé ̣nípa mímú òkí-ara fún omi-ara.

source: Alcohol abuse affects the immune system.
target: Ìmukúmu nṣe ìdílówọ́fún èyà òkí-ara.

source: Lack of exercise can weaken the immune system.
target: Àìṣe eré ìdárayá lè mú kí òkí-ara di aláìlera.

source: The body could not function without the cooperation of all of its organ systems.
target: Ara ẹda ko si lee gbeṣẹ lai si ifọwọsowọpọ awọn eto awọn ẹya-ara yi.

source: Each organ system has a distinct entity.
target: Ikankan ninu eto awọn ẹya-ara li a da lati gbajumọ iṣẹ kan gboogi ninu ara.

source: The functions of the body's organ systems overlap considerably.
target: Wọn ki i ṣe lai ran ara wọn lọwọ ni ọpọ igba.

source: The Endocrine system consists of glands.
target: Ètò èyà-ẹṣé ̣àìlópo ni àwọn ẹṣẹ́ oje-ara.

source: The Excretory system removes waste from the body.
target: Ètò èyà-ìkẹgbin ara má ń mú ẹ̀gbin jáde nínú ara.

source: The Integumentary System protects the body.
target: Ètò èyà-awọ-ara ndáàbò bo ara.

source: The Lymphatic System helps maintain fluid balance.
target: Ètò èyà-ìṣòn omi-ara nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìṣeétò omi inú ara.

source: Myriapods are a group of arthropods that includes millipedes and centipedes.
target: Awọn ẹlẹsẹwuuru jẹ ẹya kòkòrò kan. Lara wọn ni awọn ọkun, onigba-ẹsẹ, ati awọn òwọ́ kekeke miran.

source: Myriapod species are all terrestrial.
target: Eranko ori ilẹ si ni gbogbo wọn.

source: Centipedes and millipedes look similar to each other.
target: Awọn onigba-ẹsẹ ati awọn ọkun jọ ara wọn.

source: Myriapods have a segmented body with paired appendages.
target: Gbogbo awọn ẹlẹsẹwuuru lo ni ara to ni ọpọlọpọ awẹ, awẹ kọọkan si ni ẹsẹ mejimeji to parapọ.

source: Crustaceans include crabs, lobsters, crayfish, and shrimp.
target: Ninu awọn onigbalẹhin ni awọn ẹranko bi alakan, alakaṣa, akọ-ede, ati ede.

source: Crustaceans have two pairs of sensory antennae.
target: Nwọn ni mọgala meji-meji, ijagbọn meji, ati eegun-ẹrẹkẹ meji.

source: The alimentary canal is the passage through which food passes.
target: Ìfun onjẹ ni ọ̀nà tí onjẹ ngbà kọjá nínú ara.

source: The salivary glands produce saliva to aid digestion.
target: Àwọn ẹṣé-̣itọ npese itọ láti ran ìsẹ́ dídà onjẹ lọ́wọ́.

source: The liver produces bile which helps in digestion.
target: Èdọ npese òrónro tí ó nran lọ́wọ́ fún ìsẹ́ dídà onjẹ.

source: The gallbladder stores bile produced by the liver.
target: Òrónro, Òróòro ngba òrónro tí èdọ npese sílẹ̀.

source: The pancreas produces pancreatic juice.
target: Èdọ-òrónro npese oje èdọ-òrónro.

source: The rectum is the final part of the large intestine.
target: Abọọdí, Abọ-ìdí ni apá ìkẹyìn ìfun nlá.

source: The esophagus is the food pipe that connects the mouth to the stomach.
target: Òòfà-ọfun ni ọ̀nà tí onjẹ gbà láti ẹnu lọ sí ikùn.

source: The heart pumps blood throughout the body.
target: Ọkàn ngbé èjẹ̀jáde kiri gbogbo ara.

source: During systole, the heart contracts.
target: Ní ìgbà ìsọkì, ọkàn a fara pamọ́.

source: During diastole, the heart relaxes.
target: Ní ìgbà ifera, ọkàn a tu sílẹ̀.

source: Blood circulation is the movement of blood around the body.
target: Ìṣònyíká èjẹ̀ni ìrìn èjẹ̀yí ara kákìrí.

source: Blood coagulation is the process of blood clotting.
target: Èjẹ dídì ni ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ èjẹ dí di èépá.

source: Platelets help in blood clotting and wound healing.
target: Adèépá èjẹ̀ran lọ́wọ́ fún dída èépá àti láti máa mú egbò sán.

source: Plasma is the fluid part of blood.
target: Oje-èjẹ̀ni apá oje nínú èjè.̣

source: The immune system distinguishes pathogens from the organism's own healthy cells.
target: Ètò òkí-ara ṣe ìdáyàtọ láarín àwọn èyàwuuru afàìsàn àti àwọn pádi ara fúnraarẹ tó dára.

source: The bone marrow is where all immune cells are initially derived.
target: Ìmùdùnmúdùn èjẹ̀ni ibi tí gbogbo àwọn pádi òkí-ara ti bẹ̀rẹ̀.

source: The spleen filters the blood for immunological purposes.
target: Àmọ nṣe asẹ èjẹ̀fún òkí-ara láti ṣe déédé.

source: Viral diseases can affect the immune system.
target: Àwọn àìsàn ọlọjẹ le ní ipa lórí ètò òkí-ara.

source: Age is a factor that affects the immune system.
target: Ogbó jẹ́ òkùnfà tí ó nṣe ìdílówọ́fún èyà òkí-ara.

source: Depression can affect immune function.
target: Ìbànújé ̣le ní ipa lórí bí òkí-ara ṣe nṣiṣẹ́.

source: Environmental toxins can damage the immune system.
target: Àwọn nkan olóró tó wà nínú àyíká lè bà òkí-ara jẹ́.

source: The nervous system coordinates the body's responses.
target: Ètò èyà-èṣọ-ara nṣe àkójọpọ̀ àwọn ìdáhùn ara.

source: The respiratory system exchanges oxygen and carbon dioxide.
target: Ètò èyà-ìpòyìdà ara nṣe pàṣípààrọ òyì-iná pèllú òyì-èédú.

source: The urinary system removes liquid waste from the body.
target: Ètò èyà-títọ ara nyọ ẹ̀gbin omi jáde nínú ara.

source: Cells are the building blocks of all living organisms.
target: Àwọn pádi ni àwọn pilẹ̀ kọ́kọ́rọ́ gbogbo àwọn ẹ̀dá alààyè.

source: Tissues are groups of similar cells that work together.
target: Àwọn ìṣù jẹ́ àkójọpọ̀ àwọn pádi tí ó jọra tí wọ́n sì nṣiṣẹ́ pọ̀.

source: Parasites live on or in another organism and benefit at its expense.
target: Àwọn ajọfẹ́ ngbé lára tàbí nínú ẹ̀dá mìíràn, wọ́n sì nṣe àwọn ohun tí yóò ran àwọn fúnrarẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ ṣùgbọ́n tí kò dára fún ẹ̀dá náà.

source: Bacteria are microscopic single-celled organisms.
target: Àwọn bátéríà jẹ́ àwọn ẹ̀dá kékeré tí a kò lè fi ojú rí tí wọ́n sì jẹ́ pádi kan.

source: The body functions as an integrated unit of organ systems.
target: Ara ṣiṣẹ́ bí àpapọ̀ àwọn ètò èyà-ara.

source: Each system relies on the others for proper functioning.
target: Ètò kọ̀ọ̀kan gbẹ́kẹ̀lé àwọn ìyókù fún ìṣiṣẹ́ tí ó tọ́.

source: Organs can be part of multiple systems at once.
target: Àwọn èyà-ara lè jẹ́ apá kan nínú àwọn ètò púpọ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan.

source: The integration of systems is necessary for health.
target: Ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ àwọn ètò jẹ́ ohun pàtàkì fún ìlera.

source: The reproductive system ensures the continuation of the species.
target: Ètò èyà-bíbí èdá-oníyè ndá àbò bò ìtẹ̀síwájú àwọn ẹ̀dá.

source: The immune system defends the body against foreign invaders.
target: Ètò èyà-òkí-ara ndáàbò bo ara lòdì sí àwọn àlejò-ara aláìnípẹ̀.

source: The skeletal system provides structure and support.
target: Ètò èyà-eegun ara npese àgbékalẹ̀ àti àtìlẹ̀yìn.

source: Arthropods have a hard exoskeleton made of chitin.
target: Àwọn kòkòrò ní abarajọ-eegun lóde ara tí ó le tí a ṣe pẹ̀lú kítínì.

source: Exoskeletons provide protection and support for arthropods.
target: Abarajọ-eegun nfún àwọn kòkòrò ní àbò àti àtìlẹ̀yìn.

source: Spiders produce silk from special glands.
target: Àwọn alántakùn npèsè ìṣẹ́ láti inú àwọn ẹṣẹ́ pàtàkì.

source: Insects undergo metamorphosis during development.
target: Àwọn ẹlẹsẹmẹfa má n lo ìyípadà-àwòrán nígbà ìdàgbàsókè.

source: Many crustaceans have specialized mouth parts for feeding.
target: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn onígbálẹ̀hìn ní àwọn ẹ̀yà ẹnu pàtàkì fún jíjẹun.

source: Insects have one pair of antennae while crustaceans have two.
target: Àwọn ẹlẹsẹmẹfa ní mọ̀gálá méjì-méjì nígbàtí àwọn onígbálẹ̀hìn ní mẹ́rin-mẹ́rin.

source: Arthropods molt their exoskeletons as they grow.
target: Àwọn kòkòrò má n bọ́ abarajọ-eegun wọn bí wọ́n ṣe ndàgbà.

source: Digestion begins in the mouth with mechanical breakdown.
target: Ẹ̀dà-onjẹ bẹ̀rẹ̀ nínú ẹnu pẹ̀lú ìrúmọ́.

source: Saliva contains enzymes that begin breaking down carbohydrates.
target: Itọ ní àwọn ẹyàwuuru tí ó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ìdálẹ̀ àwọn ìjẹ-àgbàlagbà.

source: The stomach produces acid to help break down proteins.
target: Ikùn npèse ìfunná láti ran ìdálẹ̀ àwọn ẹyà-ara lọ́wọ́.

source: The small intestine is the primary site of nutrient absorption.
target: Ìfun kékeré ni ibi pàtàkì fún ìfàmúná àwọn èròjà.

source: Bile emulsifies fats to aid in digestion.
target: Òrónro nṣe ìdápọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rá láti ran ẹ̀dà-onjẹ lọ́wọ́.

source: The large intestine absorbs water from indigestible food matter.
target: Ìfun nlá nfa omi yọ láti inú àwọn onjẹ tí a kò lè dà.l

source: Peristalsis is the wave-like muscle contractions that move food.
target: Ìsọ̀n-jíjìnà ni ìfara-pamọ́ iṣan bí irú-omi tí ó nṣí onjẹ lọ.

source: The circulatory system helps maintain homeostasis.
target: Ètò ìṣòn-èjẹ̀nran lọ́wọ́ láti ṣàgbékalẹ̀ ìdọ̀gba-ara.

source: Hemoglobin in red blood cells binds to oxygen.
target: Aṣọ-ẹ̀jẹ̀ nínú àwọn pádi-èjẹ̀pupa so mọ́ òyì-iná.

source: White blood cells come in several types with different functions.
target: Pádi-èjẹ̀funfun wá ní oríṣiríṣi pẹ̀lú iṣẹ́ ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀.

source: Blood pH is carefully regulated to maintain health.
target: A ṣàkóso ìpẹ̀kan èjẹ̀pẹ̀lú ìtọ́júu láti fi ṣàgbékalẹ̀ ìlera.

source: The pulse is the rhythmic expansion of an artery.
target: Ìlù-ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni ìgbòòrò àti ìfẹ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan ìṣòn-èjẹ̀àlọ.

source: Blood pressure is the force exerted by blood against vessel walls.
target: Agbára-ẹ̀jẹ̀ ni ipá tí èjẹ̀fi le ògiri àwọn ìṣòn èjè.̣

source: The heart has four chambers: two atria and two ventricles.
target: Ọkàn ní yàrá mẹ́rin: ilé-ìgbà méjì àti ilé-ìgbàsẹ́ méjì.

source: The immune system has innate and adaptive responses.
target: Ètò òkí-ara ní ìdáhùn adálẹ́mọ́ àti aláfihànyípadà.

source: Antibodies are proteins that recognize specific pathogens.
target: Àwọn sójà-ara jẹ́ àwọn ẹyà-ara tí ó mọ àwọn èyàwuuru afàìsàn pàtàkì.

source: Inflammation is a protective response to injury or infection.
target: Wíwú ni ìdáhùn àbò sí ọgbẹ́ tàbí ìkóràn.

source: Vaccination strengthens the immune system against specific diseases.
target: Àjẹsára nmú kí ètò òkí-ara le kọjú ija sí àwọn àìsàn pàtàkì.

source: Fevers help the body fight infection by raising its temperature.
target: Ibà nran ara lọ́wọ́ láti bá ìkóràn jà nípa gbígbé ìgbóná-ara sókè.

source: The immune system develops memory for pathogens it has encountered.
target: Ètò òkí-ara npèsè ìrántí fún àwọn èyàwuuru afàìsàn tí ó ti pàdé.

source: Stress hormones can suppress immune function.
target: Àwọn oje-ara àníyàn lè tẹ iṣẹ́ òkí-ara ba.

source: Cell division allows organisms to grow and reproduce.
target: Pínpín pádi nfún àwọn ẹ̀dá láàyè láti dàgbà àti bí.

source: Respiration is the process of gas exchange in living organisms.
target: Mímí ni ìlànà ìpààrọ̀ òyì nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá alààyè.

source: Metabolism includes all chemical reactions in living organisms.
target: Ìṣeàyíká-oje ní gbogbo àwọn ìdárapọ̀ kẹ́míkà nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá alààyè.

source: Photosynthesis is how plants make their food using sunlight.
target: Ìṣepèsè-òogùn ni bí àwọn ewé ṣe npèsè oúnjẹ wọn nípa lílo ìmọ́lẹ̀ òòrùn.

source: Species adapt to their environments over generations.
target: Àwọn òwọ́ nyípadà sí àyíká wọn ní ìran dé ìran.

source: Genetics is the study of heredity and variation in organisms.
target: Ìmọ̀-ogidi-ẹ̀dá ni ẹ̀kọ́ nípa ìjogún àti ìyàtọ̀ nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá.

source: Ecology studies the relationships between organisms and their environment.
target: Ìmọ̀-ìbágbépọ̀-ẹ̀dá nṣe ìwádìí àwọn ìbáṣepọ̀ láàrin àwọn ẹ̀dá àti àyíká wọn.

source: Healthcare science is the applied science dealing with the application of science, technology, engineering or mathematics to the delivery of healthcare.
target: Èḳọ́ nípa Ìlera jẹ́ èḳọ́ ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ tó nlò ọgbón òun òye ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀, ìmọ̀-èṛọ, iṣẹ́-èṛọ àti ìṣirò fún ìjíṣẹ́ ètò ìlera.

source: Healthcare scientists diagnose and treat diseases.
target: Àwọn onímòn-jìnlẹ̀ èḳọ́ ìlera nṣe ìwádi-àìsàn àti ìwòsàn fún àwọn aláìsàn.

source: The doctor provides care and support for patients.
target: Dókítà npèsè ìṣètójụ́ àti àtìléhìǹ fún àwọn aláìsàn.

source: Healthcare science incorporates biology, genetics, physiology, and physics.
target: Èḳọ́ nípa ìlera jẹ́ kòkárí àwọn ojúlówó èḳọ́ ìmọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ bí èḳọ́ èdá-oníyè, èḳọ́ nípa ìran, èḳọ́ nípa ìwúlò èyà-ara, àti èḳọ́ èdá.

source: Some healthcare programs focus on improving patient health.
target: Àwọn ètò-èḳọ́ míran dá lé ìtóḳásí àwọn nkan tó le ṣe ìlera fún aláìsàn.

source: Vitamins are essential for good health.
target: Ajíra jẹ́ pàtàkì fún ìlera pípé.

source: A balanced diet provides adequate nutrition.
target: Ìjẹèṃun pípé npèsè àwọn ọ̀jẹ̀ tótọ́.

source: Maintaining cleanliness prevents many diseases.
target: Ṣíṣe ìmótótọ́ ndáàbò bò fún àìsàn púpọ̀.

source: Proteins are necessary for muscle development.
target: Òjẹ̀ jẹ́ pàtàkì fún ìdàgbàsókè iṣan.

source: Carbohydrates provide energy for the body.
target: Èlạ̀-okun npèsè okun fún ara.

source: Mineral salts help maintain proper body function.
target: Iyọ̀ afáralókun nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìṣiṣẹ́ ara tó tọ́.

source: HIV causes AIDS by weakening the immune system.
target: Ọlójẹ̀ afàìgbéṣẹ́ òkí-ara ló nfa Àìsàn Àìgbéṣẹ́ òkí-ara nípa mímú kí òkí-ara má ṣiṣẹ́.

source: Malaria is a common tropical disease.
target: Ibà jẹ́ àìsàn tó wọ́pọ̀ ní àwọn àgbègbè tí ojú-ọjọ́ gbóná.

source: Leprosy affects the skin and nerves.
target: Èṭẹ̀ ní ipa lórí awọ àti èṣọ́ ara.

source: Tuberculosis is a disease of the lungs.
target: Jèdòjèdọ̀ jẹ́ àìsàn èdòf̣oró.

source: Typhoid fever is transmitted through contaminated food.
target: Jèfunjèfun ní àrùn tí ńgbá onjẹ elegbin wọ ara.

source: Tuberculosis spreads through the air when infected people cough.
target: Jèdòjèdọ̀ nránni nígbà tí aláìsàn bá nwúkọ́.

source: Cholera causes severe diarrhea and vomiting.
target: Onígbáméjì nfa ìgbẹ́ gbuuru àti èébì.

source: Hookworm enters the body through the skin.
target: Jàgbàyà wọ ara láti ìhà awọ.

source: Whooping cough is highly contagious through droplets in the air.
target: Ikọ́ líle ọmọdé nránni látinú kèlèḅẹ́ tí ńfò ní ojúfò.

source: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted infection.
target: Àtòṣí jẹ́ àìsàn tí ńránni nígbà ìbálòpọ̀.

source: Smallpox causes a distinctive skin rash.
target: Ṣòp̣òná nfa àwọn èy̩ụ́n pàtàkì lára.

source: Leprosy symptoms develop slowly over many years.
target: Àwọn àmì Èṭẹ̀ njáde jẹ́ẹ́jẹ́ lórí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún.

source: Vitamin A helps prevent night blindness.
target: Ajíra A nṣe ìdíwọ́ fún àìlè ríran dáradára ní òru.

source: Vitamin B1 helps the body use food for energy.
target: Ajíra B1 nfún ara ní làákàyè láti jẹ́ onjẹ déédé.

source: Vitamin B2 helps maintain healthy skin and eyes.
target: Ajíra B2 nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún awọ àti ojú tótọ́.

source: Vitamin C prevents scurvy and strengthens the immune system.
target: Ajíra C nṣe ìdíwọ́ àrùn ekúru àti mímú òkí-ara lágbára.

source: Vitamin D is important for bone health.
target: Ajíra D jẹ́ pàtàkì fún ìlera egungun.

source: Vitamin E helps protect cells from damage.
target: Ajíra E nṣe ìdáàbòbò àwọn hóró ara.

source: Vitamin K helps blood to clot properly.
target: Ajíra K nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún kí èjẹ̀ di èépá bí ó ṣe yẹ.

source: Citrus fruits are good sources of Vitamin C.
target: Àwọn ọsàn jẹ́ orísun tó dára fún Ajíra C.

source: Eggs and meat provide Vitamin A.
target: Ẹyin àti ẹran npèsè Ajíra A.

source: Green vegetables contain Vitamin K.
target: Àwọn èfọ́ tútù ní Ajíra K nínú.

source: The patient has a high fever.
target: Aláìsàn náà ní ibà gbígbóná.

source: She is experiencing severe headache.
target: Ó ní orí fífọ́ púpọ̀.

source: The doctor prescribed medication for tuberculosis.
target: Dókítà fún un ní òògùn fún jèdòjèdọ̀.

source: Regular handwashing prevents many infectious diseases.
target: Fífọ ọwọ́ déédé ndènà ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àrùn arọnni.

source: The baby received vaccines against measles.
target: Ọmọ ọwọ́ náà gba abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára fún kitipi.

source: Malaria symptoms include fever and body aches.
target: Àwọn àmì ibà pẹ̀lú ara ríro jẹ́ àmì ibàá-gbóná

source: Diabetes requires careful monitoring of blood sugar.
target: Àtògbẹ nílò ìṣọ́ sí ìwọ̀n súgà inú ẹ̀jẹ̀.

source: The epidemic spread rapidly through the community.
target: Àjàkálẹ̀-àrùn tànkálẹ̀ kíákíá ní àdúgbò.

source: The dentist treated the dental caries.
target: Dókítà ehín ṣe ìtọ́jú ehín kíkẹ̀.

source: Genetic diseases are passed from parents to children.
target: Àwọn àrùn àfijogún ńlọ láti òbí sí ọmọ.

source: The laboratory scientist analyzed the blood sample.
target: Onímọ̀-jìnlẹ̀ ilé-iṣẹ́ àyẹ̀wò ṣe ìtúpalẹ̀ àwọn àyẹ̀wò ẹ̀jẹ̀.

source: The nutritionist recommended a balanced diet.
target: Onímọ̀ nípa ìjẹun dámọ̀ràn ìjẹẹ̀mun pípé.

source: Medical research helps develop new treatments.
target: Ìwádìí nípa ìṣègùn nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìdàgbàsókè àwọn ìtọ́jú tuntun.

source: The nurse administered the injection carefully.
target: Nọ́ọ̀sì fún un ní abẹ́rẹ́ pẹ̀lú ìṣọ́ra.

source: Regular exercise improves cardiovascular health.
target: Ìṣeré-iṣẹ́ déédé nṣe ìtọ́jú ìlera ọkàn àti ìṣàn ẹ̀jẹ̀.

source: Preventive healthcare reduces the risk of serious illness.
target: Ètò ìlera àbojútó ndín ewu àìsàn lílé kù.

source: Mental health is as important as physical health.
target: Ìlera ọpọlọ ṣe pàtàkì bí ìlera ara.

source: The physiotherapist helped with the rehabilitation exercises.
target: Onímọ̀ nípa ìdá-ara-padà ṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ pẹ̀lú àwọn iṣẹ́-ẹ̀rìn ìmúdára-padà.

source: The medical team collaborated on the complex case.
target: Àwọn ẹgbẹ́ ìṣègùn ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ lórí ọ̀rọ̀ líle náà.

source: The healthcare system aims to improve public health.
target: Ètò ìlera ní àfojúsùn láti mú ìlera àwùjọ dára si.

source: Jaundice causes yellowing of the skin and eyes.
target: Iba ponju-ponju nfa àwọ̀ pupa sí ara àti ojú.

source: Measles presents with a characteristic rash and fever.
target: Kitipi máa ńfarahàn pẹ̀lú àwọn èyí pàtàkì àti ibà.

source: Meningitis is an inflammation of the membranes covering the brain.
target: Ibà-orí jẹ́ wíwú àwọn ìlà tó bo ọpọlọ.

source: Cancer requires early diagnosis for effective treatment.
target: Jẹjẹrẹ nílò ìdámọ̀ kíákíá fún ìtọ́jú tó ṣiṣẹ́.

source: Pneumonia affects the lungs and breathing.
target: Àrùn èdọ̀foró ní ipa lórí èdọ̀foró àti mímí.

source: Polio can cause permanent paralysis.
target: Àìsàn rọpárọsẹ̀ le fa àìlè rìn láéláé.

source: Rabies is transmitted through animal bites.
target: Àrùn dìgbòlugi ńgbàkálẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ ṣíṣan ẹranko.

source: Ringworm is a fungal infection of the skin.
target: Ekùsá jẹ́ ààrùn èṣo-funfun lára awọ.

source: Scabies causes intense itching of the skin.
target: Èékú nfa hinahina ara tó lágbára.

source: Stomach ulcer causes abdominal pain.
target: Ọgbẹ́-inú nfa ìrora inú.

source: Stroke affects brain function suddenly.
target: Àrùn ẹ̀gbà ní ipa lórí iṣẹ́ ọpọlọ lójijì.

source: Tooth decay is caused by poor dental hygiene.
target: Ehín kíkẹ̀ jẹ́ àbájáde àìtọ́jú ehín dáadáa.

source: Yellow fever is transmitted by mosquitoes.
target: Ibà pupa ńgbàkálẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ ẹ̀fọn.

source: Epilepsy causes seizures and convulsions.
target: Wárápá nfa ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ gígbọn àti mímì.

source: Heart attack requires immediate medical attention.
target: Ìkọlù ọkàn nílò ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀.

source: High blood pressure increases the risk of stroke.
target: Ẹ̀jẹ̀ ríru nṣe àfikún ewu àrùn ẹ̀gbà.

source: Typhoid fever spreads through contaminated food and water.
target: Jẹfunjẹfun tànkálẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ onjẹ àti omi elegbin.

source: Tuberculosis is transmitted through the air when infected people cough.
target: Jẹ̀dọ̀jẹ̀dọ̀ ńgbàkálẹ̀ láti ojú-ọ̀fúrufú nígbà tí aláìsàn bá wúkọ́.

source: Cholera causes severe diarrhea and dehydration.
target: Onígbáméjì nfa ìgbẹ́ gbuuru àti àìní omi lára.

source: Whooping cough is characterized by severe coughing fits.
target: Ikọ́ líle ọmọdé ní àmì pàtàkì ikọ́ líle.

source: Gonorrhea affects the genitourinary system.
target: Àtọṣí ní ipa lórí ètò ìtọ̀ àti ìbísí.

source: Smallpox spreads through direct contact and respiratory droplets.
target: Ṣọ̀pọ̀ná tànkálẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ fífi ara kan aláìsàn àti kèlèḅẹ́ ọ̀nà ọ̀fúrufú.

source: Leprosy transmission occurs through prolonged contact with infected persons.
target: Ìgbàkálẹ̀ Ẹ̀tẹ̀ ṣẹlẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ ìbára-ẹni-fínra pẹ̀lú àwọn aláìsàn fún ìgbà pípẹ́.

source: Dengue fever is spread by mosquitoes.
target: Ibà inú eegun ńgbàkálẹ̀ nípasẹ̀ ẹ̀fọn.

source: Vitamin A is essential for good vision.
target: Ajíra A jẹ́ pàtàkì fún ìríran dáradára.

source: Vitamin B1 deficiency can cause beriberi.
target: Àìtó Ajíra B1 lè fa àìsàn ẹ̀ṣọ ara wíwú.

source: Vitamin B2 helps maintain healthy skin and eyes.
target: Ajíra B2 nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún awọ àti ojú tí ó tọ́.

source: Vitamin C prevents scurvy and aids in wound healing.
target: Ajíra C nṣe ìdíwọ́ àrùn ekúru àti ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìwosan egbò.

source: Vitamin D helps the body absorb calcium for strong bones.
target: Ajíra D nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ara láti gba káláṣíọ́mù fún egungun lágbára.

source: Vitamin E protects cells from damage.
target: Ajíra E ndáàbòbò àwọn hóró ara kúrò nínú ìpalára.

source: Vitamin K is needed for blood clotting.
target: Ajíra K jẹ́ pàtàkì fún dídì ẹ̀jẹ̀ ní èépá.

source: A balanced diet contains all necessary nutrients.
target: Ìjẹẹ̀mun pípé ní gbogbo àwọn oúnjẹ afara-lókun tó yẹ nínú.

source: Proteins are the building blocks of the body.
target: Òjẹ̀ ni àkọ́lé ilé ara.

source: Carbohydrates provide energy for daily activities.
target: Ẹ̀là-okun npèsè okun fún àwọn iṣẹ́ òòjọ́.

source: Fats and oils help in the absorption of fat-soluble vitamins.
target: Òṛá àti epo nṣe ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún ìgbàmú àwọn ajíra afara-lòrá.

source: Mineral salts maintain the body's electrolyte balance.
target: Iyọ̀-afáralókun nmú ìdọ́gba iná-ara dúró.

source: Harmful foods increase the risk of diseases.
target: Àwọn onjẹ eléwu nṣe àfikún ewu àìsàn.

source: Chemistry is the study of matter and energy.
target: Èḳó ̣Ẹlà jé ̣èḳó ̣àwọn èdá, agbára àti àwọn ìbáraṣepọ ̣tó wà láarín wọn.

source: A chemical reaction transforms one set of substances to another.
target: Àsè ẹlà jé ̣ìlànà bí àwọn ìjọ èdá kan ṣe nparadà sí àwọn ìjọ èdá miran.

source: The laboratory contains many chemical elements.
target: Ilé ìmọ-̣jinlẹ ̣ní ọpọ̀lọpọ̀ ìṣù-átọmù.

source: Acids and bases are important in chemistry.
target: Èḳan at'ègbo jẹ́ pàtàkì nínú Èḳó ̣Ẹlà.

source: The chemical equation shows reactants on the left side.
target: Òṃì ̣ẹlà fi àwọn èsè-àsè hàn ní apá òsì.

source: The product of the reaction is a new substance.
target: Èṣún àsè náà jẹ́ èdá tuntun.

source: Organic chemistry is the study of carbon compounds.
target: Èḳó ̣ẹlà-eléedú jẹ́ èḳó ̣àwọn àsèpọ eedu.

source: Inorganic chemistry deals with non-carbon compounds.
target: Èḳó ̣ẹlà-aláìléedú dájú pẹ̀lú àwọn àsèpọ tí kò ní eedu.

source: The atomic energy can be released during reactions.
target: Agbára átọmù lè jade lásìkò àwọn àsè.

source: Chemical synthesis is the process of creating new compounds.
target: Ìṣèdá ẹlà jé ̣ìlànà tí a mòọ́ ṃọ̀ gbà se àsè láti ní èṣún tí a nfé.̣

source: The equilibrium point is where forward and reverse reactions balance.
target: Ibi agbede ni ibi tí àwọn àsè iwájú àti ẹ̀yìn dọ́gba.

source: An exothermic reaction releases heat energy.
target: Àsè afaná túlẹ̀ agbára okun-iná.

source: An endothermic reaction absorbs heat from surroundings.
target: Àsè aloná gba okun-iná látí àyíká.

source: The chemical composition shows the ratio of atoms in molecules.
target: Ètò ohun-inú ẹlà fi ìbùpín àwọn átọmù nínú mólékù hàn.

source: The mixture contains different substances that are not chemically combined.
target: Àkópọ̀ ní àwọn èdá oníyàtọ̀ tí wọn kò ṣe àsèpọ̀ ní ọ̀nà ẹlà.

source: Alkali metals react vigorously with water.
target: Àlùrọ aṣọṣẹ ṣe àsè lórísírísí pẹ̀lú omi.

source: Non-metals usually form covalent bonds.
target: Àdàrọ máa ńṣẹ̀dá ìrón ìpínpín.

source: The reactants in this equation are hydrogen and oxygen.
target: Àwọn èsè-àsè nínú òṃì yìí ni hydrogen àti òyì-iná.

source: The products of water electrolysis are hydrogen and oxygen.
target: Àwọn èṣún-àsè ìpínṣẹ́ tó fi ojú ẹlẹ́tíríìkì omi jẹ́ hydrogen àti òyì-iná.

source: Temperature affects the rate of chemical reactions.
target: Ìgbóná ní ipa lórí òṣùwọ̀n àsè ẹlà.

source: Entropy measures the disorder in a system.
target: Ìdàrú wọ́n ìdàrúdàpọ̀ nínú ètò kan.

source: Enthalpy is the heat content of a chemical system.
target: Agbára wiwulo jẹ́ nnkan okun-iná inú ètò ẹlà.

source: A complete reaction consumes all reactants.
target: Àsè-ìsèparí lo gbogbo àwọn èsè-àsè.

source: An incomplete reaction leaves some reactants unconverted.
target: Àsè-àìsèparí fi díẹ̀ nínú àwọn èsè-àsè sílẹ̀ láìyípadà.

source: The equilibrium constant determines the ratio of products to reactants.
target: Òòkà-àìyẹ ibiagbede pinnu ìbùpín àwọn èṣún sí èsè-àsè.

source: Free energy determines whether a reaction occurs spontaneously.
target: Agbára wíwúlò pinnu bóyá àsè kan ṣẹlẹ̀ fúnrararẹ̀.

source: Chemical bonds hold atoms together in molecules.
target: Ìrón ẹlà mú àwọn átọmù jọ pọ̀ nínú mólékù.

source: A single bond consists of one pair of shared electrons.
target: Ìrón kan jẹ́ ẹyọ ìbáṣepọ̀ àwọn ẹlẹ́tíróònù.

source: A double bond involves sharing two pairs of electrons.
target: Irọn meji jẹ mọ́ pípín ẹgbẹ́ méjì àwọn ẹlẹ́tíróònù.

source: A triple bond involves sharing three pairs of electrons.
target: Ìrón meta jẹ mọ́ pípín ẹgbẹ́ mẹ́ta àwọn ẹlẹ́tíróònù.

source: The gas volume changes with temperature and pressure.
target: Àyè òyì yípadà pẹ̀lú ìgbóná àti èéfún.

source: Biochemistry studies chemical processes in living organisms.
target: Èḳó ̣ẹlà-ìyè kọ́ àwọn ìlànà ẹlà nínú àwọn ẹ̀dá alààyè.

source: Physical chemistry examines the physical properties of chemical systems.
target: Èḳó-̣ẹlà t'ìṣeṣí-èdá ̣yẹ àwọn ìṣesí ara ti àwọn ètò ẹlà wò.

source: The metal reacts with the acid to produce hydrogen gas.
target: Àlùrọ náà ṣe àsè pẹ̀lú èḳan láti mú òyì hydrogen jáde.

source: Gold is a noble metal that resists chemical reactions.
target: Wura jẹ́ àlùrọ ọlọ́lá tí ó korò sí àwọn àsè ẹlà.

source: The catalyst increases the rate of the reaction.
target: Aláàtúnmú pọ̀ òṣùwọ̀n àsè náà.

source: Chemical analysis determines the composition of substances.
target: Èḳó ̣ìṣeyanjú-ẹlà pinnu ètò-inú àwọn èdá.

source: The solvent dissolves the solute in the solution.
target: Epo tú gbẹrẹfun nínú àpòpọ̀.

source: Solid, liquid, and gas are three states of matter.
target: Adì, aṣàn, àti òyì jẹ́ irú-ipò mẹ́ta ti èdá.

source: The pressure of a gas is related to its volume.
target: Èéfún òyì kan ní ìbátan sí àyè rẹ̀.

source: Chemical bonds store energy that can be released in reactions.
target: Ìrón ẹlà tọ́jú agbára tí a lè tú sílẹ̀ nínú àwọn àsè.

source: The alloy is a mixture of two or more metals.
target: Àyópọ̀ jẹ́ àkópọ̀ àwọn àlùrọ méjì tàbí jù bẹ́ẹ̀ lọ.

source: The amalgam contains mercury mixed with other metals.
target: Àdàlú ní mercury tí a pọ̀ pẹ̀lú àwọn àlùrọ míràn.

source: The concentration of a solution affects its properties.
target: Láti sọ dògidì ti àpòpọ̀ kan ní ipa lórí àwọn ìṣesí rẹ̀.

source: Soap making involves the reaction of fats with alkali.
target: Ọṣẹ ṣíṣẹ́ ní àsè àwọn ọ̀rá pẹ̀lú aṣọṣẹ.

source: Chemical equations must be balanced to obey conservation laws.
target: Òṃì ̣ẹlà gbọ́dọ̀ wà ní ìwọ̀ntúnwọ̀nsì láti tẹle àwọn òfin ìtọ́jú.

source: The change in nature of elements follows periodic patterns.
target: Àyípadà nnú àyànmọ̀ àwọn ìṣù-átọmù tẹle àwọn àpẹẹrẹ lákòókò.

source: The chemical process requires specific conditions for optimal results.
target: Àwọn ọnà àsè-ẹlà nílò àwọn ìdí pàtó fún àwọn èsì tí ó dára jùlọ.

source: The color change indicates a chemical reaction has occurred.
target: Ìyípadà àwọ̀ fihan pé àsè ẹlà ti ṣẹlẹ̀.

source: The drug contains active chemical compounds that affect the body.
